author: {'steamid': '76561198011233147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1678924735}
review:
I really tried to NOT like this game. Because, it's not like I WANT to like every game I've spent my money on. Nah. I like to know that I've wasted time and money on something terrible. I really, really tried, but..... disappointingly I ended up LOVING it.

This game surely has a lot of stuff going for it, though not completely without flaws.

It's kind of hard to explain this completely. It is cute and funny, then suddenly turns dark and mysterious. It is emotional and thrilling and clever and artsy and puzzling and adorable and weird and lengthy and wonderfully narrated and has a totally inconclusive ending. In other words this game is the definition about it being about the journey more than about reaching a goal. Because, WOW, was that ending a punch in the stomach.

That being said, I thoroughly loved almost everything about the game until that that very last part, and there is a second part in development that hopefully brings us a conclusion to all the questions we are left with.

There are some aspects of the game that are incredible. The voice acting in this game is one of the best I've ever come across in any game. They make the story even better and really hits on the punchlines and narrations they do. Fantastic job.  There are interesting puzzles, deductions, interrogations and conversations. Several choices that can be made throughout. Secrets to be found. Enjoying and fulfilling... for the most part.....

Because, some of them feels unnecessary. Some puzzles are just there to stall you a little and take nothing but simple clicking to complete. I feel there could at least be some more ingenuity to those. Some of the choices you get changes nothing or very little to how the story progresses and seem to be there just for separate achievements. Some of the collectibles you have very limited access too, and must be found on your first try or you miss out. You can of course go back scenes you've already been to to make different choices (achievements) or to try your hand at missing collectibles again, but I simply don't like the idea of hiding stuff where you will not have access to all the time, at least in a chapter/scene. Some choices are portrayed as very important choices, but seems to not make any difference, except for a possibility that might make some changes in the next game? I don't know.

I had a great time playing this game and would easily recommend anyone who likes point & click adventures and puzzle games alike to play this gem. Just beware of a disappointing ending, and you should be set for a joyful ride.

I'd rate this game a 8 out of 10 (would have been higher if ending was better)

So, even if I enjoyed this game, we are lucky to be able to have different opinions, so if you are sitting on the fence, make sure to check out several reviews before making your decisions to get it or not.

Happy gaming :o)

TJ

author: {'steamid': '76561198137566954', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1678830802}
review: You know that feeling when you are starting to play some game expecting it to be pretty good, but it turns out to be absolutely fantastic? That is the case with Jenny LeClue: Detectivu. It is one of the better adventure games I've played, with great characters, pleasant gameplay mechanics, satisfactory puzzles, nice humor and gorgeous art direction. Highly recommend if you like adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145093114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1678754178}
review: It's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004078165', 'num_games_owned': 1525, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1678497922}
review: While this game was pretty fun... I hate to do this, but I'll have to give this one a thumbs down.  This game did a great job of being entertaining and also had a nice art style, but the ending is really what ruined it.  I ended up having even more questions and there was zero closure. And to top it off, they slap you with a big "to be continued" expecting you to buy a second game without even feeling like you've solved anything with this one. I would've been happy if they at least closed this game with most of your thoughts and loose ends being resolved, and then showing how there's still more to be solved in the sequel.  Don't make it so that everything we worked for in this game gets solved in the next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079830133', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1678243396}
review:
I'm on the fence with this one - leaning more towards positivity.

On the one hand, the game itself is really fun to play. The art style is beautifully done. The story built in a way that made you want to keep playing to see what would happen next. And I love collecting things - so the search for stickers and postcards was great!

On the other, Jenny is the worst...I really struggled to get on her side. I actually have a note that says "Now I get where Jenny gets her awful-ness...her mother is terrible". ALL OF THE LADDERS were insane...holy moly. And I can't believe it ended without a true conclusion - almost 11 hours of play with no final pay off. What a bummer.

Overall, not terrible but not the best either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994590173', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1655421442}

author: {'steamid': '76561198281300977', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1677966322}
review: This game is amazing and really good. I must praise it for what it is and what it puts on the table. Sadly the only problem is the reason I can't recommend it. Even if it is a good peaced story driven game, it has no ending! Like it was cut and wrapped up just before it could tell what was building upon! and I am more than okay with cliffhangers and open endings but this story becomes increasingly interesting the more you play (adding more and more stuff) just to end with nothing of importance really taking place. I know a sequel is in the making but its more likely  the next part of this game so... there. I really want to recommend this lovely game but it just feels incomplete as it is. I Might revise it after the next one finishes but as it stands now, everything is good until the credits roll and you can't believe they just ended it there. I know these games are hard to make but, put a "part 1" at the title, I was really going for a non episodic game when I decided to buy this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971004328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1678521021}
review:
처음에는 저연령층을 타겟으로 한 게임인 것으로 생각되었으나, 차츰 스토리나 퍼즐(그렇다고 어려운 편은 아님)이 흥미롭게 전개되어 집중하며 게임을 즐길 수 있게 되었다. 아직 끝을 보지 않았지만, 결말이 매우 궁금해 졌고, 또한 탐정 소설 작가와 주인공 제니와의  대화식(80~90년대의 영화에서 가끔 쓰던 방식) 진행이 레트로하지만,  오랫만이어서 인지 나름 신선(?)했다. 그리고 개인적으로 제니가 유치한 중2병 캐릭과 전혀 거리가 먼 시크한 직설적인 캐릭이라 매우 마음에 들었다.

포인트앤클릭 어드벤처를 사랑하는 분들께 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838145397', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1691153067}
review:
Karakterle o kadar özleşemedim ki kendimi öldürme kararı aldım. Kibar ol diyorum yine kaba cevap veriyor.

Oyun oynanış açısından ilk cinayete kadar sıkıcıydı. Sonra gerilim adım adım arttı. 
Hikaye ve gizem 9/10 --> 1 puan kırmamın nedeni bazı karakterler olay örgüsünde çok havada kaldı. Spoiler olmaması açısından bende kalsın. Bide oyun bitmedi. Devam oyunu ile hikaye şekillenecek. Bi noktada gizem yarım kaldı.
Bulmaca ve araştırma 5/10 --> zor hiçbir bulmaca yoktu. Hatta kafa çalıştımayı gerektirecek bir bulmaca da olmadı
Karakter inceleme mekaniği 7/10  --> analizler güzel ama her bulduğu ipucu için araya girip konuşması sıkıcıydı. Bence bütün ipuçlarını topladıktan sonra konuşulsa daha akıcı olabilir. Ve bizde bu sürede kendimiz olayı yorumlayabiliriz. 
Olay şemasını şekillendirme 4/10 --> Sherlock holmes oyununda da buna benzer bir mekanik vardı. Ama seçimler sonucunda olay ve sonuçlar değişiyordu. Ve karar verirken ikilemlerde çok kalıyorduk. Bunda ise öyle bir durum yok. Gözün kapalı oynarken bile doğru kararlar verebilirsin.

Sonuç: vakit geçirmek için uygun bütçeli güzel bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314221222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1549, 'last_played': 1680851960}
review: Você fica bem entretido com o jogo e consegue resolver facilmente puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561199024748253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1677581845}
review:
遊戲節奏過慢，喜歡刺激的劇情的人容易在前期就因為漫長的鋪陳而想睡。
兩個小時的劇情鋪墊真的太久了，重複的劇情不能跳過。
還有不知道為何遊戲的拼圖遊戲特別容易整個遊戲當住。無論是用手把或者鍵盤都無法改善。
對，我現在由於這個拼圖遊戲卡住而無法進行主線。
希望這BUG早日改善。

author: {'steamid': '76561199472458164', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2742, 'last_played': 1689524354}
review:
O jogo em si tem uma história boa de acompanhar, os personagens são carismático, recomendaria para quem gosta de jogos de investigação, porém com algumas ressalvas, o jogo pode demorar um pouco para começar a realmente tomar forma e por muitas vezes ser cansativo.
Obs: Eu nãoe demorei tanto assim para zerar, acabei deixando por alguns dias aberto quando fui ao trabalho, devo ter demorado cerca de 9 horas para zerar o game

author: {'steamid': '76561198014763908', 'num_games_owned': 2519, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1676925952}
review:
Just not for me, simple as that.

It plays like a kids game, the story and acting is written and told as if it was a kids game, it's incredibly hand-holdy and you're directed to do everything. If there is a puzzle there is no logic, it's just a matter of going through the 3 or 4 possible combinations until one of them is correct. If you're investigating a place you'll automatically know where the answer or clue is because if a place doesn't have a clue the investigate option is removed after the first time you check it, if there's something there it can still be investigated.

The description of the game makes it seem like something completely different, as if it's an actual investigation game with puzzles but in reality everything is more or less solved for you and you're just there to move the character along while having everything done for you and the story told to you.

As I said it plays like a kids game for young children but I don't think it's fit for a child as for a child I imagine certain parts are quite scary and the overarching theme is murder, crime and horror.
It doesn't fit for me. It's acted and written as if it's a game for young children, it plays exactly like any random kids show for young kids. Huge clash and I don't understand who the audience for that is except for a small niche amount of people, which is great for them I guess.

Maybe it gets better towards the end as some reviews say, but I'm not interested. First impression=not for me at all.

And as a disclaimer: This game does not have an ending or conclusion. This is not a spoiler, this is a disclaimer that you should know before buying. There is no sequel.

Joke of an options menu, there exists 0 excuses for bare-bones, ribbed & empty options menus.

Looking at SteamDB it looks like it's on an 80% sale quite often so if you think this game might be for you then I obviously recommend you get it on sale. $20 for a simple and mostly just purely story, almost visual novel esque ~10 hour game is quite steep.

[h1]Curator page[/h1]

[i]If you liked this review or otherwise found it helpful in deciding whether or not to buy this game, feel free to follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/29162366/]my Curator page[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198121985991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1676693590}
review:
Get ready for a bunch of “You found gallery art!” interstitials and poor-at-best gameplay. I adore the artwork, and the writing has some great moments, but you basically just wander around looking for blue dots to hover on. And there’s a handful of uninspired puzzles to fiddle with. (I wouldn’t say I actually solved most of them, so much as I just moved stuff around until it told me I was done.) The mystery is convoluted, which isn’t necessarily bad if it pays off in the end… but the solution (that is, the parts of it that were actually written) was quite unsatisfying for me. Then it suddenly shifts to “here’s a room none of the characters are in, pull one of these three numbered levers, choose wisely!” but HOW does one choose wisely with absolutely zero context?

I didn’t enjoy the experience, but I felt invested in the story so I kept playing to the end. And before the most interesting questions about the mystery were addressed, the ones that kept me playing… “To be continued!” It did NOT end with a satisfying pay off — a cardinal sin for a mystery. I suggest taking a pass on this game, I feel it looks a lot better than it actually is.  :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198105981413', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1675541522}
review: Симулятор обычных будней в Подольске. Мистика, тайны, все дела. Варианты ответов в диалогах одновременно и влияют на геймплей, и нет: проявляются разные мелкие фичи, но сюжет намертво приварен к рельсам. Нет штрафов за неправильные догадки, можно просто решать задачи методом тыка, пока не попадешь на верный вариант. Большая часть локаций интуитивно понятна, но под конец пару раз терялся. Постоянно всплывают подсказки, указывающие, какие кнопки сейчас надо использовать, что ещё и упрощает поиск интерактивных предметов. Есть различные собираемые предметы, которые дают немного информации о мире. Если брать по скидке, то игра вполне себе ничего, хотя концовка всё же вышла довольно странной. Возможно, продолжение поставило бы всё на свои места, но с 2019 года автор ничего не издавал.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203153899', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1674830766}
review:
本の中の名探偵ジェニーレクルーと、その筆者の物語

３０年も続く名作であった少女探偵の話は今では陳腐なものとして飽きられていた。
編集からの作風を壊せという指示に怒り果てた筆者は悪魔となる事を宣言する。

ストーリーの指示に従い画面内の怪しい個所を調べて証拠を集め謎解きをしていく。
正しい証拠を繋げるとジェニーは名探偵らしい推理を披露してくれる。
探偵物語らしく色々な箇所で謎解きをしていくのがなかなか面白い。

それぞれのパズル自体は簡単なものが多いけど、ステッカーとギャラリー、実績のコレクション要素がとても多いので飽きさせない作りになっていた。


会話や筆者の文のユニークさが気持ちよく、とても気持ちよく遊べるゲームだった。
ゲーム内世界で３０年愛されていた理由も分かる。
エンディングは[spoiler]選択肢によってちょっと違うがどれも続きが見たいと思わせるつくりなっている。
この世界を守りたいという筆者の思いと共にジェニーレクルーの冒険が続いてくれてたら嬉しい。

最終章の選択肢は誰を選んでもいいけれど、自分的には母親を選ぶのがその後を想像できて良かったです。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970353906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1673885304}
review:
What a charming game. The Artstyle, characters, story and locations are all oozing with charm.

It helps that everything is written in a humourous, witty style. Especially the back and forth between Jenny and the Narator (among other characters) are a real treat in how the dialogue unpacks. Also the mysteries in this game are actual engaging mysteries. They did their job in that they make the player want to uncover them.

Looking around and exploring the in-game town of Arthurton is always rewarded. The detective element is fleshed out enough to be called engaging, though CSI this is not. The actual puzzling is mostly quite light, with the exception of a few that require some more thought. But this game is never boring, I don't feel it was in need of puzzles that crack your skull. 

I really hope the developer continues this story, while there are points to improve upon in a potential part II, this is a very solid recommendation for anyone looking for a Charming, Funny and Witty Detective story.

author: {'steamid': '76561199017989676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1710612087}
review:
tho this game never got the greatest attention it has some of the best graphics/art I've ever. If you stop playing the game in any section the whole thing looks like an art peace, and the writing is amazing and funny i caught a few chuckles there and there. and the voice acting for every character there are with i think 18 voice actors. but during through the game there are little mini-games for lock picking, hot wiring, and puzzle solving. but what really got my attention was that your choices get counted and tells you what type of person you are, from protector, to politician, and even more.
 For 20$ it's worth the 4 chapters, plus the collectables from stickers which you can customize your own journal with, to gallery photos of concept art from the making of the game and there is alot of concept art.
So if this interests you, you should buy the game, which a second game is being made following this one, so it will really help fund it.

My only request is that they make plushies of jenny leclue, i would buy that on the spot. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198358098222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1673795681}
review:
I've just finished playing this game, and OMG, what an amazing game is was! *Clapping hands*
I almost passed by this title because the steam page is not updated and it doesn't say that it's voice acted. It is voice acted now, and the cast made an incredible job here!
I bought it on a sale, and I'm astonished with the quality of this game: the story, the gameplay, the visual concept, everything! It become one of my favorites on my list, and I sincerely hope this developer continues to bring us more.
Everything is so enjoyable and accesible in this game, things are not over complicated, you can even choose to have time limited (and make it more chalenging) or not. It's well translated, and in a variety of languages.
THis is one of those hidden gems that I cannot recommend enough!
Go play it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561199106273933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1679159322}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025470814', 'num_games_owned': 1064, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1672694722}
review:
Zamiast długaśnej recenzji wystarczyłoby w sumie jedno słowo: urocza. Urocza jest oprawa graficzna, uroczy są bohaterowie, którym aktorzy uroczo podkładają głos, uroczy jest nawet sposób, w jaki narrator przekomarza się z bohaterką (mam słabość do tego tego typu zabiegów). Mniej urocze jest za to ciągłe bieganie po ogromnych, monotonnych tunelach, do którego w pewnym momencie zmuszają nas autorzy, przez co gra zaczyna się nieco dłużyć w środku. Nie pomaga też powtarzalność rozwiązań mechanicznych. No bo ile można łamać deski, które blokują nam drogę? Albo dekodować ukrytą wiadomość? 

Ponarzekałem, ale jak ktoś chce się zrelaksować i bezstresowo spędzić dwa-trzy wieczory, to warto dać Jenny szansę.  

PLUSY:
+ kapitalny dubbing
+ śliczna oprawa graficzna
+ sympatyczni bohaterowie
+ interakcje narratora/autora z Jenny

MINUSY:
- dłużyzny w środku
- otwarte zakończenie
- lekka powtarzalność mechanik

author: {'steamid': '76561197967101822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1332, 'last_played': 1706049785}
review:
Jenny LeClue was pleasantly entertaining. Filled with action, voice actors, engrossing story line, choices and morals, superb graphics and puzzles. All the puzzles were potentially difficult, but relatively simple if one looks for "LeClues". Well worth the price for the time it gives back in solid entertainment. However, that ending...

With that said, I did find some rough edges.
1. The tree in the graveyard didn't perform as expected. I was wandering around all over looking for a clue indicating what must be done, but unless you come to a "stop" in the just right area within the graveyard it won't do anything. If you just breeze on through without stopping nothing will happen. Then it must be repeated in the same manner to complete the action.

2. At one point I got stuck between the edge I just climbed up on and a barrel that was left too close to the edge. I had to quit the game and go back in, which put me back to the previous save point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190976103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1672662013}
review: Доволі нудна гра з примітивним геймплеєм, зовсім не таке як в описі, нажаль не можу вже зробити рефанд

author: {'steamid': '76561198360760635', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1672595812}
review:
解谜按照收集线索-拼贴线索-进行推理顺序进行，收集线索阶段，不靠把线索设计的非常隐蔽来提升谜题难度。拼贴线索阶段，逻辑严密。可以说在玩过的推理游戏中首屈一指了。（这里就不拉踩了）

再加上生动的性格设计、漫画风的游戏美术，总体上是打折时非常值得入的一款游戏。
剧情上，有点像小时候看过的冒险小虎队。不过游戏用一种非常有趣的方法自己先吐槽了自己。总之，剧情上还蛮有趣的哈哈哈。

author: {'steamid': '76561199215834247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1672263640}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. but.....Game play did not match the game description, game is describes as "game focused on exploration, story, and character, featuring dozens of characters to meet, mysteries and puzzles to solve". I played a little over an hour of the game and the game holds your hand telling you where to click and solves everything for you. There was no independent action on the players part in solving anything other than moving the mouse around until something lights up.
It sounded like the story would be interesting but I just couldn't get over how the game mechanics were working, so not a game for anyone who wants to feel like an actual detective finding the clues or solving the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866003493', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1672238696}
review:
Замечательная игра для детей от 8 до 12 лет. Если вы старше этого возраста, то вероятно, что удовольствие от игры вы не получите. Игра с юмором, красочная с интересным таинственным сюжетом в стиле секретных материалов и детективом об убийстве. Головоломки не сложные. Мы играли с дочерью 9 лет: она играла, а я читал в слух диалоги. Играли мы на большом телевизоре с геймпада по СтимЛинк. Впечатления от игры и совместного времяпрепровождения получили по максимуму. Так, что да Я рекомендую данную игру. Даже с учетом незаконченности всей сюжетной линии. Такая уж задумка авторов.
10 из 10 людей в черном.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142054178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1671827198}
review:
Pros:
- cute & often very detailed graphics!
- engaging story, dialogue/banter, framing device!
- full voice acting
- variety of locations
- decent game length
- I liked the puzzles but I can imagine others might find them too easy (I think the intended audience is middle/high school?). 
- choosiness gets recorded in journal
- vibes


Cons:
- WASD controls - why not point-n-click??
- standard walking speed is too slow
- choosiness doesn't actually mean anything (I would have liked to have seen other players' choosiness statistics, like Telltale used to have)
- the sound when Jenny almost walks off a ledge gets on my nerves
- Keith needs more screentime for us to form a bond with him, poor kid
- abrupt cliffhanger ending

author: {'steamid': '76561198035599199', 'num_games_owned': 1983, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1670192838}
review:
Absolutely appalling ending.  Let's get that out of the way straight away.  Although I'm still recommending this game, if you can't handle the game coming to a handbrake stop after about 9 hours, with a huge number of questions unanswered, consider this fair warning and steer well away from this game.

With that aside, the journey you take is a very good one.  Well written characters and dialogue, backed up with great voice acting, really propel you along on this excellent adventure.  There are some amounts of padding towards the end, and there's never really much friction from holding you back on this extremely linear game, but this doesn't hold the gameplay back from really shining.  The artwork is also excellent, and there's enough variation in the moment to moment action to keep you engaged throughout.

So, terrible ending aside, there's a lot to like here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086677539', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1668367191}
review:
[h1] Душный детектив для самых маленьких [/h1]

[spoiler] Дженни ЛеКлю была мертва [/spoiler] 
когда я проходил игру в первый раз. Никакой озвучки. Только стикеры и открытки. Выбор без выбора а ля TellTale Games, вполне неплохая затравка для сюжета прикольная музыка и красивая графика. Что ещё надо? Ну не знаю наверное смысла добавлять все что добавили после. Начнём по порядку.

[h1] Графон [/h1]
То что именно меня сначала и подкупило при покупке этой игры. Работа со светом, цветом и постеры у игры шикарные а вот внешка персонажей игры лично мне кажется странной ибо иной раз смотря на свою героиню я думал что ее родители на самом деле Финеас и Ферб которые по очереди переспали со Стражем Руин из Дарк Соулс иначе я не могу сказать почему голова это прямоугольник а ходит она на зубочистках. Но таков стиль, надеюсь ко второй части слегка изменится.

[h1] Звук [/h1]
Неплоха но иной раз может надоесть. 
Сам звук в игре нормальный а озвучка выше всяких похвал. Идеально подошла к игре и сделала ее только лучше и если раньше приходилось читать бесконечные монологи писателя ещё быстрее бы трахнули мои глаза но увы она на английском хотя и не трудном понять что говорят и в какой момент переводчик облажался крайне легко при условии если вы знаете инглиш.

[h1] Геймплей [/h1]
А вот здесь и начинаются первые проблемы игры. Как несложно понять это детективный квест с элементами выборами. Ну и конечно сбором всякого барахла которое реально душит но об этом чуть позже.
Вся наша игра это поход по средним или малым локам набитыми всякими коллекционками, загадками и осмотром всяких улик. Локации красивые? Да. Загадки сложные? Нет. Коллекционки душат? ЕЩЁ КАК. 
Всё что нужно делать по большей части это бродить по локе и желательно залезть в каждую жопу и обнюхать каждый миллиметр дабы заметить сраную лупу и осмотреть невидимую хрень которая по факту ничего вам не принесет кроме ачивок и головной боли. 
В игре их три вида: Открытки (паззлы которые вы будете собирать когда найдёте их все), стикеры которые вы можете лепить себе в журнал который вы можете в теории и вообще ни разу не открыть, ну и арт из галереи который открывает вам картинку из артбука. Ничего кроме открыток интереса не представляет и по факту в тупую тратит ваше время и особенно чёртова галерея которая вообще нахрен не нужна.
[spoiler] А вот открытки их частицы лежат рядом с секретными зонами и если в этой зоне открыть меню вы увидите код а при сборе открытки на задней ее стороне будет шифр который вы можете разгадать сами но игра настолько не популярна что только англоязычные игроки что-то и пишут в обсуждениях стима. Короче свой локальный Гравити Фолз. [/spoiler]
Загадки в самой игре унылые а порой максимально душные и чаще всего повторяются раз этак до трёх. [spoiler] Ангелы. Канализация. И дрочка глаз с радио.[/spoiler]. Решать их нетрудно но скучно настолько что чтение секс черепах более интересный процесс.

Ну а дальше спойлеры поэтому имейте ввиду.
[h1] Сюжет [/h1]
Повествование ведётся от автора серий книг про Дженни. Который по факту пишет детские детективы где Дженни по большей части ищёт кто украл банку с вареньем или забыл использованный презерватив у матери школьной тпшки что вечно троллит гг за квадратность вагины её матери. Однако всё равно все счастливы. 
Но поскольку всех уже задолбал такой сюжет Писака начинает писать. Однако он всё равно обоссался. Сюжет книг из детской фигни превратился в подростковую фигню. Главная Героиня в принципе неплоха если вы уже раз сто видели таких что они уже вас не бесят а просто побоку. Большая часть второстепенных персонажей вторичны или не интересны. Хотя и имеют некоторые отклонения чтобы уже совсем не забыться игроку. [b]Однако [/b]. Общий сюжет здесь интересный и по правде говоря клёвый. Вся эта фигня с городом. Сферы Зазера. Шахты и другие события произошедшие на заднем плане игры очень необычные и крайне интригуют, да настолько что, даже немного слитая концовка даёт нам классный клифф на будущую игру. 

[h1] Итог [/h1]
[b] Игра я бы сказал на 250 рублей из 500 [/b]. Брать строго по скидке. Платина у игры душная, но я ее выбил ибо было скучно.   Сюжет интересный. Загадки днище. Однако это первая игра данных разработчиков и я поверю что следующая часть будет лучше. Жду вторую часть хоть у меня и есть сомнения насчёт её выхода ибо анонсировали ее вроде как дважды. Собирали средства на кикстартере однако бонусы за покупку игры и покупку артбуков крайне долго отсылались если следить за твиттером и инстой игры.(Около полутора года но может и больше). Засим всё. Приятной игры.
З.Ы.
Шифр для не ленивых. [spoiler]РЕНЕЖИВ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074515521', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1667518745}
review:
Die Story hat einen guten Leitfaden, doch leider wird man zum Schluss total vom Ende enttäuscht. Ein unkreatives und geschmackloses "Fortsetzung folgt" ... nachdem ich 16 Stunden im Spiel war. Kann das Spiel daher leider nicht weiterempfehlen, da die Geschichte offensichtlich hier enden sollte und nicht der eigenen Fantasie überlassen werden sollte, wenn Jenny doch so Logisch, Rational und Realistisch schlussfolgert! Die Entscheidungen im Spiel haben dadurch null Sinn und machen keinen Unterschied. Wenn es schon mehrere Entscheidungswege gibt, sollten sie auch einen Sinn haben und jeweils etwas anderes auslösen und ein eigenes Ende haben. Ich hatte am Ende noch viele offene Fragen unbeantwortet und wenn der Autor so auf Happy Ends steht, hätte man auch eins machen sollen und nicht gezwungener maßen jemanden sterben lassen und ein offenes Ende lassen. 
"Fortsetzung folgt" würde nur passen wenn die  Geschichte wirklich noch potenzial hätte für einen zweiten Teil, was sie aber nicht hat. Ich bin grad sauer und enttäuscht...

author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 1311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1311, 'last_played': 1660440313}
review:
[h1]Jenny Leclue episode 1[/h1]

Jenny LeClue is a cute adventure game but is it worth playing?
The game starts very cheerfully and from the start it seems like a very pleasant adventure. And honestly it is.

You play as Jenny – a young girl who wants to be a detective. In the beginning you may think the story will be all children's adventure but eventually it evolves into more serious story with twists.
There's also lots of humor which is not bad all and will make you laugh several times at least.

Gameplay is simple. You solve puzzles and explore the surroundings while interacting with other characters from time to time.

Lets start with the puzzles. Often you'll need to examine the area or a person, like their clothes, various objects and then do a deduction. That isn't hard at all and is rather fun connecting the dots.
You also get some traditional puzzles and while they are good and fun, they repeat several times through the game. Same exact puzzles all over again which is disappointing.
Interacting with other characters progresses the story. You also have some choices to make which leads to different responses from the characters. It doesn't change the ending or anything, mostly choices are tied to achievements.
Other than that you'll be running back and forth in a side scrolling manner. It's fun, you'll need to climb, pull/push things, etc.

But there's one huge downside. This game should be called “episode one” or something like that. The game ends with a huge cliffhanger and you as a player feel betrayed. And it's not your usual cliffhanger seen in movies where after beating the bad guys everyone is happy and you see some baddie appearing again at the very end. No, the cliffhanger feels like the game ends in the middle of the story. That's not right.

Graphically it's a beautiful game. Both the surroundings and characters are nicely drawn. Great variety in locations and nice animations. The game just looks cute, even in the darkest moments.

Sound design is great. Full voice acting with wonderful voices of every single character. Jenny sounds exceptionally well. The voice actors did a great job.
Soundtrack isn't a masterpiece but it's good and accompanies the overall atmosphere of the game very well.

Overall a very good adventure game with extremely disappointing ending. Buy this on sale since you're not getting the full story. Other than that it's worth it for every adventure fan.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Great story
[*]Wonderful characters
[*]Looks good
[*]Sounds good
[*]Fun and diverse gameplay
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]It's only episode 1
[*]Puzzles repeating themselves
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198296474483', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1665946933}
review:
Einfaches Mystery Adventure für alle die kein Bock haben Lösungen extern zu suchen und somit alles aus eigener Hand lösen können (ohne Kopfschmerzen und genervt sein von der Unlogik der Rätsel:). 
Jenny ist ein unterhaltsames Spiel, welches mit hübscher Grafik, hervorragender Voice-Vertonung und einer interessanten Story punkten kann. Leider haben sich die Entwickler beim Ende herzlich wenig engagiert und deshalb fällt die ganze Story am Ende flach wie ein Plunder zu Boden. Auf gut Deutsch, man hat das Finale komplett versemmelt. Sehr schade. 
Hatte persönlich aber Fun. Empfehle es wegen dem schlechten Ende nur mit 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165191487', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1664208667}
review: Such an awesome murder mystery game. I'm hoping the narrative will go on in the future. The soundtrack is moody, the art is amazing, and the voice acting is so good. It's absolutely worth playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1665783619}
review:
In questo gioco non impersoniamo la ragazzina detective Jenny, ma bensì il suo creatore ossia un uomo sulla sessantina con un cane di nome rufus. Lui è uno scrittore specializzato in libri per ragazzi, solo che la sua serie che all'inizio gli ha portato fortuna, ossia: Jenny la detective, non vende così tanto rispetto agli inizi e con l'editore che spinge a voler una storia più macabra con magari qualche omicidio, il povero scrittore, decide di creare la storia più macabra che abbia mai creato. Perciò, tutto inizia con l'omicidio della protagonista. Questo è solo il primo dei vari casi che la protagonista e così il giocatore, dovrà affrontare. Raccogliendo prove e facendo deduzioni adatte a una novella sherlock holmes. Il gioco è un'avventura in cui voi impersonate Jenny che dovrà affrontare l'avventura più grande della sua vita, piena di decisioni che lei e il giocatore dovrà fare, per andare avanti la storia, ogni tanto lo scrittore si intrometterà consigliandole delle azioni  più "pacifiste" cosa che a Jenny non sempre farà piacere seguire. Ma dipenderà anche dalla scelta del giocatore se seguire o meno i consigli dello scrittore. Quindi, partiremo per un'avventura che pian piano si dipanerà di fronte ai nostri occhi con anche i pensieri dello scrittore in cui a volte non sà come far proseguire la storia, quindi, lo vedremo dubbioso sul da farsi. Il gioco è un'avventura in cui ci sono pochi oggetti da usare, nella maggior parte di casi controlleremo la ragazzina in un ambiente 2d a scorrimento laterale, con qualche divergenza salendo le scale o su un oggetto. Le uniche cose che si raccolgono, sono i collezionabili sparsi nelle varie schermate del gioco. Lo stesso non è piccolo, la longevità si assesta sulle 8-9 ore e tranquilli, gli enigmi non sono per nulla difficili anche se a volte sono ripetuti. Dovete solo dedurre la verità, dalle prove che i vari casi vi metteranno di fronte. Tranquilli se fate deduzioni errate, potete sempre riprovarci finchè non lo indovinate. ^_^ Personalmente, lo consiglio. I suoi punti di forza sono: Un'ottima longevità, le musiche adatte all'atmosfera e anche la storia non è niente male, per non parlare che tutto è sottotitolato in italiano. Cosa un pò rara per un indie. L'unico difetto che potrebbe avere è che ahimè non finisce. ^^; Per il resto, se volete un'avventura giocabile con il joypad e con molte scelte, questo è gioco fa per voi. ^_^

P.s: Grazie alla modalità partita + potete rigiocare l'intera storia tenendo con voi tutti i collezionabili raccolti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322532762', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1647355298}

author: {'steamid': '76561198301134674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 2291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1665500990}
review: Теперь, когда разобралась с ачивками, могу наконец-то написать отзыв об игре. Мне определенно есть, что сказать! Это безумно стильная и качественная картинка, приятная анимация, доставляющее взаимодействие с предметами, забавный сюжет, симпатичные персонажи и местами очень, ну очень челленджевые ачивки. Приготовьтесь стереть в пыль кнопку взаимодействия. А также немного поработать мозгами и глазами в поисках разных коллектиблс. Играйте в хеллоуинскую версию, потому как в нем гг не выглядит нелепо, наоборот, очень круто. Села на попу ровно ждать продолжения.

author: {'steamid': '76561199094988981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3797, 'last_played': 1707171672}
review:
CONTÉM SPOILER DO JOGO!
O jogo é visualmente bonito e muito agradável, em minha experiência não ocorreu problemas(como bugs, etc), porém senti uma pequena falta de pequenos detalhes na história que PARA MIM fariam diferenças exorbitantes. Principalmente a parte do cemitério(antes dos portões de madeira), achei ela rasa, no quesito da gameplay e não fui completamente entretida, mas esta é uma opinião e não algo a se melhorar.
Resumo da ópera, é um ótimo jogo com ótimos "enigmas" e uma boa história. Porém as vezes(poucas) repetitiva, como na parte do Laboratório do Dr. Zazer, sinto que ela foi repetida muitas vezes desnecessariamente, porém sei que era pela narração da história do pai de Jenny, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096742804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1599621688}
review:
Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is the story of a young girl whose passion for crime solving and love for her mother take her on an incredible journey. The game's quirky sense of humor make it a joy to see Jenny's hunger for adventure and mystery and to see her mature as a person. The interface for discovering clues and analyzing the relationships between those clues is nice and simple. The art style makes for a world that is colorful, vibrant, and atmospheric. A fun set of characters and voice acting improve the game even further.

One of the main criticism of this game (from others) is in its ending. It ends somewhat abruptly on a cliffhanger, seemingly (hopefully?) to set up for a sequel. I do not think this warrants a negative review, but I can understand how it might frustrate a player.

Jenny can come off as something of a... snarky, rude, know-it-all. It's the kind of personality that walks a fine line between being charming and irritating. But I like to think there are other characters who challenge her and are having a positive influence.

Gameplay/puzzle mechanics are pretty basic but this doesn't seem unusual of the genre so I'm not even inclined to include it as a mark against.

All in all, get the game and pray for the sequel <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198132719952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1665408553}
review: A arte do game é simplesmente incrível, essa estética de livro infantil é cativante. Sua história e personagens são maravilhosos. Temos aqui uma aventura leve e divertia que irá proporcionar uma boas horas de diversão.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998332408', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1657847595}
review: Backed this game on Kickstarter but then I only played it on Apple Arcade when it came out.  The addition of Voice Acting made an already fun, fantastic game even better.  Also the New Game+ is great to get all the achievements and collectibles.  My only real complaint is that the cliffhanger ending is killing me and I can't wait for the sequel!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983709435', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1661816404}
review:
This game was such a big surprise to me. I expected a short chield-friendly adventure game. What I got instead was almost 11 hours of a really intricate mystery story, excellent voice acting and interesting puzzles. You are a kid and you solve cases/murders, ask questions to suspects, investigate crime scenes...and run from the police. What's interesting is that Jenny LeClue manages to stay very positive and it makes me as the player feel very happy, despite the topics of the game.

You can see that the developers put a lot of work and dedication into this game, it feels very polished and for a game like this, it looks beautiful, has great music and it's also quite lenghty.

There are also meaningful choices you can do that shape your personality type, tons of collectables to find and excellent voice acting.

I hope there will be a sequel to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198843197902', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2678, 'last_played': 1649377536}
review:
Amo esse jogo, amei as horas de jogo e já zerei mais de uma vez! Estou ansioso pra continuação! Recomendo!
Os puzzles não são tão difíceis quando você é atento, a história e desenvolvimento é muito legal, cada escolha pode ter consequências diferentes. Recomendo de verdade.

author: {'steamid': '76561199028614749', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1661257448}
review:
剧情引人入胜。非常喜欢小说作家和笔下人物双线叙事、相互推动故事线的设定。本以为不过是个一成不变的平和小镇，但随着探索深入陡然升高的科幻浓度，让人不自觉地期待起后续发展。

不知是不是为照顾各年龄段的玩家，解谜完全是宝宝难度。谜题带有区域特点，以外并没有太多巧思，破案还不如往本上贴贴画有趣（划掉）。
作为含推理要素的游戏，如果不是有伏笔或玩梗，同类谜题反复出现多少有些降好感。主角很多时候有在替玩家吐槽，比如“普通的门过时了吗”等等，微小地弥补了一点点解谜的单调感。

Deja Vu作为稀有成就很有吸引力，但各区域间的道路偏长以及潜行攀爬时不能加速，无形中拖慢了游戏节奏，让我个人很难燃起二周目的热情。
点赞一周目通关后切得碎碎的章节选项，能高效回收选项分支类的成就，也让我这种无心二周目一心只想凭瞎选来捡乐的玩家了解到终章复盘中证物选择不同，会让小侦探分析出的内容不尽相同。

虽然槽点颇多，但冲着这剧情以及我[spoiler]认为“死亡”是回到另一个世界的方式[/spoiler]干脆利落、毫不犹疑地选择弄死主角，希望续作已经在路上了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199203367527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1689884290}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062605121', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1661120783}

author: {'steamid': '76561198237673034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1661015025}
review:
殺人の冤罪で捕まった家族の疑いを晴らすべく真犯人を探す謎解きありのアドベンチャーゲーム。
謎解きの難易度は易しめ。
一部翻訳がおかしいですが、ほぼ問題なく日本語訳されている。
収集アイテムもあり探索に飽きない。（ちょっと多すぎる気もしますが）

他の人のレビューでもありますが、ストーリーは殺人事件の真相がわかり裏で起きていたのは…といったところで突然終了する。
一応2022/6/3に続編が開発中とアナウンスがあったのでストーリーが完結することを期待。

・良かった点
（英語ですが）フルボイス
主人公の成長（選択肢次第ですが）

・悪かった点
上り下りが必要な（特に意味がない）障害物
アクションが全体的に遅く感じる
実績解除のためにいくつかチャプターをやり直したが手間がかかる。（早送り・スキップみたいな機能が欲しい）

・気になったところ
実績「[spoiler]Key To The City[/spoiler] 」の解除方法がわからなかった。
（ストーリクリア時点で解除されず）
[spoiler]一番早く解錠できるチャプター31[/spoiler]を繰り返していたら実績解除できたので[spoiler]解錠回数[/spoiler]が関係している？ 

最後の選択肢。何も違いがない？

author: {'steamid': '76561198859202696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1655632677}
review:
I absolutely looove this game.
The art and the game direction are just amazing.
The gameplay, the story, the characters are really good also.
And yes, there is a cliffhanger on the end of the game, wich is not bad at all, lots of game had cliffhangers before (.dot\\Hack, Final Fantasy when you had numerous CDs for each FF tittle, Chrno Cross...).
There are some bugs and inconsistences like you would expect on any game, Jenny LeClue even beats some AAA games in the quality aspect.
Looking forward for the next entry in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041016547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3372, 'last_played': 1658710140}
review:
Sweet, well polished game. Amazing story-telling. It's just fun to play.
It's not a hard game, and has a lovely system for deduction process, which makes you feel quite clever at times :)
The only downside is occasional backtracking, especially when you get stuck on a puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027180015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 5259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5177, 'last_played': 1690716437}
review: Whimsical and wonderful from start to finish. Absolutely gorgeous art and cute, quirky characters with growth and depth transverse the world of Arthurton. With deductive puzzles, locking picking, and cyphers that are clever and allow you to solve the meta mysteries right along with Jenny LeClue and write Jenny's story right along with Arthur K Finklestein, it truly immerses you in both narratives. I love this game almost as much as Jenny and I both love coffee. Happily awaiting part 2! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198982878881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1658135861}
review: 画面挺好，流程实属折磨人，前两个小时感觉还挺好，后面越玩越无聊，没有必要的解密在那里重复一遍又一遍一遍又一遍，到最后完全让人失去耐心除了通关什么都不在乎了。我上一个梯子花了差不多二十秒，先是剧情一遍，然后解密一遍，然后跟我说不行我tm还要再来第三遍，这种琐碎没用恶心人的设计就在游戏里重复出现，玩到最后一肚子火。为了你那个没用的贴纸还得到处乱跑，主角的速度还死慢，外加电脑按键设置恶心人，玩个游戏我需要aswd加上下左右加enter加shift加jmx。这游戏就是来折磨人的，恨谁就买一份给他让他全成就吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198996666913', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1658131116}

author: {'steamid': '76561199196657185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1657686633}
review: Loved it so much! It made me love solving puzzles again. The story was engaging and compelling. It ended on a cliff hanger unfortunately but the overall mystery was solved. I am dying to know the next release!

review:
Increíble, incluso esa palabra se queda corta para describir este juego, Jenny LeClue-Detectivu tiene una historia que de verdad te engancha para continuar observando hacia donde ira nuestra joven detective para averiguar el gran misterio que parece rodear su pueblo, la actuación de voz es sublime, arte encantador y adorable, quisiera que este juego fuera una comida gourmet ya que seria extremadamente exquisito. 
Lo único que me lastima de este juego es que nos deja pidiendo mas

review: Amazing game. I bought it just because 'yay mystery' but DANG it got intense, it got really dramatic, and my favorite part was the 'twist' about the town did NOT disappoint in fact it was an element of mystery/science games I really enjoy. Recommended? Absolutely!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068346261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1656732682}
review:
I had no idea this game didn't have an ending, and I think people should know this before buying. What is this going to be like an episodic thing? That abrubt "To be continued" ending just felt like I had wasted all this time playing an unfinished game. At first I thought I did something wrong with my choices and got a bad ending, but nope, I googled it and this is how it always ends.
Other things I didn't like about this game was the repeating puzzles over and over, it got really boring after a while. And why can't we use a mouse? It was super annoying WASDing around on the screen when searching for clues, and having to mash the enter button rather than clicking with a mouse, like why?..
It's a cute game though, more suited for kids I'd say. Good voice acting and good story, except you won't know how it ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275963211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2271, 'last_played': 1656131162}
review: Two words, underrated gem. The story kept me hooked and I felt like a little kid again, flipping the pages of a detective novel anxiously to reveal the true mystery and satisfyingly see the pieces come together. I felt like I was THAT detective and it was an incredible experience, it's what those "choose your own adventure" novels are attempting to achieve. I never felt babied because some of the puzzles were quite tricky and I came close to looking at a walkthrough at one point, but I eventually got it and it made me feel very smart, like a true detective! The art is gorgeous and adds so much to the experience. The music can be so good and add to the intensity. I recommend this game a million times over, the story completely overdelivered from what I assumed was your run of the mill "who-dunnit" murder mystery!

author: {'steamid': '76561198990784417', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1654515972}
review:
[h1] Die Nachwuchsdetektivin Jenny LeClue [/h1]

[b] Geschichte: [/b] 
Der Autor Arthur K. Finkelstein schreibt seit 30 Jahren Romane über die Junior-Detektivin Jenny LeClue. Immer nach derselben bewährten Formel. Es sind die sympathischen Geschichten über eine Kinderdetektivin für die Zielgruppe Kinder und Jugendliche. Gewaltfreie und familienfreundliche Detektivgeschichten an denen sich Jung und Alt gleichermaßen erfreuen können. 

Das Problem ist, die Verkaufszahlen sind rückläufig. Der Verlag sieht dringenden Handlungs- und Änderungsbedarf. Die Geschichten von Finkelstein werden als langweilig und vorhersehbar eingestuft. Darum bekommt Arthur vom Verlag die strikte Vorgabe, dass in dem nächsten “Jenny LeClue  Buch” zwingend ein Mord geschehen soll. 

Als Spieler sehen wir immer wieder den Autor Arthur K. Finkelstein, der an dem neuen Jenny LeClue Roman arbeitet. Wir begleiten ihn bei dem Entstehungsprozess seines neusten Werkes. Der Autor selbst fungiert zwischen den Kapiteln, die wir mit Jenny LeClue spielen, als Erzähler. 

Jenny LeClue lebt in dem idyllische Örtchen Arthurton. Die Idylle findet ein jähes Ende, als ihre Mutter des Mordes verdächtigt wird. Jenny muss die Wahrheit herausfinden und ihrer Mutter helfen. Dabei deckt sie auch mysteriöse Hintergründe rund um das Städtchen Arthurton und den Tod ihres Vaters auf.   

Die Geschichte spricht den Spieler auf mehreren Ebenen an. Neben der Rahmenhandlung geht es ums Erwachsenwerden und die Bedeutung von Freundschaft und Familie. Durch Entscheidungen des Spielers kann die Geschichte beeinflusst werden. Welche Tragweite und Auswirkung diese Entscheidungen haben, kann ich nicht zweifelsfrei einschätzen. Ich vermute, dass der grundlegende Verlauf der Geschichte immer in dieselbe Richtung geht.  

[b] Grafik und Ton: [/b]       
Das Spiel kommt in einem farbenfrohen Comic-Look daher. Wir bewegen uns wie in einem Sidescroller nach links oder rechts, oder klettern auch schon mal nach oben oder unten. Ab und an wird in eine Szenerie auch mal näher hereingezoomt oder auch die Kamera mal weit rausgezoomt um mehr Überblick zu liefern. Manchmal wird eine Art Detailansicht angeboten, wenn man z.B. Dokumente oder Maschinen näher in Augenschein nimmt. Mir gefiel dieser Comic-Stil ganz gut. 

Eine professionelle Sprachausgabe gibt es in Englisch und dazu werden deutsche Untertitel angeboten. Eine deutsche Sprachausgabe gibt es nicht. Heutzutage eine lobens- und nennenswerte Besonderheit, wenn Adventure-Spiele eine deutsche Sprachausgabe vorweisen können. Die Musik ist eine solide Untermalung, wurde mir persönlich aber irgendwann etwas zu eintönig.  

[b] Spielmechanik und Rätsel: [/b] 
Von der Spielmechanik her handelt es sich nicht um ein klassisches Point & Click Adventure. Die Steuerung wurde offensichtlich gezielt für Controller konzipiert, damit es auf Konsolen ebenso gespielt und gesteuert werden kann wie am PC. Ich bin kein Konsolen- und Controller-Fan und habe mich mit der Tastatursteuerung arrangieren müssen. Der Controller wäre hier wohl die richtige Wahl und für Controller-affine Spieler wohl ohnehin die erste und bevorzugte Wahl.        

Das Rätseldesigne hat auch nicht wirklich viel mit einem klassischen Point & Click Adventure gemeinsam. Allerdings ist es, trotz sich immer wieder wiederholender Elemente, unterhaltsam. Ich habe mich immer ausreichend gefordert, aber nie lange überfordert gefühlt, so dass Frustration hätte aufkeimen können. Daher muss ich dem Spiel ein durchaus gelungenes Rätseldesigne attestieren, was den Spieler ganz gut bei Laune hält.  

[b] Umfang und Cliffhanger: [/b]  
Mit meinen ca. 16 Stunden Spielzeit hat das Spiel einen ganz ordentlichen Umfang. Allerdings endet das Spiel mit einem Cliffhanger und löst nicht alle Fragen und offene (Neben-)Handlungsstränge auf. Allein aus diesem Grund wäre eine Fortsetzung schon wünschenswert. 

[b] Fazit: [/b] 
Ein familienfreundliches Abenteuer, welches erzählerisch und visuell vieles richtig und gut macht. Für alle die am liebsten mit Controller spielen und bei einem Adventure auch schon mal gerne Geschicklichkeitselemente eines Plattformers mögen, die werden mit diesem Spiel ihre Freude haben.  

[b] Bewertung: [/b] 82 %

author: {'steamid': '76561197985497697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1654034590}
review:
What a fantastic experience!
Story, visuals, ambience and gameplay go so well together that I couldn't help myself but binge it in a single, continuous 12h session.

You get great storytelling, a very well-working 2D/3D mix and tons of mystery/detective plot points that are mostly resolved at the end. Gameplay wise it's a neatly mixed combination of locomoting, finding a series of clues in close up shots and deduction puzzles. Kind of like what you'd get when reinterpreting a Detective Conan episode as a video game: action, story, thinking and planning but with right amount of presentation, "juice" and lots of over-the-top revelation moments. All wrapped and varied so neatly that I can only remember maybe two points in the game that felt a little stretched.

There's one thing that I had a beef with, however: the ending is a cliffhanger. Did really annoy me at first (did not see the developer's note on its steam page) but considering that all the main mysteries are solved or atleast identified... I shouldn't complain to be honest. So many games mess things up by not solving even a SINGLE mystery they put you up with and terminating any hope for resolution (Thimbleweed Park for example). But here the bulk of it is actually solved, leaving you with a second layer of mysteries and a few plot points that came in towards the last quarter of the game. Not tidy, no, but a perfectly acceptable setup for a sequel.

Anyway, aside from my initial reaction to the ending, I had an absolute blast playing it! It is a splendidly well crafted game that I thoroughly enjoyed and can safely recommend it to everybody who enjoys mystery solving, character development and a bit of legwork while doing so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198946259505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1653511346}
review:
I can recommend this game, but with some caveats:

Pros:
- One of the few point-and-click games I have found that doesn't have a section that locks you out unless you can complete a puzzle requiring dexterity. For some disabled people, that's kicking us out of the game unless we can find someone to play that section for us, which is extremely frustrating. 
- Lack of dexterity will also not kill you. You can't die by falling off something or not completing a puzzle fast enough. Again, this is great for some disabled players, or for those who like to be able to chill a bit while playing.
- Every time a "special action" is required (e.g., climbing, jumping) the command prompts are shown. This is a major bonus for people with memory problems.
- Genuinely interesting story, spooky in places but just enough to keep you hooked.
- Interesting and engaging characters (although I'm not a fan of Mrs LeClue's priorities).
- Graphics and music very much to my taste (but your mileage may vary).
- Most of the puzzles are pleasantly challenging. They do get a bit repetitive, though (e.g., matching the wires). One seemed silly as it was sheer guesswork.

Cons:
- THE STORY ISN'T FINISHED. You're left on a cliffhanger, with no idea as to when (or if) the next chapter will be produced. I feel this should have been stated somewhere in the game info. I wouldn't have played it had I known that it was "part 1" of a yet-to-be-produced series.
- Having to look for and pick up various items gets really old really fast. Most of them are "gallery items" whose purpose is unexplained. Perhaps they are purposeless? 
- The walking pace is pretty darn slow. You can run through some sections, but not all. This becomes particularly frustrating when you have to walk back and forth through an area to complete a puzzle.
- No manual save options, and the length of time between autosaves varies from a few minutes to faaaaaar too long. The most annoying thing is that the game will tell you how much you're going to lose if you quit, but not how long you've got to go until the next save point. This is a major pain in the gizzards if you need to be able to quit the game at short notice, as you might have to repeat a section, which is frankly tedious.

All in all, I'm glad I played it, but I would have been infinitely happier had I known going in that the story does not have an ending. I feel conned, frankly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207649600', 'num_games_owned': 1989, 'num_reviews': 369, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1653147170}
review:
Увлекательное приключение с приятной графикой и музыкой интересным сюжетом и диалогами. Несмотря на простые и однотипные головоломки, а также довольно лёгкие задачи, возникающие по ходу прохождения играть интересно до конца, благодаря сюжету. Пожалуй самым большим минусом является концовка, которая очень резко обрывает этот самый сюжет и игроку предлагают дождаться продолжения игры. Год назад в Интернете появлялись слухи о запуске на кикстартере сбора средств на сиквел, но пока это так и остается слухами.

Несмотря на недосказанность в игре, рекомендую её любителям адвенчур и детективов. Надеюсь на появление в скором времени второй части, которая расставит все точки над И, потому что основные тайны так и остались не раскрыты.

review:
Don't bother, it's an unfinished story.

An episode, not advertised as such, a scam which gets the company blacklisted.

It's a good mystery, yet I wasted 11 hours (it's a slow burner) and will never get any answer.
It was my only motivation to play, the gameplay being poor, basic, straightforward, completely handheld. A vulgar Hidden Objects game, only without proper hiding, and with a handful of puzzles that might be challenging to a 10 year old child.

Not the sole flaws, by the way, but you need no more details to be warned off.
Don't feed those rats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025125036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1652250221}
review:
I should probably get some things out of the way first — yes, Jenny LeClue's plot is very linear, the puzzles are delightful introductions to brain-teasers that you'll find in other games, but are introductions, and you can, as I did, blitz the game to completion in 10 hours.

That being said, Jenny LeClue was great fun to experience, and while I did blitz the game in 10 hours, it was done in at least three sittings of around 3 to 4 hours each. The plot threads this line between being very twee and sweet, yet also dealing with growth and loss that any child can experience, and the reactions adults placed in that similar circumstances feel. 

Jenny is [i]not[/i] a nice person — she's rude, a little mean, thinks highly of herself at the expense of others — but very relatable, to anyone who was precocious and grew around adults that constantly underestimated them and their abilities. And the events she's thrust in — which include the death of the people she cares about, dealing with grief and loss held in abeyance over a period of a year, risking her life [i]multiple[/i] times, and realizing that some things gone may actually never be repaired — shake her to the very core, even though she tries [i]very[/i] hard to not show it.

We even get to see it from the perspective of the author of Jenny's series — a very nice meta touch, by the way — a man very obviously stuck in a comfortable routine of publishing Jenny LeClue series even as his target audience moves away from him. Unfortunately for everyone, he does that thing where authors being pressured to move away from a tried and true formula do, [spoiler]which is engage in some [i]Lost[/i]-level interdimensional shenanigans to explain why Arthurton was stuck in such a cozy environment for what probably is decades now[/spoiler], but the fact that he's dragged, kicking and screaming, across the threshold at times [i]by his own character[/i] is, as someone who's had plot-lines run away from him, something very familiar and honestly kind of funny to see.

That being said, with regards to the ending, [spoiler]I'm not sure I'm keen on the fact that it ended with what feels like a very abrupt cliffhanger, and it's not evidently clear what significance that final choice will be to any subsequent sequels[/spoiler]. That being said, I will look forward to how the developers will resolve this, so I'll keep an eye on any sequel to at least see what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069805095', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1652240722}

author: {'steamid': '76561198857331671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1651879348}
review:
缺点：对我个人而言可玩性，推理性不高，大部分情况鼠标乱移看到箭头指示亮了点确认就可以了，尤其是每个人物的审问调查时每找一个线索都要对话半天，还要长按键等候，实在是在挑战我的耐心。以及后面地图的探索，因为想尽量收集贴纸等元素，地图生怕错过任何一个地方，但有些场景移动速度巨慢，折磨满分。小游戏大部分是重复的，难度系数也都不高。[spoiler] 其中卡住的是水管结构那里，我是笨比，研究了半天管道，然后发现其实你先打开开关，通的管道就会颜色改变，贼明显，啊好气[/spoiler]
优点：游戏画面配音角色都很不错，可以当成一个动画来欣赏，故事的走向也是猜不透的，剧情这一块可以。虽然这一部最后未完待续，但很期待下一部剧情的衔接。操作方面很简单，适合手残党。但人物方面为什么感觉有种傻白甜攻略了傲娇的cp感。 哎酸了，我老婆苏西真的是白富美还是全能天才。
总结：推荐打骨折价时入手，还是可以玩一玩的。全款不推荐。里面做出不同的决策后最后有一个类似mbti测试一样很神奇

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1649160253}
review:
C'est joli, construit, bien fait, souvent drôle mais, mais... j'ai beaucoup de mal à me mettre dans l'ambiance. De nombreux objets que je trouve étant des vignettes de collection et non des indices, j'ai plus le sentiment de jouer à un jeu d'objets cachés de base ou de parcourir un making of que de chercher à résoudre un mystère. Le narratif omniprésent ayant de plus tendance à la digression, je trouve frustrant et usant les ratios actif/passif et utile/accessoire, en gros je m'ennuie un peu faute d'être concentré sur l'intrigue.
Après quelques chapitres, je ne suis pas sûr d'aller au bout de Jenny LeClue Detectivu.

Edit: arrivé au bout d'un parcours je maintiens un avis légèrement négatif. Bien que ce soit très bien écrit, mis en scène, mis en musique et bien traduit ce qui devient rare, je n'ai pas été pris par cet ensemble à l'intrigue pilotée par des spots d'actions trop visibles, aux énigmes trop simples et répétées pour un jeu d'aventure (je ne suis pas fan des jeux Sierra totalement incompréhensibles de la "belle époque" du point&click, mais il y a quand même de la marge entre le trop des uns et le pas assez de l'autre), aux collections qui déconcentrent sans vraiment faire appel à l'observation. Tout est tellement guidé et balisé dans ce jeu que je n'ai aucune envie de le refaire pour en chercher les variations. Disons que je ne suis pas le bon public pour ce jeu trop casual à mon goût pour cette catégorie malgré ces qualités intrinsèques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263979879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1648466585}
review:
[h1]İYİ BİR YAZAR ASLA PES ETMEZ[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2785978474
Arthur Finklestein, meşhur dedektiflik ve polisiye yazarı, baş karakteri minik bir kız olan Jenny LeClue’nun yeni bir kitabını yazmak üzere daktilonun başına geçer. Kitapları her daim saadet, mutluluk ve huzur içermekte, ufacık bir canlının bile incinmediği bir olay örgüsü ile ilerlemektedir. Ayrıca kitabın geçtiği kasaba olan Arthurton, herkesin huzur ve saadet içerisinde yaşadığı, bırakın suç işlemeyi ufacık bir kavganın bile olmadığı, güllük gülistanlık bir yeri yansıtmaktadır. Lakin her şey bir anda değişmeye doğru yelken açar ve Arthur’un telefonu çalıverir.

Hattın diğer ucunda Richard Inkwell, nam-ı diğer büyük patron vardır ve bu konuşmanın Arthur’un hiç ama hiç hoşuna gitmeyecek şekilde sonlanacağından kimsenin şüphesi olmayacaktır. Büyük patron, Arthur’un yazdığı kitapların satış rakamlarının çok düştüğünü ve okuyucunun yeni şeyler görmek istediğini söyler. Yenilik getiremeyecekse de artık onunla çalışamayacaklarını bildirir. Ve daha sonra ise şunu ekler “Artık kitaplarında cinayet görmek istiyorum.” 

Ve işte o andan sonra Arthur Finklestein kendi iç dünyasıyla bir mücadele içerisine girmek zorunda kalır. Daha önce hep huzur ve mutluluk saçan Arthurton kasabasına yıkım getirebilecek midir? Elleri daktilonun tuşlarında dans ederken kendi var ettiği karakterlerin hayatını sonlandırabilecek midir? Peki büyük patronu mutlu edip, tarihin tozlu raflarında çürüyen bir yazar olmaktan kurtulabilecek midir? İşte Jenny LeClue bize, bu yolda verilen mücadelenin tatlı ve kimi zaman da düşündüren kapılarını aralıyor. 

Daha fazla detay vermiyorum bu kısımda çünkü olaylar buradan sonra iyice dallanıp budaklanıyor. İlerledikçe sizi şaşırtacak ve içine çekecek bir hikâyesi olduğu konusunda şüpheniz olmasın. 

[h1]BİR RUFUS, BİR FİNKLESTEİN, BİR JENNY VE DİĞERLERİ[/h1]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2782953896
Oyun, yazarımız Arthur’un sahneleri seslendirmesiyle ve daha sonra da karakterlerin kendi aralarındaki diyaloglarıyla ilerliyor. Ve bu kısımlarda dış sesin anlatımı oyuna çok büyük bir tat katmış. Jenny bazen dış sesin söylediklerinin aksi şeyler söyleyerek ortada tuhaf ve komik anlar oluşmasına sebebiyet verebiliyor, bazen ise dış ses olayların heyecanına heyecan katacak yorumlar yapabiliyor. Diyaloglar tatlı tasarlanmış. Jenny’nin espri anlayışı yeterli düzeyde ve beklenmeyen anlarda karşısındakini çok fena çarpabiliyor. Bu da oyuncuya ayrı bir haz veriyor tabii ki. 

Oyundaki karakterlerin tasarımları ve hikâyedeki yerleri güzel düşünülmüş. Karakterlerin aralarındaki atışmalar, didişmeler, birbirlerini sorgulamaları ve şakalaşmaları gerçekten büyük keyifle dinletiyor kendini. Jenny bir dedektif adayı olduğu için oyunda bol bol da çıkarım ve sorgulama sekansı var. Jenny karşısındaki karakterin üzerindeki detaylardan ve ona sorular sorarak bir çıkarım yapıyor, daha sonra da bu çıkarımları kullanarak olayı sonuca vardırıyor. Ve voilà artık dedektiflik için gereken her şeye sahipsiniz.

[h1]GÖRSELLİK VE SES ÖNEMLİ ABİ[/h1]

Jenny LeClue, harika çizimlerden oluşturulmuş, capcanlı renk paletiyle ve oldukça güzel gözüken bölüm tasarımlarıyla insanı alıp götüren cinsten bir yapım. Her bölümde birbiriyle muazzam uyum içerisindeki tonların kullanılması, etraftaki nesnelerin şirinliği ve her an SS almak için içinizi gıdıklayan manzaralarıyla oldukça güzel bir deneyim sunuyor. Seslendirmeler bu büyüklükte bir yapım için oldukça kaliteli. Seslendirme sanatçılarının ne kadar büyük bir özenle çalıştıkları belli oluyor. Karakterlerin mimikleri oldukça güzel tasarlanmış. Jenny’nin yüzünden bile verebileceği tepkiyi anlayabiliyorsunuz. Özellikle Arthur Finklestein’ın seslendirmesi muazzam bence.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2784429958

[h1]SON DETAYLAR[/h1]

Oyun, oynanış kısmında ekstra olarak söylenebilecek pek bir şey barındırmıyor. Oyunun istediği noktada karşımızdaki karakterleri sorguluyoruz, çıkarım yapıyoruz, sonuca vardırıyoruz ve hikâyeyi devam ettiriyoruz. Öyle her karşıma çıkan karakteri sorgulamak istiyorum durumu mevcut değil. Ayrıca seçimi bizim yapmamızı sağlayan bazı anlar da mevcut lakin bir iki seçim dışında diğerleri çok da önemli gibi gözükmüyor. Oyunun sonunda bir seçim anı var ki işte o her şeyi belirleyen an diyebilirim.

Ayrıca puzzle kısımları mevcut ve pek zorlayıcı değiller. Özellikle ana ilerleme materyallerinden biri de puzzle olan bir oyunda biraz daha kafa yakıcı şeyler görmek istiyor insan. Genelde aynı puzzle tarzını birden fazla yerde kullanmışlar ve bir süre sonra bu durum insanı boğabiliyor. 

Oyunda bir büyüteç mekaniği mevcut. Ekranda “M” tuşu belirdiği vakit büyüteç ile bulunabilecek bir nesne olduğunu ifade ediyor. Bu nesne bazen işe yaramaz bir toplanabilir, bazen ise ilerlemek için gereken mühim bir eşya olabiliyor. 

Toplanabilir nesneler, oyunda bulunan “Concept Art”ları açmak için gereken “Gallery Art” nesneleri ve minik dedektifimiz Jenny’nin çıkarım defterini özelleştirmek için kullanabildiği “Sticker”lar olarak ikiye ayrılıyor. Jenny’nin defterini açtığınızda, topladığınız çıkartmaları defterin istediğiniz kısmına yapıştırarak kendi tasarımınızı oluşturabiliyorsunuz. Olay bundan ibaret.

[h1]NE YAPALIM ŞİMDİ? ALALIM MI?[/h1]

Oyunun olumlu kısımları olumsuz kısımlarına göre bende daha ağır bastı. Özellikle görselliği ve diyalogları çok tatlı. Karakterlerin mimikleri ve seslendirmeleri ise 2D bir oyundan hiç beklemediğim seviyede kaliteli. Çıkarım sekansları eğlenceli ve merak uyandırıcı. Bir sonraki bölümde ne olduğunu oyunun sonuna kadar merak ettiriyor. Hikâyesi ise insanı ilerledikçe içine çeken cinsten olsa da biraz fazla uzatılmış olduğunu düşünüyorum. Oyunun oynanma süresini arttırmak için ekstra gereksiz işlere girilmiş ve bu da bir süre sonra oyuncuyu “Bitse de gitsek be abi” kıvamına getiriyor. 

Dedektiflik oyunlarıyla aranız iyiyse, tatlı görselliği içinde kendinizi kaybetmek istiyorsanız, gereksiz seviyede uzun olsa da gittikçe gizemli bir hâle gelen hikâyesinin size göre olduğunu düşünüyorsanız almanızı öneriyorum.

[h1]75/100[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000737112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1647971177}
review:
Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is a great mystery adventure with a captivating story, superb art and overall nice music (although this part is a little bit lacking for my taste). If you like detective/mystery stories with a spin and lots of humour, this is a game you will love!
You will like this game, if you like Ace Attorney, Spongebob and other wonky stuff.

Strengths:
+art style
+captivating plot (altough due to the mystery theme it is sometimes convoluted)
+dialogue and the amazing voice-over with spoken secrets
+distinguished characters and their development
+the humour
+creative dots everywhere

Weaknesses:
-unsatisfying end, that screams "Sequel!" (still nice, but leaves you behind too much for my taste)
-childishness overall while trying to be a mature game
-lacking music at some points (but not too terrible or anything, most of the time it's goo, but never amazing)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064590408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1625435870}
review:
[h1] Charmant, drollig... und dennoch...[/h1]

Das hier ist eine sehr sehr sehr subjektive (man würde vielleicht sogar sagen unfaire) Wertung aber ich muss ehrlich sein: Dieses Spiel hat einen charmanten Look, nette Figuren, eine nette Geschichte und simple, aber niemals nervige Rätsel.

Das was das Spiel aber für mich kaputtmacht ist das unglaubliche Cliff-Hanger Ending. Man wird absolut unbefriedigend zurückgelassen und sitzt wie ich wohl mit langem Gesicht da. Ich habe nichts gegen Teaser, aber das hier würde ich fast schon als "Teil 1" im Titel deklarieren, das fand ich unglaublich ärgerlich und ich habe den Kauf etwas bereut

review: Loved this game! I love a game where your choices shape the narrative. The art is so pretty, and I enjoyed the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561199165514920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1647106141}
review:
[b]Imagine having to pick up a gallery item while running away from a murderer[/b]

Not a harsh "no", very mixed feelings.
First and foremost, this is a beautiful, high-quality game with really good voice acting. However, I really wonder what the target audience is. Some puzzles or "deductions" were very challenging. The story itself had a good build-up and was pretty dark and layered. On the other hand, the slow walking pace was soooo frustrating, the dialogue or deductions were stating the obvious and puzzles were re-used too much. This makes me think it must be nice to play with children because you get something out of it as an adult and can help the child when needed. 

It's impressive to see that I didn't get all the details and secrets (looking at the postcards and achievements) after playing attentively. However, I don't feel the need to play this game again. A big contribution to this feeling is the gallery art?!?!? It's so annoying when you need to search for a hidden thing every 3 minutes and it turns out to be a gallery item 90% of the time... but that you also can't skip it because sometimes it IS useful. Besides, I don't know what to think of the story... I like that it was getting more and more layers, but the end is very abrupt in comparison. You just got to know all the pieces and then BAM! here they are together and BAM! "it's over, see you next time byeeee". Because of this cliffhanger, I do look forward to a sequel, just because I put in all the work and deserve to know what's going on lol
