author: {'steamid': '76561198028661912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1646659172}
review:
Несмотря на милое личико. Алкоголичка, алкоголичка. В смысле, не ведитесь на красивую картинку. Игра достаточно не ровная и сомнительные решения в ней перевешивают плюсы.

Итак, у нас есть некий писатель детских детективов. Из его печатной машинки должна выйти уже 38-я книга о похождениях девочки-детектива Дженни ЛеПодсказки. Редакторы настоятельно советуют автору сделать серию мрачнее и жёстче и убить одного из персонажей, а лучше двух. Иначе книга будет отменена. Писатель испытывает когнитивный диссонанс, ведь он задумывал Артуртон, город, где происходит действие игры, милым и беззаботным местом. Но всё же начинает писать. С этого момента игра периодически скачет от писателя к персонажу, а игрок выступает в роли некого олицетворения судьбы, который влияет на то, какой будет книга. Тут уже заметна не доработка на стадии проработки, о событиях прошлых частей или хотя бы о их названиях, никто не вспоминает. В общем, в городе происходит убийство, и Дженни начинает расследование.

Игра управляется полностью с клавиатуры. На вопрос, когда будет добавлена поддержка мышки, разработчики ответили никогда, хотите - играйте на геймпаде. И это в игре, где нужно постоянно водить курсором по экрану... с клавиатуры. Вот оно - поколение консольных разработчиков. По той же причине здесь присутствует некое подобие QTE с ограниченным по времени выбором и долбление по кнопке Enter с последующим её зажатием. Подозреваю, что с мышкой игра бы проходилась гораздо быстрее.

Ну ладно, смирились с управлением. Следующий раздражающий момент - сбор коллекционных предметов. Их просто тьма, ещё и трёх видов: картинки для галереи, наклейки, части открыток. Весь этот шум ужасно отвлекает. Осматриваешь предмет - там три коллекционки, ищешь подсказки, там ещё столько же. Идёшь себе спокойно - появляется уведомление, что нужно поискать безделушку, а через пару шагов ещё одну и ещё. При этом при поиске можно найти как коллекционку, так и необходимый для прохождения предмет. Зачем подавать это в лоб? Можно было запросто открывать галерею после прохождения определённой главы или давать награду за осмотр каких-то предметов. А то создаётся ощущение, что игра не про расследование, а про сбор хлама. Более того, некоторые предметы нельзя осмотреть повторно. Не заметил коллекционку при приближении, но подметил её на общем плане, выкуси.

Идём дальше. Главная героиня ужасна. Она надменная, заносчивая, дерзкая, бестактная, одинокая волчица на одинокой дороге, совсем одна. Но по сюжету она даже не достигла переходного возраста. Откуда это отношение к людям? Даже по полученным достижениям видно, что игроки выбирали дружбу с другими персонажами и принимали помощь от них, чему героиня противится так, что её аж передёргивает. Эгоистичное прохождение выбрали только охотники за идеальной игрой, умопомрачительное 1,8% "большинство". Я бы лучше поиграл за местную Кортни Грипплинг. В глазах Дженни она выглядит богатой задавалой. Но по факту оказывается доброй, чувствительной, заботливой девушкой, которая вдобавок умная, красивая и вообще учёная-изобретательница с хорошим вкусом. Почему я не могу играть за неё? Дженни даже сама игра не любит, всячески намекая на её смерть и подталкивая к этому. Отсюда постоянные замирания на краю обрыва на грани падения. Или реальные падения в пропасти. Можно даже в груду камней на вагонетке вписаться на полной скорости. И даже приговорить героиню к смерти в финале, хотя этот выбор ни на что и не влияет толком.

По описанию может показаться, что игра похожа на Нэнси Дрю, но нет. Скорее на Oxenfree и Night in the Woods. Точно также бегаем с видом сбоку по разным непонятным мрачным местам (по пещерам, шахтам, ночному лесу, бункерам). Только, если в тех играх мистика была притянута за уши к истории о взрослении, то здесь тайны города играют первостепенную роль, а отношения персонажей вторичны. Но сюрприз-сюрприз. Игра не имеет финала. Это упоминается в большинстве обзоров. Но я не понимал, как это будет подано. А вот как. Всю игру мы как бы расследуем убийство, взбудоражившее мирный захолустный городок. Но по ходу действия вскрывается куда больше интересных тайн о самом городе. И преступление в итоге отходит на десятый план. Оно не просто становится не важным для игрока, оно становится не важным для сюжета. И тем не менее, игра подходит к моменту, когда Дженни больше для себя самой, чем для кого-то ещё, декламирует как всё произошло по её мнению. В этот момент начинается обвал и один из обречённых игроком на смерть персонажей исчезает. Продолжение следует. Вопросы о том, где находится Артуртон, что за Совет трёх и кто в него входит, что за человек в плаще, жив ли отец Дженни - остаются без ответа. Если это первая часть неизвестносколькологии или игра задумывалась как расследование конкретного дела, то в чём сложность была отразить это в названии? Реально получается, Дженни всю игру опирается только на свои домыслы и трактовку улик, встречает тех, кто может всё прояснить и... конец. Зачем так делать? Анонс кампании по сбору средств на сиквел был сделан в конце прошлого года, но с тех пор никаких подвижек не было.

И знаете, в чём ирония? Сразу после "продолжение следует" появляется цитата матери Дженни: "великие детективы не оставляют загадки без решений". Уж кто бы говорил.

Головоломки в основном интуитивны и не сложны. Но некоторые изматывают, заставляют много бегать по локации туда-сюда. Хуже всего загадка со статуями ангелов на кладбище. Они стоят далеко друг от друга. Нужно понять, какой куда должен указывать и правильно ли ты выставил положение. Ещё хуже головоломки на настройку радиоволны/изображения. Там, крутя четыре регулятора и щёлкая двумя-тремя тумблерами, надо свести волны в одну или убрать помехи. Ладно бы это было один раз, но это повторяется раза четыре. В меньшей степени то же касается взлома замков и вращения регуляторов для сопоставления проводов.

Русский перевод нормальный, но встречаются ошибки. Плохо, что не стали заниматься перерисовкой текстур. Из-за этого получаем какую-то ерунду вроде "Case of Недоступная лестница". Или головоломки с шифрами, где надо искать слова в книге со сказками на английском. Можно было оттолкнуться от финального решения и написать отсебятину.

Идеальная игра предлагает пройти себя два раза. При этом для получения некоторых пропущенных достижений можно загрузить ранее пройденную главу и быстро добежать до нужного места. Но в некоторых случаях нужный выбор находится аж в самом конце эпизода. Что важнее, новая игра + в этом случае исчезает и для её появления надо снова запускать титры и смотреть до конца. Разработчики знают об этом баге, но так его и не исправили.

Подводя итоги, могу сказать, что у игры был потенциал. Но следовало выпускать законченную историю с заделом на продолжение, а не обрывать повествование на середине. Сократить или вообще убрать секции лазания/прыгания/бегания. Добавить управление мышью и больше головоломок. Ну и, конечно, пересмотреть подход к сбору бонусов. К сожалению, я сомневаюсь, что разработчики услышали мнение игроков, и если сиквел выйдет, то там будет всё то же самое. Пройти можно, но вероятность разочарования велика.

P.S. Не понимаю, зачем Сиджея сделали таким похожим на Дока из "Назад в будущее" внешним видом и манерой речи, но при этом умственно юродивым.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372160041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1646231987}
review:
-喜欢
小姑娘的性格真的很有趣
画面不错
虽然选了普通模式但感觉还是有点吓人（虽然其实并没有恐怖画面但是不知道为什么心里毛毛的 而且我取消了时限选项 整体推游戏还算安逸）
还算有趣的自圆其说的故事
几乎完全没有自主思考的解谜要素，解谜小白可以当电子书看（一直按enter 小姑娘会给出近乎全程的推理过程，只需要在最后5选x选中推理的线索而已）

-讨厌
恶心的三选一结局（暂时只打出这一个结局 不清楚另一个选项是不是好结局）
虽然双臂支撑慢走和攀爬速度慢很有代入感但是shift能不能一直起作用！！！（上上下下爬藤蔓把我逼疯）
额外的收集要素是不是太多了点……
这游戏是没有手动存档还是我没找到存档入口……？

-建议
如果入手该游戏的话，开头的对话模式推荐自动，不然enter键能按碎（对话略多，确认是enter攀爬是enter互动是enter对话推进还是enter）

author: {'steamid': '76561199230138805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1646021569}
review:
Visualmente espectacular, historia atrapante, gran personaje protagónico.
Juego lineal y guiado. Falla en los acertijos, las respuestas suelen estar en la misma escena y las resoluciones son fáciles y repetitivas.
Final abrupto e inconcluso, dejando el camino para una continuación.
Deja un sabor amargo, recomendado para los que están comenzando a jugar aventuras gráficas.
NOTA: 1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198033594479', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1645738718}
review:
Pouce gris.

Jenny LeClue - Detectivu est un petit jeu développé par une petite équipe financée par Kickstarter. Il se présente comme un jeu d'enquête reprenant les codes des romans jeunesse, mais relève plus du jeu d'aventure centré sur son histoire. En effet, les énigmes et puzzle à résoudre sont très accessibles (ce qui est cool) et limite trop classiques (ce qui l'est moins). 

Certains niveaux (les mines) semblent inutilement longs quand on préfèrerait profiter de la petite ville d'Arthurton. Pire, certaines énigmes nous imposent des allez - retours qui allongent de manière artificielle la durée de vie. Même remarque sur les millions d'objets cachés dans les niveaux, qu'on aurait apprécié simplement débloquer en terminant le jeu après une petite dizaine d'heures, la rejouabilité étant incertaine malgré la présence de choix.

J'ai apprécié la DA, le soin apporté aux doublages (quelques oublis sont à signaler pour la traduction VF), et l'humour omniprésent, notamment celui issu de l'interaction directe entre le romancier qui écrit l'histoire et sa turbulente héroïne. Quel dommage que ce jeu ne se suffise pas à lui même et nécessite d'attendre la suite pour avoir le dénouement de l'histoire.

Je vous conseille de le prendre en promotion pour toutes les raisons évoquées ci - dessus, car il est relativement cher.

Si vous n'avez pas fait Tangle Tower, je vous le recommande chaudement également :
https://store.steampowered.com/app/359510/Tangle_Tower/?l=french

Manette supportée,
Petit niveau d'anglais nécessaire pour les parties non traduites.

kontrolleri zor, puzzle'ları çok basit, seçenekler sunuluyor ama aslında iki seçenek de aynı yere çıkıyor. oyun değil de interaktif film gibi :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198100310524', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5213, 'last_played': 1642880960}
review:
[i]Jenny LeClue[/i] is a young and overly eager — not to mention self-appointed, though that is of lesser importance to our young protagonist — detective’s struggle with her unexpected first murder case, as her jam-addicted author himself is struggling with being coerced into writing more danger, death, and chaos into his beloved detective mystery series. What little miss LeClue has been up to until now in this long-going series nobody knows.

A narrative-heavy detective mystery adventure game oozing with creativity, [i]Jenny LeClue: Detectivú[/i] impressed on several occasions. The art is simple, but expressive and charming. The writing is colourful, with personality, and arguably the best aspect of the game, and combined with the addition of voice-over, it breathes life into the characters and the world they inhabit like nothing else. More true to the genre than one would perhaps expect, there are nods and easter eggs such as hidden encrypted messages throughout the game. Playing it, it's as though one can feel the very passion poured into its making.

For the gameplay-inclined, there is little to bite into here, with virtually no difficulty to speak of. On a technical level, the game suffers somewhat, with some bugged achievements and other bugs, though fairly harmless. By far the most vexing point is the veritable ease with which New Game can be selected over New Game+, destroying your save file and dooming you to play through it all afresh, or to bitterly abandon any hope of collecting those sweet, sweet achievements. Jenny LeClue sorely needs an idiot-proof mechanism preventing players, such as yours truly, from shooting themselves in the foot not even just once, but thrice, because of this. Ahem.

[b]Verdict:[/b] 7−/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198124942948', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1644518242}
review:
Довольно годная игра с интересными головоломками, правда в некоторые моменты оставляет с непонятными чувствами.
Иногда ругаешься на главную героиню, ибо ты вроде выбрал "мягко сказать", и она чуть ли не матом "ТЫ ЧО, ВООБЩЕ". Что очень сильно насмешило так это когда тайная дверь открывается, был слышен звук спавна в SCP: Secret Laboratory. Игра оставляет "большую" сюжетную дыру, намекая на продолжение (о чём собсна и говорят). Но продолжения ниту, что вводит в печаль. 
В игре не очень сложно находятся спрятанные вещи, главное побродить чуточку больше, и тогда игра сама скажет что тут что-то есть. Хотя были собраны лишь ~70-80 % спрятанных вещей (в виде стикеров и картин (картины кстати годные)), но это даёт некоторое удовольствие (помимо стикеров, в самом начале игры поставил некоторые стикеры и забил). 
В целом игрой доволен, жду продолжения. И помни [b] НИКОМУ НЕ ДОВЕРЯЙ, ДАЖЕ СЕБЕ [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198341184421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1643992800}
review: This game is truly amazing!!!  I play a lot of point and click and adventure...Puzzles etc.  This one may be my absolute favorite so far and definitely in my top 5.  I hope there is another one under way...pleeeeeeeas!!!  It was challenging but intuitive and I did not feel the need to rush through.  The mystery was so well thought out with well timed jump scares and plot twists.  So, very enjoyable and not monotonous at all.  So many different forms of game play with clever puzzles worked masterfully in.  Fabulous job!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011453658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1643409705}
review:
Озвучка - на высоте, одна из лучших игр в этом плане.
Перевод на русский - хороший, художественный (не без огрехов, но в целом очень хороший).
Юмор - много, качественно, иногда в голос.
Атмосфера детских детективов - стёб и ностальгия в одном флаконе.
Милота - просто милота. Очень много милоты!

Кстати, уважаемые разработчики/издатели - почему нет саундтрека в продаже?
И СДЕЛАЙТЕ ПРОДОЛЖЕНИЕ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198187032061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1642609357}
review:
Восхитительная игра с глубокой историей, графикой с великолепным сочетанием цвета и композиции, затягивающее развитие сюжета и персонажа. 
Первые пол часа хотелось бросить, показалось, что случайно купила детскую игрушку. Но по мере развития сюжета Дженни на глазах превращается из легкомысленного ребенка с детскими забавами и фантазиями в подростка со взрослыми проблемами в пугающей и полной неизвестности реальности. 
Сюжет, красота, загадки, геймплей, повествование, персонажи, многогранность - мне всё очень понравилось, это, наверное, самая любимая игра :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198316286295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1647979272}
review:
After 15 hours of playing this game, I managed to finish the story. And it was so much more and so much better than I expected.

If you are interested in solving riddles and searching for clues, making deductions and choices, collecting collectibles, this game is for you.

I enjoyed the first run a lot and will most certainly start a second one, this games has enough to offer to replay it and make different choices the next time around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960585528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1641580349}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a really charming adventure game. As the title suggest it is mainly about doing detective work which ranges from whimsical "Case of the missing glasses" to an actual murder case and also includes most puzzles in between with stuff like "the case of the slightly out of reach ladder"
Overall I would recommend this game, however it has a few problems keeping it down.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
- Charming art style
- Really good voice acting
I was actually surprised by the quality and also its speed. Usually I skip ahead because the voice over is too slow for my taste but here it worked quite well for me.
- Dialogue and characters in general are great. The main character is kinda obnoxious by design: over-confident, not willing to ask for or accept help and generally quite a brat but can also be really funny and I quite liked her. There is more serious dialogue at times but it is typically interspersed with funny parts.
- Puzzle design
While generally showing a nice variety the puzzles are mostly very simple. You walk around an area, use everything or look at specific people/items and use everything there and then you connect the dots. There are mini-games but I will get to those later.

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
- Cliffhanger ending
This is the main negative thing about this game: It is part 1 of 2 and it ends on a massive cliff-hanger. Part 2 is not out (yet) and until then the game pretty much heaps mystery on mystery without resolving most of them in the end. I knew that it ended abruptly but I was still baffled when it did.
- Controls
This has been mentioned by others already but the controls are really not ideal. Pretty much every interaction is made more complicated then it needs to be. I’m also not a fan of how often you have to tap or hold the interaction key just to make it seem more interactively. Then there is the magnifying glass. Most of the time items in the environment will need to be inspected using the magnifying glass before you can actually use them. This means walking around until the glass indicator appears, activating it, moving it around the screen until something highlights, holding use until the game decides you did it enough, then you can go to the item and actually use it. However 90% of the time it will be just some collectible item but you still have to do it every time because it could also be important.
- Padding
This got worse the further I got into the game. A lot of the areas are EXTREMELY padded. There is a boating section which takes forever and pretty much the whole underground area could have been cut in half without losing anything of value. The game is best during the dialogue and actual detective sections but walking around spacious and mostly empty areas to find the path to progress in between annoyed me a lot. Also a lot of the sections force you to walk slowly further lengthening those areas. Also also there was far too much climbing on vines just for the heck of it. 
There is also a bunch of mini-games but most of them also were more annoying then anything else. This is especially true for the plank breaking and the power cables which are repeated far too many times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198895863790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1641549793}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016151326', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1641391406}
review: Использовать геймпад это пожимать лапу дьяволу, но эта игра так и просит проходить ее с джойстиком или еще лучше на тачпаде, что я изначально и сделал. Правда несмотря на странное и неудобное управление, Дженни Леклю заслуживает высочайших похвал. Классный визуал, простой и ненавязчивый геймплей, атмосфера загадочности и мистики, достойная Секретных материалов и Гравити Фоллс. Всем рекомендую приобрести эту игру, а еще лучше поддержать разработчиков для создания продолжения)

author: {'steamid': '76561199037409093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1641483820}
review:
Cool game which captivates you with its story. The riddles are light, nothing complicated but it keeps your attention. The alternative choices in some points are a nice touch. In my opinion, the gallery items and stickers haunting is unneeded.
I'm looking forward for part 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561199111646372', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1641322846}
review:
Обычно я качаю игры с торентов, но ету мне подарил друг в стиме,за что большое ему спасибо! (thanks Gummer!!)
И в целом она мне понравилась, особенно везуальный стиль и атмосфера - играла с удовольствием!! А еще понравились многие персонажи, озвучька ну и история(сюжет) увлекает! В начале было много смешных моментов, а в конце игра превратилась прямо в ужастик(хорор),ну не совсем ужастик но мне было жутко по пещерам ползать!! Вот а теперь про минусы разкажу. Геймплей простой и однобразный, а загадки и головаломки простые (и часто повторяются),при етом сама игра не короткая! поетому иногда было скучновато,особенно когда надо было много бегать и ничево не происходило! Второй минус - я сказала сюжет увлекает и он увлекает, но в целом он какой то бредовый, много всево очень намешали и в конце просто каша уже! И почти некаких ответов игра резко обрываеться надписью *продолжение следует* вот ето мне очень не понравилось! 

Вот вспомнила почему я вобще решила написать обзор. В игре есть класная фишка, можно украшивать свой дневник(журнал) наклейками которые находишь во время игры!! Их можно клееть на обложку или любую страницу в любое место и еще крутить их можно! Очень круто!! Но блин!!!!когда включаешь игру в следущий раз все наклейки у меня проподают из журнала!! Я не знаю может у меня одной такое?? Очень обидный баг но фишка супер

Ладно пора подводить итоги! Игра 7/10 (мое мнение)
Рекомендую тем кто любит простые игры-преключения! Тут надо просто бегать,читать диалоги и решать не сложные головаломки! Хорошая игра для релакса(расслабления), я играла в нее когда была усталая и в другие игры играть было лень (после трудново дня в школе или если настроение плохое). 

Фух на етом все! не думала что писать обзоры так сложно прямо как сочинение ахах только можно ошибки не исправлять

author: {'steamid': '76561197988904686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1641002370}
review: Though more of a visual novel than an "adventure game", the story here really had my attention and I was eager to move on and find out more. There are a number of dialogue options that come up that can change the course of the game, and give you a different experience a second time through in small ways.   What surprised me the most was how it read like a young adult novel with some heavy themes of death and danger throughout, so it never felt patronizing.  Overall, the game looks great, has sharp writing, and an amazing cast of voice actors, however the biggest issues I had with it were the puzzles, which were seldom and rather easy, and when you get to the end it drops a "To be continued" on you. As of this writing, the game came out two years ago and last had a teaser tweet about four months ago, so no idea if that's ever going to happen, but I'm hoping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032623323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1640667927}
review:
Прошел игру. Напишу небольшой отзыв. Игру советую. Два бакса со скидкой она стоит. Она хорошая, местами даже отличная. Вроде на нее и собирали с Кикстартера, но в результате получилось хорошо. По сути это приключенческая игра для расслабления. Никаких боев тут нет. Просто решение простеньких паззлов и забавный сюжет. Самое веселое это наверное Гэги и шутки в первой половине игры. Первая половина она здесь лучшая. После этого разработчикам то ли надоело, то ли денег им много завезли, но добавили много непонятой беготни, которая для движка игры совершенно не подходит. Тут бы все же поисследовать и порешать загадки с шутками прибаутками, а не платформинг какой-то.
Концовка полностью слита как обычно. Одни вопросы, а ответов нет.
Что ещё могу добавить. Русский текст есть. Ничего так, не портачит вроде. Что-то вроде подчищенного промта. Ошибок там не нашел, но и процентов 30% гэгов как всегда убрано. Про Английскую озвучку что-то позитивное говорить тоже смешно учитывая, что почти всех женских персонажей озвучивала одна актриса. Пойдет. Звуки и музыка тоже пойдут. 6/10.
Игра стоит своих денег. Если не собирать весь мусор проходится часов за 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068240538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1641846941}
review: I'm playing this with my husband, the story is okay, the art style is okay, the voices are okay, the lack of using a mouse is baffling. The main character is an obnoxious brat, there is nothing likeable about her at all. I hate not finishing a game so we will persevere but we really find Jenny unpleasant, she has no redeeming features at all, so far. Also I am not a fan of pointless game choices and the magnifying glass animation is beyond irritating, you should be able to activate things without holding a button down for 5 seconds, this is not good for people who have tendonitis or carpal tunnel issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561199037054007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1640054835}
review: This game is amazing. The art, the story, the writing, the voice-acting, it's all superb. I really enjoyed my time at Arthurton, and how its big mystery unfolded. It's a really beautiful, wholesome game, and I will be returning to it for sure. Can't wait for the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024645120', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1639221041}
review:
I am usually a fan of point and click adventures but this game caused me a great deal of frustration. I think it's stylish and grabbing (otherwise I wouldn't have played to the end), but there were a lot of moment of wishing things would go a bit faster along the way. Maybe I was trying to be too thorough and it's my bad. 

The slow mechanic of using the magnifying glass led to me feeling frustrated when something was 'just' a gallery item or sticker and slowed the pace of the game a lot. Unfortunately one can't ignore the spots all together because they're sometimes important devices. The ending made me want to scream and throw my laptop out the window.

Maybe this game is just geared more for a young adult audience, but the puzzles were a bit simple for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010359871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1628574467}
review:
Play Jenny LeClue if you want to feel like a detective genius. I like the Sherlock games, but if you want to live that fantasy play Jenny LeClue. The detectiving is fun and making deductions is satisfying.
The collect-a-thon elements are a bit obnoxious (and I would feel like I was doing a disservice if I ignore them), some of the levels are tedious (just say no to sewer levels), and the ending feels like a copout but these are all miniscule in comparison to the positives.

author: {'steamid': '76561199168211982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1638858641}
review:
美術設計不錯、全語音互動小說
解謎很簡單 "廣播訊息"的解密設計得頗精巧
倒是被操作卡關 開始時關了"操作提示" 被放大鏡的操作卡到以為中Bug了
其次 收集品過多 很影響遊玩節奏
最後 故事基本上就是圖書館常備、連續10冊以上的那種兒童偵探小說
[spoiler]還要只是序章 後段還牽扯到平行宇宙[/spoiler]
開了很多的頭卻不收尾 結尾戛然而止到談不上是留下懸念 根本就是未完成的故事
如骾在喉 餘味太差 除非有續作將故事圓回來 否則絕不推薦

author: {'steamid': '76561198283025755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1638725606}
review:
가끔씩 헉할 수준의 끝내주는 2.5D 그래픽과 연출
풀더빙에 개성넘치는 캐릭터
노가다 요소가 좀 있지만 그래도 어렵지 않은 퍼즐
후반부 갈수록 점점 고조되는 괜찮은 스토리와 괜찮은 퀄리티의 한글화
다 뒤지고 다녀서 거의 10시간 나왔는데 평범하게 플레이하면 6-7시간 정도의 괜찮은 분량
그리고 내 사랑 제니의 서사를 생각하면 이건 오지고지리는세상에몇없는 갓겜인데 엔딩에서 갑자기 바람빠진 풍선됐음...
탐정물인데 아주 활짝 열린 결말을 견딜 수 없다면 제니 르클루2 나오면 같이 사세요
게임 자체는 진짜 좋았는데... 아니... 하... 이 복잡한 감정에 도저히 말을 이을 수가 없다...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073973550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2600, 'last_played': 1703349886}
review:
I wouldn’t call this a puzzle game. It is rather a story based adventure with light puzzles. But very good such. Puzzles are mainly quite easy, there are some little harder ones but nothing frustratingly hard. The story and mystery are main things here. The story is quite interesting, just don’t expect very high realism.

The voice acting and visual style are great. There are lots of choices, some of which affects the story in major ways. UPDATE: After playing the whole game again and doing different choices, the choices didn't affect the story nearly as much as I had expected.

In the store page, there is a horror tag. I definitely wouldn’t call this a horror game, but there are some parts that are little spooky.

Some cons:
I didn’t like the automatic saving system. Sometimes saving interval is bit too long. Also the saving system makes it much harder to try different choices. There is a scene select feature, which lets you to jump back to certain scene, but still more traditional saving system would be better.
In the game you can find gallery art pieces, which are mainly concept art and can be seen in the gallery accessible from the main menu. I don’t recommend to look those until you have finished the game, because some of those contain very minor spoilers.

Note that this is an episodic game and the second episode have not yet been released. Some mysteries are resolved in this episode, while others remain to the second one.

Anyway, I very much enjoyed Jenny LeClue and I’m looking forward to the second and final episode.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083550026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1619662750}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027873712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1638323643}
review:
Not for me but it might be for you. A bit too casual for my liking.
It's a hidden object game with voice acting.
Had I seen a hidden object tag I wouldn't have bought it, even on sale.
The game is very linear with many prompts. 
It's impossible to get stuck and that immediately gives it a very low difficulty ceiling.
Ultimately it is well polished and for an indie or small studio I simply can't give it a thumbs down even though I didn't enjoy it.
Worth adding that it's better that the game be too obvious and easy than have infuriatingly obscure solutions as some of the more popular hidden object games tend to have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199236606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1638313997}
review:
I can't say I am not in love with this game. The story is amazing and well written, I almost feel like the creators should pitch a series based on this game. With such a great story they had to potential to make this into a Broken Age type of interactive point and click game. The type where u have an inventory and plug and play mechanic. Had they done that, Jenny LeClue would easily be in the top 10 best point and click games ever made. Instead, the creators took a more visual novel type of approach; you spend more time watching the story unfold and you get small games (some very repetitive) here and there to keep you engaged. 

That is not necessarily a bad thing, many games of that genre tend to be amazing (i.e Danganronpa), but when I bought this game I wish I was made aware of that. That being said the game has more pros than cons:

Cons:
- Puzzles are not challenging and the solutions are basically spoon fed to you.
- More emphasis on the story portion than the game portion; there is a lack of balance.
- They removed the mouse function, which makes doing tasks a bit tedious. 
- I did not enjoy having to press shift so much to run, it kept triggering my sticky keys.
- Much of the "mystery" was not really clarified. I still don't know what is going on even with all the evidence that were presented to me. I know there's a sequel coming up but atleast give me something so I don't forget what's going on when I play the next game.

Pros:
- I personally love the narration, the story is well paced.
- I love that they have autoplay so it plays like a video instead of being all choppy.
- The characters, especially Jenny are well developed and likeable.
- The story is very well written so it didn't make me feel too bad that I was watching the game more than playing it.
- The voice acting is amazing, they did a great job.
- Some puzzles towards the last few chapters were really fun and somewhat challenging.
- Some of the game mechanics were really unique and fun (investigation and deduction parts).
- It's an excellent game for tweens and teens!

Now that you understand how the game is like, I really urge everyone to still play it but with a different mindset. Get into bed with your laptop on your day off and just get immersed in the story. You really will be in for a treat!

author: {'steamid': '76561198838249047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1638397717}
review:
首先，画风很喜欢。身为资深解谜类游戏玩家，我一直都不太喜欢那种3D角色的解谜，因为我会头晕……所以如果你也有这方面问题，这款游戏很合适。
其次，揭秘难度适中或者说中等偏下。如果你想要高难度的解谜关卡，这个游戏不适合你。
第三，与其说是解谜游戏，不如说是互动剧情小说。这里要夸一下英文配音，很多英文游戏的配音真的很……背台词，这里面的角色配音很出神入化，你都能当动画片看那种。
最后，如果作者考虑出小说我一定买！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198886321618', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2669, 'last_played': 1670201365}
review:
Um Adventure que soube bem como se aproveitar do mistério, Jenny LeClue é verdadeiro filme em questão de direção, pois cada ação que fazemos no jogo torna o mistério em volta dele mais, mais e mais grandioso

O carisma da protagonista Jenny LeClue também é admirável, sua obsessão por mistérios e falta de senso de perigo torna a história bem mais divertida

author: {'steamid': '76561198028588051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1688402759}
review:
I've read some reviews complaining that this game is unfinished. Is it annoying that it's not clearly stated that this is part 1 of a longer story? Yes. Does that make the experience any worse, or does the game end abruptly? No.

With that said, I didn't enjoy my playthrough as much as I expected, mostly because there's barely a game here. The story is ok, the writing is good, but the gameplay consists of tedious minigames that feel like padding and busywork, they don't feel organic, it's like they are there just to pretend this is a game, I wish they had been left out. Also, in my opinion the narrator hurts the pacing of the story. Still an interesting story with good writing, but the cons beat the pros for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981412938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1637610768}
review:
Visuals 9/10
Voices 10/10
Writing 8/10
Controls 4/10
Game Design 2/10

It's stunningly beautiful most of the time and the characters are very lovely, as the overall atmosphere, but it's a real challenge to trudge across. God, so much backtracking and constant pixel hunting everywhere – this feature of "looking for clues" is a sadistic joke: sometimes you need to find an interactive spot, but most times it's just a collectible, but you can never be sure!

And there's not enough detective work. What bogs me down is that Jenny chews up every solution to little puzzles there are, leaving nothing for the player, and that there are SO MUCH WALKING /climbing back and forth around the most SPACIOUS of LOCATIONS (no fast travel for ya, and required interactive objects can be screens and screens apart).

And there's very little interactivity with the most common interaction with the world being tapping the action button few times. Need to find a specific grave? Tap-tap-tap-tap-tap it and Jenny will find it. Need to make a conclusion? Tap-tap-tap-tap-tap it and Jenny will make it. This tap-tap-taping is downright downgrading / borderline interactive movie with the play button jamming constantly, if not for the tedious treading.

Oh, and the mouse is not supported. MOUSE in the ADVENTURE game is not supported, not even for menus. It's so awkward to navigate and for some reason near the end, the game starts to think that it's Prince of Persia. Thank god, you can re-map keys, but it's still can't be played with one hand comfortably. And I love my detective adventures with a cup of tea, reclining.

And worst of all, the story drops on the cliffhanger with no answers given to anything. I poured 10+ hours into jogging across the screens to get more questions >:-/. What's up with devs and cliffhangers in their debut projects? I'm freaking torn. The visuals, the style, the voices, the premiss are SUPER WELLDONE and captivating, but the (semi-)final result is not a good game.

I guess there were either no passionate gamedesigners on the team (just writers and artists), or there was one particular super savvy producer, pushing it to the vastest auditory possible, which often means to no one. Eh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800595798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1637106923}

author: {'steamid': '76561198812162622', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1637042287}
review:
Jenny LeClue would easily be one of top 10 games I've played this year.  It was a sheer delight to experience and I would liken it to a really good book.  You can't stop playing!  All lovers of murder and mystery will adore this. Each character is well fleshed out and you get to know and feel for them.
Jenny lives in a sleepy town called Arthurton with her best friend Keith and cousin Suzie.  Her father was a scientist and is deceased, so she only has her mother.  Mum was a former CSI and Jenny has inherited her investigative skills.  She is bored as nothing ever happens in this town, but Jenny and we, the players, are in for a big surprise.
The story is brilliant with all its twists and turns and is narrated by Arthur Ficklestein, the inventor of Jenny.  [Some of the names in this game are hilarious!]  He is a mystery writer of obscure childrens books. This game is his coming of age too.  We share his concerns as he struggles with decisions that will affect Jenny's life forever.  Arthur has his publisher breathing down his neck threatening to cancel his contract. His pain is evident as he has to change Jenny's course and put her in grave danger.
The game opens very slowly as we're introduced to Jenny and all the characters.  It really is a prologue to the main game.  Bear with it as the story picks up and everything is soon going at  a cracking pace.  The intrigues, plots and scheming will astound you.
Jenny LeClue's character is a mixed bag.  She has such a brilliant mind that she can't be bothered with others. Jenny can be extremely obnoxious at times which hides her vulnerability.  She is very prickly and incredibly insensitive to others.  Jenny has a biting sarcasm and an acerbic wit which produces some hilarious dialogue.  The writing and dialogue are exceptional.  I had a good chuckle at Jenny's interactions with others.  Incredibly argumentative and impatient when others can't keep up with her mentally, she doesn't endear herself to others.  Nontheless, she shows great courage on her journey, overcoming her fear of the dark and heights.  Jenny gets herself in some very interesting situations!!
I won't say much about the story except that Jenny's mother is framed for murder.  That is on the store page.  So our super sleuth has to prove her innocence and find the killer.  You will help Jenny along the way and make some difficult choices.  There are lots of puzzles to solve and codes to crack.
The graphics are lovely and very suitable for the theme.  Voice acting was exceptional.  All characters were brilliantly done, especially the town nut, CJ.  It really heightens the game.  Music was good and so were the sound effects.
There are some downsides though.  Mainly the mechanics of the game.  I don't know if you're able to use a controller, but WASD and enter were the main mechanics on the keyboard.  It is not a point and click game, but more of a side scroller.  I found the game controls very frustrating, but the story had hooked me in and I soldiered on. 
The other annoying part is that there are multiple collectables and if you stopped to pick one up, it really interrupted the flow of the story.  You have 61 achievements to get.  There is a level select to go back to certain areas to mop things up.
The other negative is that this is part one of a two part game.  Yes, that is a surprise!!  It did finish on a slight cliff-hangar and there is definitely more to come.  The dev is working on the second part right now.  I can't wait!!
As an indie game, this is exceptional.  Mografi specialise in visual storytelling and they really have delivered on a high level here. These people will go far.
Is it suitable for children?  I would say from pre-teens or teenagers upwards as Jenny is full of teenage angst.  There is one jumpscare which will make you laugh afterwards and there are spooky bits too.
Game play is lengthy....10 to 15 hrs for most people.  Highly recommend.  9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198150423585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1636836233}
review: Such a thrilling and exciting detective game! So many decisions made me on the edge of my seat!! Forcing me to make such crucial  decisions made me so frustrated but so excited. Wonderful game! Having so many collectibles was a bit much at points but it didn't make exploring any less fun! I'm a huge fan of mysteries and story based games so this is easily one of my favorite games I've played in a while! I'm going to go back and find all the hidden secrets and find all the different endings and achievements!  I'm so excited for more I hope the next game is as thrilling and exciting as this one! Kudos developers Kudos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097118288', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1636408534}
review:
I discovered this game through pushinguproses youtube channel. I have always been a fan of the point and click puzzle games with a mystery element so this looked right up my street. 

Pros:
~The art style is very aesthetically pleasing and collecting the concept art as a side quest although tedious is worth while. 
~The concept of Jenny and her friends being characters in a Nancy drew/Famous five type of book series is quite a refreshing one. Having grown up on novels like this I felt like it covered all of the tropes from those stories while casually poking fun at them. The writing is witty and I had a good chuckle several times throughout the game.
~The voice acting is perfect. CJ in particular reminded me of Doc brown so everytime he had a line or too I couldn't wait to hear him ham it up
~Although I found the puzzles to be quite easy and linear. That isn't necessarily  a bad thing as the story flowed quite smoothly and I was glued to the game. I have a habit of leaving a game for months if I'm stuck on a puzzle and I never had that with this game.
~The element of choice was quite nice and adds re-play ability value
~ The ending has made me wish the second game was already out, I'm hooked !!!

Cons:
~ Some of the collectables were quite fiddly to pick up 
~ The dialogue options implied something different at times from what actually came out Jennys mouth. Although entertaining, I do like to have some form of idea what's going to happen when I make a quick time choice.

Overall if you're a long time fan of this kind of game or you're looking for a good starting point Jenny Leclue is for you. I give it 8 magnifying glasses out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054794643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1636285057}
review:
The game is really amazing!

I've bought it on sale and now finally got myself to start playing it, cause i had nothing else to play. (Actually i do, but shh!)
It starts a bit boring and i wasn't sure what to expect from it, but the more you play, the more interesting it gets.

While you uncover the sometimes twisted and unexpected story, you're solving little and big cases, easy and medium puzzles, meet very interesting characters and enjoy fantastic voiceacting and harmonizing music. 
It all really fits together pretty well. 

It sucked me in so much that i had to force myself to take some breaks inbetween, especially because the game also turned out to be much longer than i expected. 
After a little more than 11 hours, i´ve reached the [i]end[/i] of it, sadly, because i could have played a lot more of this!

Don't have many negative things to mention, only irritating for me were the controls: 
No mouse, just keyboard, but you'll get used to it quickly and i must say it really suits the game. 
And well, near the end they might got a bit excessive with collectable artwork pieces. 

If you're wondering about the gameplay, it's easy to understand and to follow, some puzzles / walkways can be really time consuming, but not hard to solve. 
There aren't any time limits or quick time events, so you're free to explore and solve the mysteries at your own pace 

I adore the artstyle of the game, as well as the hilarious and creative writing, it's honestly a gem. 

What adds a bit more mystery to it, is the fact that i just read on [url=https://twitter.com/JennyLeClue/status/1457005469793456134?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet]Twitter[/url] that there are some puzzles that still need to be solved, even 2 years after release! 


[h1]Overall, Jenny LeClue is a must have if you're into story games. Voiceacting, art, characters and story are flawless. 
It's rather long for an indie game, with it's 11 hours, but every minute of it was entertaining for me and worth it. 
I'd buy it again, even for the full price.  [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198320967963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2256, 'last_played': 1636847254}
review:
想想还是改好评了
最大的缺点就是无聊，就算塞一堆和主题极度违和的阴间音效和演出也掩饰不了，真的很无聊
这个故事容量完全没必要做又长又毫无游戏性的流程，完全打消了玩家对谜题的注意力，只有烦躁程度在累积，后期谜题根本无所谓了只想立刻通关
美术挺好

author: {'steamid': '76561198975291449', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 940, 'last_played': 1644062553}
review: 超级好玩！！！！！！解谜难度超级友好！画风好可爱，收集品超级多，成就也好多（怎么会还有这么多拿不到啊到底在哪啊）！故事线脑洞好大，人物都很鲜活，做选择的时候真的有设身处地的紧迫感；可以收集贴纸装饰日志也太好了吧！云手账爱好者狂喜！结局好出人意料，好期待第二部的发展！珍妮猛猛冲！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198058057967', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1636191320}
review: 本來想給予本作好評，直到我玩到了最後，才發現故事根本沒有收尾，宛如寫到一半即被收走的作文，連寫下句點的時間都沒有。當我看到工作人員清單，心中只有滿溢的錯愕感：「等一下，剛剛那個原來是結局？」。一般來說，一部作品就算不給讀者「劇終感」，起碼也要有「告一段落」的感覺，而本作竟連段落感都沒有，除了「惡劣」兩字以外沒有更精準的評語。如同沒有完成的作品沒有試吃的必要，實質上沒有做完的遊戲，既沒有購買，也沒有評論的必要。

author: {'steamid': '76561198052101352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1636135251}
review: This is a wonderful game. I got it on sale and now would totally buy it for full price given the quality of the content. I always loved the point 'n' click genre, and there aren't many new things one can incorporate in such a game, but Jenny LeClue somehow managed to turn it up a notch and become one of the best point and click adventures I have played in the last years (and definitely among my all-time favorites now as well!). Great minigames, voice acting, witty lines, intriguing story, lovely collectibles, and graphics. I can't wait for the next episode to find out what happens next!

author: {'steamid': '76561199098103933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1643840571}
review:
The art, (beginning of) the story and soundtrack are very nice. 

But: the controls on the PC without a controller are annoying. The gameplay is very linear. You almost don't have to think for yourself. Everything happens one after the other. You have to press Enter all the time. Thus the detective feeling is missing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311359325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1635746517}
review: Fun game with great art. I really liked the art style. Although the main character is a kid, the story is still interesting enough for adults. The end was a little uneven, though. Well really abrupt with some plot threads left unhandled. If there is a sequel, I will likely purchase it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352252154', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1651024175}
review:
Great story! It will take more than one playthrough to get all the achievements. So, I'm just going to wait until the next Jenny Leclue is announced before I (try to) finish the achievements. Hopefully I won't have to wait forever.
Definitely recommended on sale like I got it. Not sure if it would be worth the full price though, especially since it's basically an unfinished story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864589418', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1635840033}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091814837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1636033565}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059407314', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1635732110}
review:
Oof.

Where do i start.

First of all, the game is absolutely stunning, the voice work is really good, everything is just great.....

....but that cliffhanger, even with the warning on the page (WHICH I FORGOT ABOUT and STILL doesn't help quell how disappointed and heartbroken i was...), i still felt betrayed? just ????? The ending still left a few more questions to be answered and it didn't feel good in a good way either. 

It had me just sitting here like "huh? where is the rest of the game" while the credits rolled, REALLY it felt like we were finally getting to the conclusion, finally putting the pieces together, and getting closer to the truth..... and then it just stops. 

"Thanks for playing!"

I'm... hesitant to really fully recommend it, with the time i did have, I enjoyed it. I enjoyed Arthurton and it's citizens and the town itself and was chomping at the bit to figure out the mystery.

I was just heartbroken when it just... ended. 

I recommend it, but be warned if you do play, that the game is basically unfinished, but what is here was an enjoyable experience. I will def be playing the second part if and when it does come out.

(also what the hell is up with the control scheme, i have horrible carpal tunnel and my hands did not like the purely keyboard or controller options. Just irritating :/ )

author: {'steamid': '76561198452865409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1636854782}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030150459', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1692015525}

author: {'steamid': '76561198986569114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 345, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1634934006}
review: El juego tiene buena trama, una banda sonora espectacular, personajes entrañables con un art style único y puzles muy interesantes. Lo malo es que el final es muy muy abierto. No te da esa satisfacción de que todo encaje como en el último momento donde Jenny habla sobre toda la investigación que ha hecho. Te deja confuso, decepcionado y frustrado. Le resta muchos puntos por mi parte, pero supongo que el motivo es la secuela. CJ es sin duda mi personaje favorito, aunque por la parte de los extraterrestres no creo que lo aguantase mucho. Suzie desde la presentación del personaje se nota que no es como las demás chicas que se ríen de Keith por lo que entiendo más o menos cómo se siente tanto por las amistades como por su sueño y pasión. Jenny por otra parte con su propio carisma es presentada de una forma divertida. El escritor que está siendo presionado y prácticamente forzado a "matar" a sus personajes me da ternura por la forma en la que muestra que definitivamente no quiere asesinar a nadie. El juego te presenta una narrativa de una historia ágil y entretenida (descartando el final abierto) y sin duda lo mejor es poder resolver de verdad los casos por tu propia cuenta a través de enlazar las pistas que has ido recolectando

author: {'steamid': '76561198004685493', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 1782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1764, 'last_played': 1634895604}
review:
Хто з нас в дитинстві не мріяв стати детективом? Ось і проста дівчинка Дженні ЛеКлю теж фанатіє від детективних історій і намагається навіть найменшу подію перетворити у захоплююче розслідування. Але коли ти живеш у невеликому містечку, де ніколи нічого не трапляється, максимум, на що можна розраховувати - пошук окулярів для своїх сусідів. Та коли раптово помирає декан місцевого університету, а матір дівчинки звинувачують у його вбивстві, Дженні розуміє - настав її зоряний час! Вона повинна докопатись до істини і врятувати свою маму!

Jenny LeClue - досить класний квест, який спочатку виглядає трохи дитячим і навіть нуднуватим, але події швидко закручуються і перед нами розгортається надзвичайно цікава фантастична історія, від якої уже неможливо відірватися! Як виявилось, місцина, де проживає Дженні, ховає надзвичайно багато таємниць і розгадувати їх - справжнє задоволення! Біда лише в тому, що у фіналі ми так і не отримаємо відповіді на всі питання, доведеться чекати продовження. Але не лякайтесь, Jenny LeClue - це не епізодичний проект. Гра доволі тривала і прикрасить вам не один вечір.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258178099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1634440191}
review: It's so nice to find a game that has good puzzles that are extremely difficult to figure out. The art is also amazing and the story line keeps you on your toes the entire time. Well done 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031101514', 'num_games_owned': 1191, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1634191908}
review:
A detective story starring a young girl who wants a big case to solve to prove she is a real detective.

The writing and the character building in the game is excellent.  The narrator is the author of the book Jenny is starring in and his own struggles add to the struggle Jenny faces during her journey.  Jenny's adorable snark make for an enjoyable experience as she interacts with people throughout the game.

While the writing is excellent there is a lot of improvements that could be made to gameplay.  Puzzles variety is lacking with only one puzzle that really took any thought.  I won't overall fault the game for this as it is more about the story and adventure but I hope they expand on this in the future games.

The final critique I have is the addition of filler content.  There are too many collectibles in a game that just distract from the story.  The stickers and postcard pieces are ok, but the concept art unlocks were way too frequent.  There is also a large section on the lake that felt completely unnecessary and ground the game to a halt.

Overall I really enjoyed the game and while the cliffhanger at the end was a bit off-putting you do get a full story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334984437', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1613765093}
review: Fisrt of all, [b]this game is not finished[/b], it drops you at the hangcliff where everything feels incomplete. Second, everything about this game [b]feels like a drag[/b], it could last half as long if you could move faster and skip the cutscenes and conversation. I'm not going back for these pointless achievements and don't recommend to waste your time on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086567923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1633528314}
review: great artwork, bad controls

author: {'steamid': '76561198211990992', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2300, 'last_played': 1633507127}
review:
总体还行。大部分故事粗看能自圆其说，但是关键场景破绽极大。
首先，开始说明黑橡木栏杆坚固啊，大力撞击，结果Dean从图书馆二楼跌下来竟然毫发无损，之前推测跌下来时候手中抓着旗帜辐条，但是最后手里却紧攥着她妈的ID卡，不管是摔下来之后Dean是清醒状态时自己抓住的，还是她妈喂药后硬塞得，我都想不通拿着ID卡这一步有什么作用。明显是为了剧情上要强制嫁祸于她妈。
假死这么大一件事情，之前说要让人发现自然死，结果却广而告之要和她妈在图书馆会面，还把图书馆整个清场，也是生怕别人不把怀疑对象放到她妈身上。
还有Dean计划笔记里竟然有把周五计划全部划掉改期，表面看起来很能自圆其说，其实搞得假死计划就像临时决定的一样，太牵强了。
还有，事件几分钟后警察就赶到了，是谁报的警？你品，你细品，是不是不堪推敲。
另外，说了假死计划是为了从内部搞垮三人议会，不过我是想不通假死有什么作用拉，Dean又不是nobody，不过这也可以解释成为了让其他两人露出水面，就看续集怎么解释了，也还行。
最后，剧情说Arthurton与现实分离，成了独立的一个空间，那么城镇资源从哪来？一个旅游城镇，没有游客，没有交通，竟然还能上网，对此剧情没有解释，但是我觉得居民竟然没人发现也是太假了。
所幸整个游戏玩法还不错，稍微弥补了一下剧情的扯淡。

author: {'steamid': '76561197962436703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1632206837}
review:
If you like adventure games, this game is amazing! The writing, the art, the extreme detail of animations, the audio, the pacing, the voice acting, the character designs... it really is a master class through and though. I've had a great time with this one.

I love that there's a designed pacing to dialog (by default, I don't have to advance things, it flows like a movie). And I appreciate that a lot of voice lines were sped up after recording to make the dialogue feel snappier.

Note: This is a very low-difficulty game. Actions and puzzles are simple enough for most children.

Complaints:
- It's extremely linear. With just 10% more interactable things that are red herrings, the game could feel much deeper.
- A million optional missables, which is fine, but some chapters are very time-consuming to replay because of minimum animation durations.
- In some parts of the game, movement will be slower (either climbing, descending, or just running is disabled). Some of these moments last a bit too long. This gets annoying during a long play session, or in areas that are meant to be explorable (backtrackable).
- The second half felt a little less polished. A handful of player state bugs let me walk away during cutscenes, fall through the floor, or slide around at sprint speed.
- While the writing and voice acting are overall excellent, there were a few skipped words, word choice issues (like writing "break" for "brake" or "pickup" for "pick up"), and mispronunciations (some voice actors are not native American English speakers). Most people won't notice this, and it's like 10 words out of 10,000.

author: {'steamid': '76561199123069515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1631946681}

review: Jenny LeClue may not be the most challenging puzzle game I've ever played, but it's easily one of the most memorable. With such strong writing and storytelling, charming characters (voiced by a newly-added cast), interesting locations to explore, and absolutely beautiful art design, Jenny LeClue is a game I've greatly enjoyed my time with. And it's an experience I won't soon forget!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025185109', 'num_games_owned': 1336, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1629696058}
review:
Fun game with wonderfully memorable characters. Jenny is just a snarky delight during the whole thing. It's not quite a "point and click" adventure game because you can't point or click, but it's definitely close enough to feel like the same general experience. A controller is highly recommended here as trying to use the keyboard felt awful even in just the menus.

The story is interesting and has enough interwoven threads to keep the intrigue going right up until the cliffhanger "to be continued" at the end, and the puzzles are fairly lightweight for the genre. Overall not a bad way to spend around 10 hours, and I'm eagerly awaiting the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198934878596', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1628715208}
review:
The game is alot of fun and if you're familiar with the Layton series or other simalair puzzle minded games. You'll pretty much love this game :) while collecting was fun for a bit, there's some downsides if you want to go full completionist.
Not all achievments are easily obtained, some didn't even work. It get's tideous to go trough the game again and again, finding all the collectibles and right decisions withoud the proper guides. You can't skip certain parts nor can you always run. Due to the frustration i sometimes noticed some small bugs here and there like sliding across the ground with a still pose b/c i was to fast with starting to run after a dialog was done.
The puzzles are really doable and i only needed help once (Because i completely forgot i had a book with me).
I think the game could be improved with a better solution to fast travel to more exact points or faster travelling to collect what you still need.
The VA is great, but this is one of the few games i noticed that some voices are too tuned which sounds a bit off for some. might just be me maybe.
Overall great game, must play regardsless :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999384699', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1628612375}
review:
An incredibly solid point&click adventure with a truly amazing art style and animation.

There isn't really much to criticize here. The game looks great, is plenty long for the cost, controls well (though I'd recommend a controller but KB works fine) and you always know what to do next. There's also only minimal backtracking and no inventory try-everything-with-everything probing.

The only true letdown is the ending, or rather the lack thereof. If you want to see it as an ending, it's utterly disappointing and marrs some - but not much - of the game's greatness. However, if you more think of it as having finished 9 out of 10 chapters and just having never picked the game back up again, it is fine.

So yeah, definitely recommended, just be aware you'll need to ignore the very last 15 minutes, ME3 style.

author: {'steamid': '76561199052788414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1626025157}
review:
[b]KISACA HİKAYE[/b]
Arthur K. Finklestein isimli yazarımız yarattığı uzun ömürlü kitap serisinin baş karakteri Jenny LeClue'nun tatlı dedektiflik serüvenini, satış rakamlarının düşmesi sonucu üstlerinden baskı almasıyla daha karanlık bir temaya büründürmek zorunda kalıyor. Renkli, sakin ve monoton bir şekilde seyreden Arthurton kasabasında artık karanlık işler dönerken, göründüğünden çok daha fazlasını barındırarak inanılmaz yerlere sürüklenen bir gizemi aydınlatmak da Jenny LeClue'ya kalıyor!

[b]ATMOSFER[/b]
-Oyunda kullanılan renk paleti, ışıklandırmalar, çevre ve karakter tasarımları birlikte muazzam gözüküyor. Kendine has stiliyle benzerlerinden sıyrılan görsel dili adeta şölen niteliğinde!
-Oyundaki seslendirmelerin de karakterleri çok iyi yansıttığını düşünüyorum. Genel olarak ses tasarımı ve kullanılan müzikler de oyunun içine girmeyi, karakterlerin duygularını özümsememizi kolaylaştırıyor.

[b]OYNANIŞ[/b]
Oynanış olarak birkaç şeyin etrafından şekilleniyor oyun:
-Tırmandığımız, atladığımız, kendimize geçiş yolları aradığımız aksiyon sırasında keyifli bir hale bürünen platform mekanikleri
-Olayları aydınlatmak amacıyla ipuçlarını, kanıtları toplayıp ardından bağlantılı olanları birleştirmek, eşleştirmek üzerine kurulu çözerken keyif alabileceğimiz zor olmayan dedektiflik mekanikleri
-Oynanışa dinamizm katan zorlamayan ama uğraştırabilen bulmaca mekanikleri
-Yaptığımız seçimlerle hikayeye yön verebiliyoruz; lakin bunların geneli gidiş noktasını değiştirmiyor, gidiş yolunu değiştirmekle kalıyor.

[b]GRAFİK[/b]
-Oyunun 2D grafikleri çok tatlı ve taş gibi duruyor. 
-Grafik tasarım açısından menü ve arayüzleri anlaşılır, başarılı ve estetik buldum.

[b]KISACA GENEL GÖRÜŞÜM[/b]
Stilize grafikleri ve muazzam atmosferiyle gözlerimi mest eden, kendine has mizah anlayışıyla bolca güldüren, gizemli hikayesiyle alıp götüren dedektiflik temalı bir macera oyunu Jenny LeClue! 
Tüm bu etmenler eşliğinde Türkçe arayüz ve altyazı desteğiyle beraber makul fiyatıyla da türü sevenler için şahane bir deneyim sunabilir, buyrun efenim!

[b]Not:[/b]
Oyunun sonu "DEVAM EDECEK" şeklinde yarım bırakılarak bitiyor, bazı insanlar için sorun olabilecek bir durum.
Oyun altyazı konusunda yer yer tökezliyor; İngilizce'ye geçiyor veyahut da hatalı çevirilerle karşılaşılabiliyor.

review: This is a fun and charming adventure game that at times can be genuinely moving. It accomplishes that by having an entertaining cast of characters, a variety of well-executed investigation elements, and a colorful visual style with dramatic camera usage, good use of lighting and dynamic background animations. Don't expect this to be the last game in the series and don't expect the story of this game to be concluded here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050240794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1621086998}
review:
Quick answer: I liked it, and I don't regret buying it.
But more differentiated, this game has several aspects that would just as well justify a non-recommendation.

-Firstly, as many other reviewers already stated, the content is brought to a halt while the story development feels like it was just about to take off into a much greater scale, and likely leave the player eager to go on. I'm not a big fan of cliffhangers, either, but it's become a common habit in modern entertainment.
-Secondly, the control scheme without mouse, keyboard only. This feels like a time slip back to the late 80s. Having used computers already back in those days, I can live with it today, too, but I would have really preferred a control with mouse. 
-Thirdly, and this picks up the previous point as well, the game feels forcefully slowed down, creating a longer play time than the content is really worth. Many, if not all, of the walking scenes are unnecessarily long. A few of those scenes develop artisctically into something else, so in those cases I'd say fine, this made sense after all. But for a lot of the crawling, walking, climbing, half the stretch would have been totally enough, there's a lot of time wasting here.
-The automatic-only game saves upon finishing particular scenes. Absolutely annoying. Especially for a casual game like this, you need to be able to interrupt and leave the game on a quick note at any point, without losing the last scene's progress. Please developers, when you do a sequel, don't do this again!

+The old school "modern" early 90s art style (being funnily consistent with the control scheme), though graphically simple, is very enjoyable, and some scenes make good use of more advanced graphic processes that add a modern flavour. A very pleasing visual contrast to many many other games. But don't let the intense colors fool you into thinking this was a game aimed at little children. IIt's certainly ok for kids, but they better be out of the age of being scared in the dark or dreaming of monsters under the bed. It's bad enough that our heroine Jenny is scared in the dark. ;)
+The story and the way it develops. From the description, I expected a kids detective story, dealing with kids detective stuff, look for this here, look for that there... I got much more than that and I love it! I'm not giving away any details, though.
+The storytelling itself. The way that the author and content interact, and eventually contradict, taking the game out of its story environment for a moment, and connecting back to what feels like "reality" is refreshing, and in my near forty years of gaming I don't think I've seen this before. Excellent idea, and it made for some good chuckling. 
+The overall balance of story and puzzles/tasks feels just right. A lot of the games in this general genre go very much in either direction, endless storytelling, clicking away pages full of text or cutscenes with heaps of blah. Or we get a lame story that would fit a beer coaster, but dozens of puzzles of a very uniform flavour to inflate the gameplay. Not here. The puzzles are easy to solve but not annoying, they don't choke the progress, the story is large but told in a perfectly enjoyable fashion and pace. 
+The characters are realistic, quirky, imperfect human individuals and very likeable. I feel we could have learned a touch more about the side characters, too, but as far as the story is concerned, it's perfectly fine the way it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198868350839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1627483327}
review:
Quiero iniciar mencionando que, a la fecha, llevo poco tiempo incursionando el ámbito de los juegos por lo que me inclino por títulos que a mi parecer serán un desafío transitable. 
En el caso de Jenny LeClue, me incliné a adquirirlo por la temática principalmente, me gustan el género "detectivesco" en todos sus formatos (series, películas, libros, etc.). La trama es interesante y llevadera, no diré predecible, sin embargo, si se juega con atención se pueden sacar una o dos conjeturas correctas. Los controles son sencillos (básicos, si lo prefieren), las dinámicas al momento de saltar/trepar/escalar, debo decir, se me hacían un poco lentas (pero puedo achacárselo a mi ansiedad). No sentí que me aburriera en ningún momento o que se me hiciera tedioso, lo cual, para mí, es positivo.
Fue interesante encarnar el personaje de Jenny, especialmente porque en más de una ocasión la personalidad con la que fue dotada me causaba cierto "escozor", una chica (no estoy segura de su edad, para mí no tenía mucho más de 12/13 años), con una personalidad que me invitaba a sentir que era combativa y que se irritaba con facilidad frente a las diversas interacciones con otros personajes. Yo no puedo saber a ciencia cierta cuál fue la idea de los creadores al dotarla de esas características, pero tampoco me parece incoherente dado el contexto en el que se encuentra, pero en sí, no hace a la jugabilidad (jajaja).
En fin, disculpen el testamento, no sé bien cómo es la dinámica de las reseñas (es la primera vez que hago una). 
Para resumir: trama interesante, encrucijadas a la hora de tomar decisiones, controles y puzzles sencillos, buenos personajes en general y, un final que deja margen a una continuación.
¡Saludos :)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198196107762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1707797805}
review: While the style of the game and storyline could have been very interesting, this game is very lackluster. Lots of boring wandering around scenes and the GAME HAS NO ENDING. I cannot believe I spent 20 hours of my life on this game. Do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 1649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1627258485}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un jeu d'aventure avec une jeune détective, dans lequel on retrouve des éléments de point&click et de platformer très léger. J'aime beaucoup le style graphique un peu décalé avec ses animations minimales. L'ambiance sonore est assez discrète mais de bonne facture. Le jeu est entièrement doublé en anglais (plutôt bien fait) et la traduction française est au top.

Les énigmes sont faciles, on a des choix à faire à différents moments du jeu qui ont un (très léger) impact sur le déroulement de l'histoire, et le cynisme de Jenny est bienvenu pour contrebalancer le caractère des autres personnages.

Le jeu se joue avec une manette, il n'est pas jouable à la souris.

A noter que c'est le premier épisode, on attends donc une potentielle suite. Si certains trouveront probablement que le jeu se termine sur un cliffhanger, je trouve qu'il se suffit à lui-même et que ce n'est pas pénalisant.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

J'ai trouvé les achievements un peu pénibles. Tout d'abord, les collectibles... évidemment au premier run j'en avais manqué quelques uns. Il faut donc refaire le jeu en entier, ou du moins les parties nécessaires, ce qui est possible car il y a une sélection des chapitres qu'on a déjà finis (ouf). Le problème, c'est que pas mal de parties du jeu sont LENTES, entre les dialogues, les phases d'interrogation des personnages, ... quand on les a vus plusieurs fois et qu'on veut juste accéder à la suite du chapitre ça devient limite agaçant. Ensuite, pour ne rien gâcher, de nouveaux collectibles ont été ajoutés dans un patch "récent". Ce qui oblige à refaire le jeu en entier encore une fois. A un moment il faut arrêter...

Pour les autres, il y en a qui semble mutuellement exclusifs, comme "I Work Alone" et "Team Work Makes The Dream Work", mais il est possible d'obtenir les deux sans refaire tout le jeu, juste en sélectionnant les bons chapitres avec les bons choix. "Deja Vu" semble suggérer qu'il faut refaire le jeu, mais il suffit de refaire le dernier chapitre à priori. Si certains étaient (peut-être ?) buggués lors de mon premier run, comme "Key To The City", je l'ai eu sans problème la deuxième fois.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Dans l'ensemble, un bon jeu d'aventure. On attends la suite de l'histoire !

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux fonctionne très bien, aucun problème rencontré. J'y ai joué avec le Dual Shock 4.

OS: Linux Mint 19 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.
