author: {'steamid': '76561197968599310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1627135054}
review:
A really solid detective story with stellar voice acting and a lovely visual style with very atmospheric locations. This was a joy to play and I finished it over a full day. The lack of mouse support did throw me to begin with, but I got used to it. It's a very liner experience, but I found that each location had about the right amount of time spent on it before moving on. You're very unlikely to get stuck, which is a great thing in this case. The primary loop is to solve some puzzles before getting some more story. It's very satisfying.

The only downside was how abrupt the ending was. There's a nonsensical choice to close the game (maybe a reference to Mass Effect 3 - if so, it was very obscure and unnecessary) and then you're told to wait for part 2 for the conclusion. I wasn't aware there was going to be a part 2, so this was very anti-climactic and disappointing - not how you want to end a game. Still, judging by the 99% of time I spent with the game and not the 1%, this was super fun and I'd recommend it to anyone who likes detective stories, and sassy kid characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096663928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1627150925}
review:
Серия самых коротких рецензий:

Хорошая (6.5 из 10)

P.S.: Расшифровка:

Трэш — знакомиться с игрой рекомендуется исключительно тем, кто в диком восторге от описания, скриншотов и продолжительности. Остальным, из контакта с этой игрой, только тыкать палкой, как ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ку на дороге.

Так себе — в основном, эта игра предлагает меньше, чем вы увидите из описания и скриншотов. Рекомендуется только тем, кому вышеперечисленные критерии окажутся «зашибись».

Нормальная — неплохая игра своего жанра. Сами судите по описанию, скриншотам и продолжительности. Игра, примерно, соответствует своему наполнению.

Хорошая — весьма неплохой представитель своего жанра. Многие могут найти тут «свой шедевр». Зачастую, игра приятно соответствует своему описанию и скриншотам.

Отличная — эти игры, зачастую, превосходят свои первые впечатления, основанные на описании и скриншотах (в расчёт не берём репутацию, ибо «тот кто знает, тот поймёт»). Хорошие представители своего жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304342038', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1627053740}
review:
這遊戲的長度比我想像中的長呢 挺長的
故事完整 從一開始讓人好奇 然後追查 緊張刺激
就是結局有點QAQ
一開始就想說好像顏色風景畫風也挺好的所以入手了
結果部分氣氛燈光之類的還是讓我超怕
我就很膽小很慌!! 跟女主差不多吧EMM

遊戲是固定視角 不過隨劇情/移動位置會拉近或放遠
我覺得視角都做得挺好的 該看風景的時候看風景

遊戲是全語音的
雖然個人不太喜歡英文配音
但我覺得這遊戲的配音都挺好的
就很有感覺 而且增加投入感

遊戲都是自動保存 所以無法說忽然中斷
都要等到自動儲存的位置才能退遊戲
不過有分章節 可以從某章節再開始 就方便做成就
不過部分是章節開始後幾乎要跑完那一章才到成就點
所以我就有點懶了

遊戲的解謎都比較簡單
我就只有一個沒想到看了攻略
所以就不太費腦子
不過如果追求思考的人可能會覺得解謎部分過於簡單

個人覺得這遊戲非常不錯!

author: {'steamid': '76561198328368751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1626942637}
review:
編集者「売上の為に作中で殺人事件起こせや」
無茶なテコ入れを受けざるを得なかった小説家により作られた世界が舞台の捜査系ＡＤＶ。

優しい絵柄同様、難易度も易しい。何度もミスるとヒントを教えてくれたり、一見ノーヒントに見える解除キー入力も指紋のある場所でガイドしてくれたり。（のめりこんで実績コンプしたらこんなに時間掛かったけど……）

とにかく作家と編集者のバトルがバチバチでなんか身につまされてしまった。
コナン・ドイルが歴史小説書きたいけど稼げないから推理小説書いてたことを思い出す。
オチ含めて作家のせめてもの抵抗なんだろうと感じた。作家と編集の関係はどっちが偉いとかなじゃなくて、お互いリスペクトになるといいよね。

author: {'steamid': '76561197985961079', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1626904238}
review:
Ein kleines recht sympathische Adventure mit einer hübschen 2D Optik die ein wenig an ein Kinderbuch erinnert. 
In der Rahmenhandlung geht es auch um einen Autor einer ehemals erfolgreichen Kinderbuchreihe die die namensgebende Detektivin Jenny LeClue als Heldin hat, da die Bücher aber zu harmlos sind verlangt der Verleger dass in den Büchern endlich mal ein Mord gesehen muss damit die Bücher endlich wieder erfolgreich werden.
Der Autor sträubt sich zwar seine heile Welt durch so etwas zu zerstören fügt sich aber letztendlich und so darf man in der Rolle der Jenny LeClue den Fall lösen und hat hier auch so den schönen erzählerischen Kniff dass hier der Autor als Erzähler fungiert und merklich oftmals nicht glücklich damit ist wie sich seine Figuren verhalten. 
Die Handlung hat mir hier ganz gut gefallen und die Figuren fand ich hier recht sympathisch, das Mysterium erweitert sich im Laufe der Handlung zusehends aber leider ist die Auflösung nicht wirklich befriedigend und endet auch noch in einen Cliffhanger was ich als recht enttäuschend empfand. 
Spielerisch ist eher von der geradlinigen und simplen Seite, man kommt von Abschnitt zu Abschnitt die recht abwechslungsreich gestaltet sind und dort werden Probleme meist durch simple Logikrätsel gelöst oder in dem irgendwelche Sachen verschiebt oder aus vorgegeben Sachen die Richtigen auswählt damit die richtigen Schlüsse gezogen werden können. Fand ich teilweise recht schade das hier recht viel Potenzial liegen blieb und die Lösung teilweise zu automatisiert sind, beispielsweise darf man mal einen Code knacken was grundsätzlich interessant war aber die richtigen Wörter werden einen hervorgehoben wenn man mit dem Cursor darüber fährt was das Ganze einfach zu sehr versimpelt. Außerdem fand ich dass sich manche Rätselarten zu oft wiederholen.
Hin und wieder darf man in den Dialogen auch kleine Entscheidungen treffen aber das hat keine große Auswirkung auf die Handlung. 
Die Kinderbuchoptik hat mir sehr gut gefallen, die Abschnitte sind recht detailliert gestaltet und bringen die richtige Stimmung rüber, erwähnenswert fand ich auch die Animation der einzelnen Figuren, deren Charakterdesign ist eher simpel aber durch die Animationen haben sie eine gelungene Gestik und Mimik die zwar übertrieben ist aber gut zum Still passt.
Insgesamt also durchaus ein Titel den man sich mal ansehen kann wenn man mal Lust auf simples Detektivspiel hat. 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007843420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1626810241}
review:
Nach nun mehr als 12 Stunden muss ich sagen ein gelungen und Spannendes Game. 
Leider ist das nur die ersten Teile einer Wundervollen Geschichte, die ein spannendes Ende präsentiert, wo man direkt Lust bekommt den zweiten Teil zu spielen, aber leider gibt es noch keine neuen Infos zum Zweiten Teil. Ich hoffe das es nicht durch COVID 19 dazu kommt, dass dieses Junge Studie keinen weiteren großartigen Teil hinlegen kann. Ich drücke ihnen ganz doll die Daumen.
Dieses Spiel hat mich Stundenlang gefesselt und ich konnte teilwiese gar nicht aufhören zu erfahren, wie es in dieser großartigen Geschichte weitergeht. 
Die Rätsel sind am Anfang einfach damit man die Spiel Mechaniken kennen lernt und auch die späteren Rätsel sind nicht sonderlich schwerer. So wird verhindert das man aus dem Spielfluss kommt und einfach diese schöne Geschichte weiter genießen kann. 
Die Charaktere sind so gut gesprochen, dass man in den stimmen ihre Gefühle hören und fühlen kann. Die Exzellente gesprochen Erzähler Stimme lässt einen denken mal lauscht einem Spannenden Hörbuch und befindet sich gar nicht in einem Spiel. 
Ich war sehr beeindruckt von diesem Erstlingswerk von Mografi und ich kann nur jedes Empfehlen der auf eine schöne Mysteriöse Geschichte steht, die viel Wendungen hat, dieses Spiel zu Kaufen.
Ich Wünsche jeden viel Spaß die Welt von Jenny Leclue und Arhurton kennen zu lernen. 
10 von 10 Sternen 😊

author: {'steamid': '76561198009301811', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1626812136}
review:
I want to love this game, but i only just like it.  It's flaws in game design undermine it's quality of production.


Let's get some of the deal breakers out of the way.  There is no mouse support despite it looking like a point and click. Not even the magnifying glass or inspections scenes.  A controller is HIGHLY recommended.

This is not a complete story, it's only episode 1.  It is definitely long enough to be consider a complete game though.  But it ends with cliff hanger and story development halted.  That said, there is still proper rise and fall story arch, there is character development conflict and resolution, and a major plot element is fleshed out.  It feels like you only solved a 3rd of the mystery laid before you.

This is a "Choices Matter" game, but they don't.  It's not one of the tags, but basically your choice dictates the dialog you hear and not the story(save for one scene).



With that out of the way, if those deal breakers didn't scare you off this is an absolutely amazingly well produced game.  It's fully voice acted with incredible art that is clean and brilliantly colored.  Despite it's 2D look, the game is 2.5D giving the world depth and life.   Light interacts with Jenny,  it washes over her and sets the tone literally and metaphorically. The art direction wonderfully done. The Voice acting is solid and the music scores well.


Game play is a bit of a fumble.  There are several mechanics.  One is inspection, this is where you look for clues. Almost every screen has something to look for, but I would hardly call this fun.  Another is deduction, from clues you find you combine relevant clues to lead to a conclusion. It only happens about a dozen times in the game. Third is puzzles and these come in the form of guessing what order to press buttons, what way to turn dials, reassembling jigsaws and a few others.  The puzzle felt repetitive but were sparse enough to not be an issue.  There really was no difficulty curve to them either.  Finally, interacting with the environment. Whether it's jumping, climbing or triggering some device, this represent the BULK of the game play, like 99%. And it's a bit of a let down, it feels slow and drawn out.  Setups are made to look like puzzles but you really don't have choices or anything to solve,  it's basically go here, look at that, go back, pick up something, go back and move on.  Jenny moves slowly and may have to back track to proceed.  Occasionally you will need to input a pass code, but they are usually written out plainly for you.


What makes up for the lack luster game play is the story.  The story is strong and compelling with mostly likable characters.  The most interesting element is the fact Jenny is a "fictional" character in a children's book series that is poised to be cancelled unless the author takes Jenny's story to a darker place than he is comfortable taking her.  He had her solve childish mysteries in a picturesque town until now,  frustrating the audience and even Jenny who seems antagonistic at the simple world she's in.  The existence of the author is interesting, he spoils the plot, he fights story that's taking on a life of it's own.  It works really well and makes the slow pace much more interesting that it had any right to be.


 Overall, I believe the game play needs stronger puzzles.  Despite an interrogation mechanic being in the game, she hardly interacts with anyone.  But with that aside, the game still gets a recommendation.  It's art, writing, music and voice acting help carry its middling game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304331692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1626299539}
review:
One of the absolute best games I've ever played, great story, great characters, the music and atmosphere are top notch and I really loved all the ways it differed with your choices. I was 100% invested from start to finish, I adored everything about it.

360 Controls felt a little finicky when trying to climb movable objects, and I came across a couple glitches where I fell into infinity, my right stick stopped working, and my movement tripled when in the sewer water for a moment, should probably iron those out but they didn't affect my overall experience with the game in the slightest, I'm just pointing them out to help them.

I will gladly support the Kickstarter for the sequel when it eventually comes out and I will livestream it the day I get it if I can, I'll gladly give it a ten out of ten, one of the best story and mystery driven games I've ever played if not the best.

review:
Из плюсов:
красивая рисовка
хорошая озвучка
закрученный сюжет

все головоломки(если их вообще можно назвать головоломками) одинаковые, все 5... головоломок абсолютно ОДИНАКОВЫЕ

author: {'steamid': '76561198132352299', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1629670204}
review:
Honestly a really great game that made me feel far too nostalgic at an age where I really shouldn't be feeling nostalgic for things yet.

The art is gorgeous, the writing is witty and the central mystery of the story is incredibly engaging. I loved all the characters and the whole experience reminded me of adventure games I used to play and mystery novels I used to read as a kid whilst adding somewhat of an ironic, self-aware tone to some of the conceits. It's incredibly heartfelt and a lot of the emotional scenes were creatively well done.

Keep in mind that the gameplay is pretty simple, I didn't mind this too much when I played outside of a few instances where it was a bit frustrating. There are mysteries/deductions you have to make but the game is mostly more of an interactive story with some puzzles rather than something super intense.

However it's important to know that this is only Act 1 of a 2 act story, the central mystery does get solved by the end but there are a ton of loose ends and due to them the ending of this act alone doesn't feel entirely satisfactory and then proceeds to leave you on a cliffhanger. If that sounds like something that'd bother you I'd probably just wishlist the game and wait for the second act to come out and buy them together. 

But you do get a good 12-ish hours of satisfying story and charming characters so if you're like me and willing to wait for the continuation (sort of like waiting for the second season of a TV show imo) I highly recommend it!

review:
Probably one of the best adventure games I have ever played.

It is charming, funny the puzzles are enjoyable and it is one of the most enjoyable adventure games I have ever played.

The voice acting is amazing and really compliments the game well.

In addition the choose your own adventure style where you get to pick and choose what decisions you make greatly helps the game along.

I highly recommend Jenny Leclue.

author: {'steamid': '76561199120788369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1625342235}
review: First things first. I love this game so much, but this PC version is not good. I understand that the developers worked crazy hard on this game, and on Nintendo Switch, it’s pretty good. I love the puzzles, the great story, the character interactions are so fun, and the characters themselves are so expressive and fun. But the PC version is very strange, specifically the controls. On the Switch and (obviously) Apple Arcade versions, the game has touch controls, which make the puzzles a dream to do! I expected mouse support in this version, but instead I have to use WASD controls for puzzles, which feels very uncomfortable. The controls in this version alone make this a deal breaker. Overall, this pc version is a poor version of a good game. 9/10 game, 2/10 port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025226613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1699897943}
review:
Jenny LeClue - Detectivũ has all the charm of a classic point-and-click but without the needless frustrations. There are puzzles, but they depend on Earth logic not Moon logic. The central deduction mechanic is graceful, intuitive and satisfying. It's not perfect, some of the decisions seem arbitrarily limiting, but that may be a manifestation of one of the most intriguing thematic elements, which I will leave the reader to discover. 

Graphically the game is charming, although the parallax effects do not bear close scrutiny and can be distracting if you're the type to notice graphical quirks. But the character and environmental design are pleasingly clear and modern while harking back to computationally simpler times.

Overall this is a good game that I recommend to anyone who enjoys either point-and-click, mystery or meta-textual media.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973091367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1625212463}
review:
I recommend this game with a big caveat.  The ending is very abrupt and feels unfinished.  It seems there's a sequel being planned to finish the story and if you happen to read this after that sequel has come out, get this right away.

That aside, the game's characters and voice acting is great.  While I found the puzzles a bit easy (I'm coming from a Myst series background) I was caught up in the story and invested in discovering more about Jenny's little town with big secrets.  I liked the "Choosiness" feature of the dialog options as you can role-play a Jenny that grows to acknowledge her shortcomings or a stubborn Jenny who can do anything, without anyone's help.

The collectables added in are quite numerous and not too hard to find.  I got around 95% of them on my first run.  The number of them all makes it a bit tedious to make sure you walk into every corner and overhang to search for something, but something will almost always be there for you.  That said, these collectables have no impact on the mystery plot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194167174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1625203390}
review: An amazing game. Much longer than I was expecting it to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997846529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1622806422}
review:
A really fun and solid adventure game that looks great and doesn't outstay its welcome. I thoroughly enjoyed playing it and loved the story.  Clearly a loving homage to girl detective books from years gone past!

The only small gripe I have is that Jenny's personality is a bit abrasive and she's definitely not my favourite character.  But it's not so bad that it puts me off playing the game.

I only wish they made it clearer from the beginning that this is the first of multiple games, because it ends on a cliffhanger!

author: {'steamid': '76561198815585775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1625097691}
review:
The game has some beautiful art, but the story is incomplete; this is just a part 1 and it really wasn't advertised as such, which was a big let down. And the second part is still not out...
The plot is good but I found the characters either forgettable or annoying. The narrator/writer did nothing for the story, I didn't think they used that device very well and the narration often times wasn't needed and just added padding. And padding is the biggest problem of the game: long corridors and ladders that have no reason to be that long, for half the game you can't even run, and the mechanics of the game were slow, where you often had to click multiple times of press a key for multiple seconds just to perform basic actions.
The puzzles were very easy and repetitive; there is no inventory, it's basically just an interactive movie with hotspots, which is not bad, but I felt like the game either needed to have less interaction because it slowed down the plot significantly and it felt often pointless and boring, or have the interactions actually mean something and be more challenging.
It was a story that seemed to be aimed at younger people, and not really my cup of tea, but it was ok; the main reason I wouldn't recommend it is because of the lack of an ending, which is most disappointing for a mystery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204395161', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1625000208}
review: Cute game but painfully slow. Would be good for someone that likes to basically watch a movie when they play games with occasionally clicking. Very easy as well. Could be played by 5 year olds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015999874', 'num_games_owned': 1556, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1624969551}
review:
It has an interesting story with likable characters. It has good pacing and tone, having a mix of comedy and dark mystery, but not interrupting one with the other. The puzzles are intuitive and aren't pointlessly drawn out, except for [spoiler] the angel puzzle which on can easily be misunderstood [/spoiler]. The overall story isn't too convoluted and it's easy to understand as it give new, easily understandable, information. The only real complaint is that the ending is a bit unsatisfying as it seems to lead into a sequel, leaving the story off at a cliffhanger and leaving many plot points unresolved. I believe that the story makes up for the ending enough, and that once the sequel does come out, it will likely be worth getting if this game is anything to go by.

Overall it's an enjoyable story with enjoyable characters, and I look forward to seeing what will come in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1625606169}
review:
L'autre soir j'avais très envie d'un bon point'n'click, j'ai donc lancé ce jeu qui trainait sur mon disque dur. Perdu, Jenny c'est de l'aventure, linéaire, à la manette. Erk. Et pourtant, c'était trop bien.

Jenny, c'est une petite fille qui vit dans un bled paumé et qui rêve d'être détective. Ça tombe bien, elle va avoir de quoi faire ses preuves.

Niveau gameplay, on fait évoluer Jenny sur un plan 2D, droite et gauche, parfois haut et bas quand il y a une échelle, et on appuie sur le bouton de la manette quand le jeu nous indique qu'il y a un truc avec lequel on peut interagir. Fuuuu, ça me fait penser à Little Misfortune, et ça me fait mal à mon cœur. Sauf que la grosse différence entre Jenny Leclue et Little Misfortune, c'est que avec Jenny, on s'amuse.

Le jeu est super rythmé, ça va vite il se passe plein de trucs, les environnements changent rapidement. Mais surtout, la boucle de gameplay dont je parle ci-dessus est régulièrement brisée, puisqu'il nous est régulièrement proposé de participer à des minis jeux, des petites enquêtes, des énigmes assez simples, etc... Jamais de truc compliqué, où l'on va devoir posé son cerveau devant pendant 1h, et pourtant c'est super plaisant à parcourir.

En plus de ça, l'histoire est très bien ficelée, la mise en scène impeccable joue parfaitement sur une ambiance marquée, les personnages sont tous excellents, y a de l'humour, y a de l'émotion, du suspens. La DA est toute mignonne et très réussi, ça fait mouche. Les musiques passent bien même si elles sont plutôt discrètes. C'est propre, très propre.

À noter que ça se finit en 10h en prenant bien son temps, et qu'il y a plein de collectibles à trouver pour ceux qui, comme moi, aiment fouiller dans les ordures, et ça c'est aussi très cool.

Bon, c'est pas le genre de jeu qui va bouleverser l'existence, pas de réflexion phylosofik ou autre. Par contre c'est un excellent divertissement pour qui recherche quelque chose de soft, mais sucré et pétillant.

Ah, petit "détail" que j'ai oublié : la fin sur un cliffhanger, ça fait très chier. Vivement la suite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067979265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1645951134}
review:
Még sohasem gondolkodtam ennyit egy játék értékelésén, mint LeClue kisasszony kalandjával kapcsolatban, mert igen rezeg a léc, hogy negatív irányba billenjen a dolog.
A grafika nekem nagyon bejött, bár vannak kissé elnagyolt dolgok, de ezek nem rontottak annyit az összképen. A sztori/hangulat szintén nagyon tetszett, egészen a játék végéig. Imádom a nyomozós/misztikus kalandokat, az ilyenek kb. 2 mp alatt tudnak beszippantani. Csak sajnos akkora hangoverrel van vége a játéknak, hogy ezt már tanítani kellene. Így hát hiába a 10-15 órányi kaland, megannyi nyomozás, döntések, ha a végén teljesen súlytalan az egész, és lényegében felesleges, amit csináltunk, mert egy bazi nagy "To be continued" fogad... ennek folyományaként pedig nincs is igazán lezárása a játéknak, sok az elvarratlan szál, nem kapunk magyarázatot bizonyos karakterek hátterére. Kár érte. A folytatás meg hát... majd talán egyszer...
A másik nagy problémám a játékkal, hogy nem lehet léptetni/átlépni/kinyomni/gyorsítani a párbeszédeket, narrációt. Oh boy... pedig abból rengeteg van. Nem gondolnám, hogy ez egy megoldhatatlan feladat lett volna, főleg mivel ezt már a Lucasarts játékok is tudták több mint 20 évvel ezelőtt. :) 
Szóval igen, rezeg a léc, mikor döntenem kell, de ha a játék végét nem veszem figyelembe, akkor egy rendkívül jó, és érdekes kalandjátékot kapsz a pénzedért. Csak nem árt hozzá némi türelem... meg egy kontroller, mert az egeret sajnos nem ismeri a játék, billentyűzetről irányítani meg kissé kényelmetlen. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052422878', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1622203751}
review:
Если быть откровенным, то игра заслуживает положительной оценки. У неё есть всё, чтобы считаться таковой, НО! Я не журналист, не представитель издания или какой-то организации, а простой игрок, у которого есть только свои желания, предпочтения, мнение на счёт чего-либо и т.д. 
И вот, несмотря ни на что, после аж 10 часов (что слишком долго как для данной игры, так и для этого жанра), я смело могу сказать - игра мне не понравилась. 
Начну с того, что пускай это действительно детектив, сама детективная составляющая здесь очень простая, по сути, это обычный, подростковый, если не детский, рассказ, перенесённый в видеоигровой формат. 
Небольшой городок, мистическая атмосфера, вроде бы всё на месте, но ничто из этого не цепляет. А вечно умничающая, с очень большим чсв, маленькая героиня то и дело раздражённо что-то комментирует. Вечно всеми недовольная, она и не видит, насколько сама по себе является им ровней в отношении к другим людям. Не любящая людей, не верующая в дружбу, такой она и является, при этом, как и полагается, вечно сующая свой нос в чужие дела. 
При этом сама игра сделана, как бы, от лица писателя, которой постоянно комментирует происходящее, общается как с нами, так и с главной героиней, ломая четвёртую стену. В самом приёме нет ничего плохого, но раздражает то, сколько времени отвлекает это комментирование. Из всей игры пару часов, если не больше, занимают монологи о происходящем, описывание всего того, что находится вокруг, обычно настолько ненужно или бесполезно, что единственное, для чего может пригодится так это для юных игроков, которым трудно уследить за повествованием. Причём скипа здесь нет, или убыстрения речи, придётся всё покорно выслушивать и ждать-ждать-ждать. 
Также отмечу, не знаю какой умник решил, что уровень в шахтах и канализации должен быть таким длинным, т.к. по большей части он кажется весьма унылым и однообразным, в отличие от предыдущих красивых локаций. 
Ну и само собой, самый большой гвоздь, это абсолютно слитая концовка, которой...НЕТ! Продолжение следует, спасибо что играли, вот всё что я увидел после окончания игры. В этом жанре есть куча представителей, которым хватило меньше времени, чтобы рассказать историю и закончить её. Здесь же, неимоверно растянутый и простой, детский детектив обрывается на полуслове, оставляя тебя в неведении. Я думал такой приём уже давно был утерян, даже в сериалах он выглядит зачастую лучше, а тут... 
Честно, я немного расстроен. Очень хорошо нарисованный квест, который ещё и работает отлично, оказался максимально простеньким, нудноватым, с раздражающей (для меня) гг, которую ещё и озвучивает, как мне показалось, взрослый с войсморфером (может я и ошибаюсь). 
По итогу, я бы скорее поставил игре среднюю оценку, но т.к. в стиме такой нет, то поставлю отрицательную. Подожду возможную вторую часть, теперь уже вынужден и, когда выйдет и когда я её пройду, возможно она меня удивит и тогда я поменяю своё мнение и оценку. Ну а пока что вот так, скажу я вам, играл я в квесты намного лучше, чем этот, который не то, чтобы ничем не удивил меня, а просто совсем ничего не дал взамен потраченного времени.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033904120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1623000435}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028012642', 'num_games_owned': 1583, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3008, 'last_played': 1621259172}
review:
Отличное приключение юного детектива которое довольно притягивает и заставляет ждать продолжения. 

Незатейливая история писателя детских детективов которая заставляет его пойти против своих принципов и написать нестандартную для него историю полную интриг, убийств и тайных заговоров.

История Дженни и ее автора Артура привлекает с первых же кадров своим визуалом который радует игрока на протяжении всего прохождения. Геймплей представляет из себя простую адвенчуру в которой вы идете от одной стороны экрана в другую, при этом на пути встречаются простенькие загадки, различные мини игры и большое количество исследования мира которое разнится от обычного чтения документов, до допроса различных игровых персонажей. 

Не ждите от игры детектива уровня LA Noire, или даже Ace Attorney. В ней все довольно просто, но это не делает ей хуже. Игра цепляет тайной что разворачивается в пределах этого выдуманного городка, драмой что происходит параллельно у автора Дженни, ну и конечно приятнейшим визуалом.

Единственное предостережение что я вам дам если вы решите попробовать данную игру. Это лишь первая часть из трилогии, и концовка данной части обрывается на решении одной из тайн, которая в последствии становится наименьшей по размаху по сравнению с тем что нам авторы игры нам заготовили. Если вас это не пугает, и вы готовы к тому что придется подождать еще какое-то время на продолжение, то смело берите, игра стоит каждого рубля/доллара что за нее просят. 

Одна из приятнейших адвенчур.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094045266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1633212112}

review:
Its a cool game but be WARNED is incomplete.
If i had known I would not gotten it until i was sure they made the final of the story, was disapointed and felt tricked.
But its a good and casual play time, just that damn To be continued.... its a no no
I got a few games by mistake that till theses day never continued, so i make sure to never by episodic games ever again, so this falls into that... we'll maybe never see the ending of it.

thank you so much for making this, and thank you for adding Arabic subtitles

author: {'steamid': '76561197982961742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1620549821}
review:
A wonderfully sweet and charming game, with a lovely art style, delightful characters, excellent voice acting, and a story that had me asking questions from start to finish. There are some incredibly questionable (if I am charitable) design decisions on a few sections, such as the climbing in the graveyard section, but those comprise a tiny fraction of the game and are of negligible consequence compared to the truly incredible storytelling.

Excellent stuff. Very much hoping for a sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131702947', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1620131961}
review:
[i]Добротный квест. 
Пока проходила, не встретила ни одной ну прям очень тяжёлой головоломки, всё довольно простенькое. Сюжет интересный, ещё и обещающий продолжение. Светлая история, которая скрывает в своих уголках тёмные события, раскрывающие тайны небольшого городка, в котором проживает отважная Дженни. Но так ли она отважна, когда дело касается по-настоящему взрослых проблем? Так ли крепка её дружба и устоявшееся мнение о людях, проживающих рядом с ней?:) Всё это вы узнаете, если надумаете приобрести данный продукт.
Продолжению, судя по всему, быть. И я его обязательно приобрету.[/i]
[b] 9 кристаллов кварца из 10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198090834160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1620356583}
review:
I think the main character alone is a good selling point for this game. She's such a brat, and I love her for it.

That said, the writing is really solid and the voice acting sells a *lot* of complicated little nuances, so that's also great.

It's also the only Night-in-the-Woods-like that I've actually wanted to replay, so make of that what you will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417368580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1620208795}
review:
Jenny LeClue gives you an interesting storyline mixed with some fun humor. I find the occasional puzzles relaxing, some may find some of the puzzles tedious, some may say that they are too easy, but I enjoyed them as is.

IMO Jenny as a character is quite unpleasant and judgmental (though she has some great one-liners), but the wonderful cast of side characters more than makes up for it. Suzie and CJ are particularly delightful.

I'm eager to see where the story goes in the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402622630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1620163301}
review:
这游戏让我幻视oxenfree 同样的小镇风味和量子力学（*还没玩完OX），但的确是各有千秋。这作风格还是比较子供向，但绝不把小孩子当成大人的低配版，而是将一个稍复杂的故事通俗易懂地展现出来，这点一定要好评的。
画风6/10，剧情7.5/10，人物刻画7/10，解谜6/10，收集元素10/10，选择支8/10，内容展现10/10 综合建议是值得一玩 推荐打折入。
对了，这作确实没有揭露最核心的谜题，不过解决了一开始的谜题并给出了一个很有指向性的悬念，个人觉得不算烂尾，期待新作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198378655323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1619415998}
review: 很久没玩到这么丝滑可爱的侦探游戏了！解谜和推理流程都很流畅，不会卡关，人物个性也都萌萌，我爱苏西！科技宅傻白甜大小姐苏西跟珍妮这个傲娇太配了www故事剧情还是非常美式风格的，传统的小镇隐藏了个大阴谋设定，结尾留了个大悬念，希望能尽快玩到续作！

author: {'steamid': '76561198043911452', 'num_games_owned': 1602, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1619599203}
review: Admittedly, there are plenty of puzzles that require walkthroughs (for the slower-witted such as myself), but storywise, this is a wonderful satire that captures your attention from the get-go, and helps you stay engaged the entire way through! A must-buy for the adventure-lover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076201749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1618700159}
review:
Un jeu très sympathique mais peut-être un peu trop facile par moment . L'histoire est elle aussi très intéressante avec plusieurs niveaux de lecture sur l'intrigue. Gros bémol néanmoins sur la fin ... inexistante. On nous présente face à un choix très difficile, on a une scène de fins et PAF ! les crédits...
Avec encore un bon tiers de l'intrigue non résolue ! Peut-être qu'ils prévoient une suite au jeu, peut-être qu'ils ont été obligé de le sortir en l'état, mais ça reste une fin, qui à mon avis est inadéquate et laisse trop de choses en suspens pour un simple cliffhanger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091637608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1618577519}
review:
Надоели лутер-шутеры? Устали от игр-сервисов? Эта игра поможет ощутить сладкий вкус сюжета во рту. Сначала вас будут кормить сладкой ватой. Скорее вы подумаете, что эти изверги хотят засахарить вас, но... это лишь первое блюдо. Дальше будет только вкуснее! Необычные яства так и будут манить вас загадочным ароматом. И вы забудете о той сладкой вате.

Для меня эта игра - про "юную женскую версию Алана Уэйка". Если вы играли, то уже поняли о чём я, ведь так? Только тут всё настолько иммерсивно... разработчики постарались, чтобы вы ЛИЧНО прошли через это путешествие. Например, вы не можете просто выбить доски, которые загораживают путь. Вам нужно найти "уязвимости" в этих деревянных противниках. Более того! Они умудряются прятать своих "товарищей"! И таких загадок разной степени изобретательности тут море! И... они не надоедают!

Причём тут вам дают право выбора в диалогах и в некоторых ключевых решениях. Весь сюжет - сплошная загадка, которую надо разгадать. В этой игре... вы - судьба? Судьба - которая двигает героями этой игры. Почему? Сыграйте в Jenny LeClue - Detectivu и всё поймёте.

Игра проходится всего где-то за 12 часов. И знаете... вас расстроит концовка. Все пишут, что она всё испортила... она оборвала на самом интересном месте. Всё так. Но как по мне - интересен сам путь, а не то, чем он закончился. Если смотреть с этой стороны, то игра ШЕДЕВРАЛЬНА! Жаль, что вторую часть разработчики так и не анонсировали.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034204067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1618257790}
review:
Some general thoughts on the game:
- pretty easy
- irritating main character but that's subjective
- some dialog options that barely seem to have an impact throughout the game
- nice art style, nice voice-over overall, and an interesting way to illustrate solving mysteries/puzzles. Sadly the puzzles stay pretty basic and the presentation layer just slows you down on your way to solve obvious puzzles

My recommendation without spoiling too much is not to buy until a sequel is released and receives good  reviews. The game simply does not stand on its own as a satisfying experience. 

Spoilers ahead:
- around the 6-8h mark depending on how fast you play and if you look for collectibles, the game slows down to a glacial pace and you can feel the game trying to slow you down as much as possible (puzzles spread across vast empty spaces, constant back and forth, slow movement speed (can't run because... platforms, water, or have to climb vines), long tunnels etc. a puzzle is literally clicking words and then clicking words again and then clicking the letters which are already in the right order so as to decipher the message you could already read on your screen). This seems like hiding play time without adding content. At that stage, you feel like the ending just can't come soon enough because the gameplay is that tedious while there are some intriguing points being developed: the story takes a turn towards being a sci-fi mystery and you might feel intrigued by that
- that is, until the "ending" of the game gets shoved onto you in 2 or 3 cut scenes, with some entirely inconsequential choices being made (you get different achievements but that's it, besides some "setting up" for the next game) and the game simply does not end. None of the plot elements get resolved: one of the characters disappear and that's it, roll the credits. This feels like a bad TV show season finale with a cliffhanger after some tedious last hours. The developers coyly make that analogy below the fold of their Steam store page (I am trying really hard not to have a cynical view point here but, certainly, if the plan is for the game to be an episodic game, there are ways to clearly indicate that to the players rather than test their detective muscles on a game's store page already).

Without knowing what the pay off will be in a hypothetical second game, this game simply is not worth your time. Just wishlist the game and keep an eye out for when/if the second one is released. Playing this game will indubitably leave you with a bad taste in your mouth after some disappointing last hours and will unlikely make you want to play the second one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119212253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1618240367}
review: Most of the reviewers say that this game's puzzles are very easy but for me it was quite the opposite . Game never says anything about how to solve a puzzle (and not in a satisfying way) . Puzzles are just completely random and I couldn't even finish the game in order to see "the horrible ending" everyone is talking about .

author: {'steamid': '76561198155194910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1618067047}
review:
Jeu trop linéaire et énigmes trop simples.

Ce jeu est magnifique, l'histoire est plutôt intéressantes et les doublages sont très bons.
Malheureusement, moi qui m'attendais à un point and click avec un minimum de réflexion et de puzzles à résoudre... c'est la déception. Les puzzles  se résument à de la simple recherche sur écran (trouver des autocollants) ou à des actions répétitives sans enjeux ni réflexion.
Ce niveau peut convenir à de jeunes enfants (7 ans et +) mais en tant qu'adulte fan de point and click, je passe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030851165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1617915632}
review:
Отличная детективная история, которая поначалу притворяется чуть ли не детской, но оказывается научно-фантастической.
В игре хорошо всё: сценарий, визуальный стиль, техническое состояние. Придраться вообще не к чему.
Кроме одного момента - "продолжение следует..." Имейте ввиду, игра не полная.
И казалось бы ерунда. Мало что ли эпизодических игр. Нюанс в том, что в описании к игре нет ни слова об эпизодичности или о том, что это первая часть. Таким образом налицо введение покупателя в заблуждение (например меня). Только за это палец вниз.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116505585', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1617910153}
review: I wish there was a middle ground instead of just negative or positive, because I truly did love most of the game. I really did. author: {'steamid': '76561198407727599', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1617730525}
review:
Реально прошёл её за 15-ть часов . Замечательная игра , которую смело можно рекомендовать как любителям квестов , так и тем кому нравятся интерактивные книги (типа игр от Tell tales) . Касательно выборов , есть только один который хоть на что-то влияет : если вы соглашаетесь взять рацию у Сьюзэн , откроется дополнительная глава про слежку за человеком в чёрном , стоящим на мосту (насколько я понял , прочитав после прохождения гайд , я бы легко мог её пропустить если бы случайно не взял рацию) . В игре классная озвучка и весьма яркие запоминающиеся персонажи (кстати : актёр сыгравший Сиджея , очень сильно напоминает Кристофера Лойда (доктор Эммэт Браун из "Back to tehe future" Роберта Земекиса) . Что вполне вероятно , учитывая что ранее он участвовал в создании "Toon track" (1998) и "Back to the future" (2010) , кстати одна из лучших игр Telltales . Так что не вижу причин по которым он не мог и в 2020-м сыграть .
 И да , на самом деле игра обрывается .... в смысле сюжет обрывается в одном месте ,  и 
ЖДИТЕ ПРОДОЛЖЕНИЯ ....
которое может выйдет в 2022-2023-м , а может и нет . Для справки : игру сделали два человека (благодаря Kickstarter) и ни малейшей информации о разработке 2-й части мне в сети найти не удалось ....

author: {'steamid': '76561198327380570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1617602867}
review:
剧情挑不出毛病的游戏，就是故事没完结，很好奇最后的结局是什么样的。玩到中间的时候，突然感觉有点像怪诞小镇，小镇表面风平浪静但其实里面藏了一个巨大的阴谋，总之就是剧情还蛮吸引我的。
解密其实不难，其中一部分解密是很正统的推理，如果说解密的难度增加一些，比如说推理的过程由玩家完成然后jenny再进行一个总结我觉得会很好。
唯一要说的缺点的话就是每次的找碎纸片，这个过程占了玩家玩的30%，我以为会有一些线索在海报上对主线有些作用，但其实没有，就只是找出来拼海报和装饰日志的贴纸，就觉得有些赘余。
除此之外没有任何缺点，真的是一个老少皆宜的游戏，做的很棒！

author: {'steamid': '76561199088942085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1617640839}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046366321', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1617609977}
review:
上次打折得到时候买的，一直没玩现在想起来玩了。没想到现在还打折比之前还低。。
画面特别棒，剧情跟下来就跟看动画电影一样。特别喜欢推理的画面，跟其他解谜游戏不一样，会用涂鸦笔迹把整个解决思路绘制出来。但是解谜难度低了点，结合儿童文学的叙事或许整个游戏也特别适合小孩子玩。
剧情也算跌宕起伏，充分体现了现实和作者想法的冲突。但是最后这个坑真的无法接受，真的能期待到最后这个大坑填上的一天吗？结尾自己都写了绝对不咕咕，然而都这么久过去了。。
游戏有中文汉化，汉化质量还不错，就是小部分地方没有中文，替换成中文后有些位置看起来怪怪的。有能力直接看英文的话体验应该好一些。
游戏中选择分支还不少，但是不会影响太多，主要是剧情中间有些细微的区别。比如不拿指南针就不会有明显的发信器位置提醒，不拿对讲机后期也会强行出现走一样的剧情。
动画细节做的倒是不错，角色跑久了会越来越慢跑不动，停下来会大口喘气。表情也做得惟妙惟肖的。小团队能做这么细节实属不容易，但是也导致了工作量大做不过来，大量的选择分支没起到多少作用。从成就来看起码还有3个成就是因为游戏没做完导致没人完成的，故事最后的大坑也没来得及填上。
不同的选择会影响到性格评价（单纯的性格评价，不影响剧情），就跟一般做的性格测试有点像，但是简单多了。
然后说到成就问题，有3个是因为没做完无法完成外，I Work Alone、Team Work Makes The Dream Work、Deja Vu这三个好像有点问题。Deja Vu成就在直接读取一周目存档看完staff后没触发完成，新游戏+从头到尾玩一遍也没完成。而新游戏+二周目I Work Alone也没触发完成。不知道是不是只能单纯的新游戏开始二周目才行，从完成率来看明显是有问题的。打一遍至少要一天时间（自己二周目开的变速齿轮跳过大量无关紧要的调查花的时间也不少）实在是不想再做一次了，因为甚至做完了也不会全成就【

author: {'steamid': '76561198015858214', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1617496449}
review:
Overall I really enjoyed the story in this game and found myself getting invested in the characters. I had read reviews saying that the story ends abruptly and I can definitely see that...but I think knowing that beforehand helps take the edge off. This is a game that's obviously meant to have at least one sequel.

For some reason at the start I didn't expect to get as attached to the characters and story as I did. These developers know a thing or two about giving a character a hard time. I'd say the characters and atmosphere are the strongest aspects of this game. Jenny LeClue makes for a very likeable protagonist.

So, I'd definitely recommend this game...as long as you're ok with not having a full conclusion at the end and are willing to wait for when the sequel comes out. (and if you're not sure you could always get it on sale, I got it for around 4 euros)

author: {'steamid': '76561199106155659', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1617471863}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111526436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1594620946}
review:
This game has some puzzle elements but the aesthetics are the main workhorse for the game's interest. If you're put off by the geometric style and writing style, you're not gonna get into this.
For those the game appeals to in those regards, Jenny Leclue is a cute, cozy, narrative driven game with looming undertones of death and parental mismanagement. The town, visuals, and characters are all quite inviting in their simultaneously grounded yet eclectic nature. Jenny herself is a star, a self-driven Velma who wants to solve mysteries and hates boring excuses for real cases. The puzzle elements spring up time and again, and for the most part, they're fun though not very challenging. The case-solving and interviewing is also fun, and thankfully, solutions are not too obfuscated as you might see in a Phoenix Wright game. The OST is another great aspect, as scntfc of Oxenfree puts in some great, atmospheric tunes that lean well on synth strings and other instruments for its soundscape. An indie darling and a personal favorite of mine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377995775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1614983997}
review:
This game is so infuriating. the story has gone a whole other way to what the trailer has promised me. The Main character is annoying to my standards, others may like her and adore her, but not me, ooooh no. The controls are so... weird? it's hard to control the character at times, specially the boat puzzle. that took longer than it needed.
The puzzles in general are so repetitive that it's not even funny. At first I though it would get harder as the game went, or maybe thy would change the layout. Nope. They are all the same formal, layout and difficulty level.
The story... I tried to like it, I really did but the fact that I don't like the main character to begin with makes me hate everything related to her or the way she acts around others (to me she's just a little spoiled brat)

The only positives about this game is the graphics and visuals. That was one of the biggest factors as to why I bought this game in the first place. The colors are gorgeous and so are the scenery in the background. Plus the ambiance.

This game could of been so much more, but it really didn't deliver what I was hopping for, I really regret making this purchase and forcing myself to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267992223', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1673841735}

author: {'steamid': '76561198873727744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1616889417}
review:
I honestly feel like I had the wrong idea of the game before going into it, so I want you guys to know that it is a story book game rather than a puzzle mystery game! If I knew that I would have enjoyed it immensely 

This game's graphics are really really beautiful and the story seems pretty interesting, but the only downside that made me not able to finish this game is how slow it is. It feels like they are holding my hand throughout the entire game and it doesn't really feel like a mystery game at all. I feel like if I knew it was going to be more of a story rather than a decision/detective game, I might have enjoyed it. It has the same puzzles over and over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298176243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3940, 'last_played': 1616861323}
review: Really interesting story. Hopefully they make a second chapter. A lot of tension gets put on certain choices that I don't think actually make a lot of difference to the gameplay, so don't stress yourself out too much when you're forced to make hard choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004211374', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1615926843}
review:

Jenny LeClue did that for me. An interesting story where I thought "Where is this going?" all the time, backed up by an amazing artstyle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1615082490}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a fun adventure game. In some ways it's perhaps a bit more like a walking sim, because there aren't any traditional inventory puzzles, you basically just wander about and find hot spots to advance the story. There are a few puzzle-ish minigames, but nothing that will greatly tax the mind. The main reason to play this is for the plot and the characters. Jenny is precocious but lovable, and it's fun watching her try to solve the mystery. Be aware, though, that the mystery never gets solved! In the big finale of the game, just when you're about to uncover all the secrets of the town, it ends. "To be continued..." It's an enjoyable romp beforehand, but if you really want closure it might be better to wait for a sequel to arrive.

Aside from the abrupt non-ending, the only other complaint I have about this game is that the control scheme really sucks. It's mildly annoying to move Jenny around with WASD (while holding shift so she runs), but the real pain is when you are searching for clues and have to scroll a cursor around the screen very slowly, also with WASD. It seems like a missed opportunity to use the mouse there. Still, this is a wholesome adventure with nice animation and solid voice acting. Definitely worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963108041', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1615004741}
review: WOW! What an excellent entry into the adventure game genre. I am blown away at the quality of this game. The art style is so beautiful. The writing is fun and light, even when dealing with the darker aspects of the plot. While the puzzles aren't too difficult, they do make sense (no moon logic!). The voice acting is wonderful, and the soundtrack is so good! I knew the music sounded familiar and it was produced by the same team that did the Oxenfree OST.  I can't wait to play the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561199027017512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1661991454}
review:
Hay que rejugarlo, eso está más que claro. Hay muchas decisiones que tomar y, aunque no creo que ninguna sea incorrecta en sí, muchas dudas quedan sin resolver en una sola partida.
Me resulta difícil escribir una reseña sin spoilers, así que iré a lo básico: Sin revolucionar nada concreto en el mundo de los videojuegos, gráficamente es excepcional, sobre todo por las sobresalientes animaciones, además de contar con un doblaje fantástico, imaginativos rompecabezas y mecánicas de juego divertidas y muy variadas. Tiene una ambientación inmejorable, llena de personajes exagerados y sin embargo creíbles y magníficos (especialmente nuestra protagonista) y un sentido del humor muy simple, pero refinado. 
No sé cómo será o habrá sido para otros jugadores, pero yo me quedo con ganas de más. MUCHO más. No, en serio. Ojalá no me lo hubiera pasado y siguiera jugándolo.
Una auténtica maravilla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086681617', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1614725087}
review:
Jenny Leclue,es una chica que sueña con ser detective,pero tiene un problema y es que en su ciudad nunca pasa nada,con lo cual se siente decepcionada.Hasta que un dia,se produce un asesinato y todas las pruebas apuntan a su madre. Apartir de ese momento, habra que intentar resolver por que se ha producido el asesinato y si su madre es inocente o culpable.

En su dia,los autores comentaron que este juego seria una trilogia,con lo cual este juego seria la 1 parte de la trilogia.

El juego es una aventura grafica de scroll lateral,con algunas partes de plataformas y con gran carga narrativa.

Aspectos Positivos: Jenny tiene una personalidad arrolladora,graficamente es precioso,Suzie Glatz en ciertos momentos tiene mas carisma que la propia Jenny. Buen argumento.Al que le guste el coleccionismo,se puede poner a buscar pegatinas  y trozos de fotos,poder volver a jugar episodios ya completados, segun las decisiones que tomes, te afectara a 3 barras de personalidad(aunque no afectara en ningun momento en la historia)

Aspectos negativos:El mapa del diario no sirve para nada,en algunas partes del juego los textos estan sin traduccir (puzzles de documentos),no se puede salir,ni avanzar en la historia en ciertos puzzles,hasta que los soluciones .algunos puzzles pecan de  ser repititivos,el juego cuando hay que hacer acciones te sale con el icono de cruceta del mando para pulsar....pero no es la cruceta lo que hay que pulsar, sino los botones de colores(cada color, segun la posicion de la cruceta).El sonido, es lo mas flojo del juego

Jenny Leclue a pesar de sus cosillas, es buen juego,quiza cueste un rato al principio meterse en su historia y sus puzzles sean faciles exceptuando 1 o 2...pero al final te terminas enganchando.Un juego de 7,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198092344121', 'num_games_owned': 1789, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1614917228}
review:
Wow! What an incredible game.

You can tell the creators made movies. When I played for an hour or two, I felt like I had been playing for hours. I have yet to play another game so enthralling. The superb voice acting adds to the already charming and likable characters. I'm glad I played after they were added. The sound effects are top-notch too. I love the sound when you try and push Jenny off a cliff. It's as addicting a sound as when you run over people on Grand Theft Auto. I have to admit I jumped twice too. "What should I wear" to the graveyard and "I found the cutest frog" are some great lines by Suzie.

It is a little linear, and the puzzles aren't that hard, and some of the walking and cave scenes go on for too long. But considering the story, the fact that you have hidden objects to find, and there's a lot of replayability with the choices you make, this game is a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129474615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1614528383}
review:
披着儿童向作品的外衣，又是一个量子玄学内核的故事。从讲故事的角度来看，质量确实不错，情节环环相扣，确实做到了意料之外，但又在情理之中，至少我在这十个小时的游戏过程中，还挺有代入感，唯一值得吐槽的剧情问题就是，喜欢用一惊一乍来凸显恐怖，年纪大了，这么吓一跳真的是心跳少一拍，建议还是使用更多的游戏环节：比如追击、限时解谜等，来提升紧张的节奏。
从游戏性来说，还是过于简单了，解谜部分基本没有难度，而且为了使所有人都能完成剧情，无论做什么选择，都可以给过或者解释通，让趣味减少了挺多；但是通过不同的抉择，给出了一个类似心理学性格的评价，感觉有点新奇，也算是对关卡如此简单的一个小福利吧。不过既然开了一个坑，后续还是值得期待的，希望不要是有生之年系列。
PS. 中文翻译还有值得提高的地方，加油，期待episode 2！

author: {'steamid': '76561197994339774', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1613928917}
review:
Niniejszy tytuł jest kolejnym, który uświadamia mi, iż obecnie w pierwszej kolejności szukam w grach swego rodzaju innowacji. I nie mam na myśli tutaj wymyślnych mechanik czy niestworzonych historii - a raczej kreatywne odtwórstwo. Nie oczekuję, że twórcy wpadną na pomysł, którego nie poruszył nikt inny w historii. Nie chcę też, aby odkrywali koło na nowo.

Ale można mnie kupić w bardzo łatwy sposób – przedstawiając dość interesującą, chociaż nieprzesadnie odkrywczą fabułę przy pomocy przyjemnej oprawy graficzno-dźwiękowej, okraszając to wszystko przygodową formą. Nieprzesiąkniętą zagadkami – to jest klucz wszystkich gier tego typu, które mnie urzekły w ostatnich latach.

Nie szukam doznań, za którymi rzewnie spoglądają point’n’clickowi wyjadacze wychowani na grach z lat dziewięćdziesiąt. Właściwie – jestem przeciwnikiem powtarzania tego wszystkiego, co wtedy się w grach (niby) sprawdzało. To tanie wyjście. To niekreatywne odtwórstwo. 

Szeroko rozumiane zagadki powinny stanowić dla mnie tło ciekawej historii. Przeważać powinna FORMA zagadek – to, jak wkomponowują się one w przedstawianą fabułę, w mechaniki rozgrywki, w przeżycia postaci. Czy to wszystko tworzy jedną, spójną całość – i jakość.

Jenny jest jednym z takich tytułów, któremu się to udaje. Proste przygodówkowe puzzle wplecione są bardzo zręcznie w rozgrywkę. Stanowią tło wielu wydarzeń, ale nie mamy wrażenia, że bezsensownie przesuwamy klocki, aby przejść dalej – lecz, że odkrywamy z napięciem historię przy pomocy inherentnych umiejętności protagonistki. Zagadki są tutaj formą prowadzenia i budowania fabuły – a nie wyłącznie rozpraszaczem uwagi i przeszkodą do obejścia.

Pod tym względem Jenny LeClue stoi na bardzo wysokim poziomie. Nie sposób jednak nie dostrzec kilku mankamentów. Po pierwsze – doceniam sposób kreacji przedstawionego świata – miał być nieco infantylny, kreskówkowy i humorystyczny. Mam wrażenie jednak, że niektóre sytuacje pasują do innych jak pięść do nosa. Nie kontrastują ze sobą należycie, dopełniając się – raczej mamy wrażenie, że ktoś musiał po prostu dopisać scenę czy linijkę dialogu, nie mając do końca na to pomysłu… Ale to naprawdę rzadkość.

Ponadto jest jedna rzecz, za którą nie przepadam w wielu mediach artystycznych; nie chcąc zdradzać szczegółów historii powiem tylko tyle – nie jestem fanem łamania czwartej ściany. Nieodpowiednio umiejętnie wykorzystanie tego zabiegu powoduje, że tracę zainteresowanie. Książki, gry, seriale mają stanowić swego rodzaju odskocznię od rzeczywistości, mają dawać mi iluzję realizmu – nie lubię więc, gdy przypominają mi, że tak nie jest.

Ostatecznie – Jenny LeClue cierpi nieco na to samo, co wiele innych tytułów tego typu. W pewnym momencie twórcy stwierdzają, że gra kończy się nieco zbyt szybko – albo, że przed postacią muszą pojawić się coraz to kolejne i kolejne przeszkody. Wrzucają więc nas w długą wyprawę po tunelach, lochach, lasach czy kopalniach. I gdyby było to urozmaicone – w porządku. Ale nierzadko musimy drążyć poprzez te identyczne kopalniane tunele przez długie minuty… Aż w końcu zapominamy, co w ogóle tam robiliśmy. Jenny niestety cierpi na tego typu problem z utrzymaniem tempa rozgrywki, ostatnia godzina gry pod tym względem wiele traci.

Mimo wszystko jednak nie można nie oddać tego autorom, iż do końca trzymali mnie w napięciu. Szkoda jednak, że ostatecznie zakończenie pozostawia wiele do życzenia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354221429', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1614190967}
review:
[h1]  总体评分：7/10[/h1]

[h1] 剧情：8/10 [/h1]

《珍妮的线索》有着双故事线，表线是通过展示新书销量不佳即将被拒稿的作家和企图扭转作家写作思路的编剧的矛盾，来推动里线也就是珍妮的冒险的进展。故事以沉闷的亚瑟镇为背景,当珍妮的母亲被指控谋杀了学校校长时，她接受了突如其来的机会，并踏上一段意想不到的寻找真相之旅。但她很快发现，如诗如画的亚瑟镇并不像表面看起来那样平凡，而潜藏的势力则会不顾一切地阻止珍妮揭露真相。她需要倾尽所有推理技巧来找到真正的凶手，洗清母亲的污名。在这段冒险中，珍妮也懂得了友情的真谛并得到了真正值得信赖依靠的朋友。（所以这其实是一部百合游戏？）

[h1] 画面+BGM：8/10 [/h1]

游戏中可以探索亚瑟镇的广袤世界，包括废弃的矿井、被遗忘的墓地、无名湖与甘伯特图书馆。不得不说场景的刻画还是蛮用心的，人物也很可爱。有一说一买这个游戏的诸位最开始也想必都是被画面吸引来的吧。


[h1]  游戏性：6/10[/h1]

游戏最大的缺点就是解迷太重复了，可以说是我玩过最简单的解迷游戏。。感觉很多成分都是动作类的（但是也毫无操作难度），大概是因为这个游戏的场景比较多所导致的游戏性取舍。希望第二部能增加多点解迷的套路（这里要夸一夸纠缠塔，同样是天坑不过纠缠塔的解迷要素明显更侧重的多）

不过游戏上相比较一般的解迷游戏，又加入了很多的对话选项 。虽然说选择结果不影响剧情，但是最后可以通过日志看到类似于心理测试的性格分析表，这一点还是蛮趣味的。


[h1]  游后感：（涉嫌大量剧透，慎入）[/h1]

刚开始有些无聊，还以为是子供向的剧情，没想到后面才开始开大（果然"遇事不决、量子力学")。
可惜结局坑只埋了浅显的一部分，这一部应该是该系列的开山之作，感觉接下来还能扯出更大的剧情线
(比如谁在图书馆报的警、苏西的家族和三人议会的关联、为什么警长要把案件给苏西家族看、矿山幽灵和黑衣人可以虚空走路是否证明这些人都已经量子化、爸爸和扎则被困在另一边以及小镇的消失是否意味着整个小镇其实都已经量子化了，现在是存在着两个时空、结局最后可以三选一个主角消失，是否其实是选一个传送去另一个时空）
感觉第二部的故事还是可以猜到一部分的了已经，不过我还是相当期待的，毕竟子供向画面加入偏成人的科幻要素，谁能抵挡的住呢？（吹一句，南方公园yyds)


总之，按现在的剧情，打折买还是非常值得的，而且作为一个小众的游戏有中文已经是非常友好的了，希望制作组再接再厉，快点出续作骗我钱

author: {'steamid': '76561198068531722', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1613786608}
review:
Judging from any angle, this game is an absolute masterpiece, a hidden gem like no other!

The story is solid, very well-written, and engrossing from the very first moments. It begins as a childish play, but swiftly develops into something grimmer than anticipated from the overview, at the end startling by its ingenious complexity. The elements of a detective story are supported by those of a platformer and visual novel; all of them are implemented perfectly, thus creating a unique impression. I’d choose not to dwell on that, though – there is a nicely written description at the store page, so let’s not spend any more time on that. 

The odds are that you decided to check the reviews after being fascinated by the visual part. It is indubitably the most stunning part of the game; throughout my play, I made nearly 50 screenshots – and I wouldn’t say it is a lot as every single frame of this semi-film is worth saving and looking at. Along with that, I can't help but mention the voice-over – the actors made an incredibly good job. Together with the visuals, this part played a decisive role in my decision to try the game.

A common mistake in designing an adventure-style game is making the main hero a superhero, which, fortunately, is not the case here. Jenny, being a world's greatest detective (no doubts about that), has her weaknesses, and they are completely understandable given her age and the situations she finds herself in. Guiding her throughout her journey feels seamless and real – sometimes, you could get frustrated with her thinking or actions; but she is a little girl after all, and she behaves accordingly. Emotionally, she is depicted not as an ideal main hero, but as a human being in the first place.

Some of the reviews claim the story ends abruptly. I had read them beforehand and was ready to suddenly see a flash, and a black screen, and the names of all the great people who invested their efforts in creating the game. Now, after finishing it myself, I could say with all my honesty that the developers answered all the questions they posed throughout this chapter of the story. During the last 30 minutes, they created a base to start their next game from; yes, it can be called a cliffhanger, but it is not as burning as some people are trying to illustrate.

Overall, I am enormously impressed by the quality of the game. This level of sophistication in both story and art, and attention to minute details could be expected from world-renowned studious, but not from such a tiny team of developers. They tried their best and made an incredible job; undoubtedly, their creation costs way more than they ask for it. 

Best of luck to them. They created a sound foundation for a great story – let's hope they will live up to our expectations and the quality of their first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079877823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1613964406}
review:
It turns out, after playing the whole game, that this is Episode 1. 

I think that had I known this in advance, I would not have minded that that this ended so inconclusively. 

This is (as Arthur would probably say) an infuriating blunder.   As it is, it's going to take a major Steam sale to make be take this bait again.  

I think that this can be recommended with the caveat that the purchaser must understand that the ending is entirely unsatisfactory. The game is often engaging.  The main drawback there is too much make-work thrown in (the barriers in the mines that have to be clicked on over and over for no good reason, as an example) to pad it out.  

Perhaps next time the developers will omit that kind of game play, and if they can possibly manage it, include an ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989674036', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1621361873}
review:
I just finished the game today... I only want to say THANK YOU. This game was everything. What an amazing writing, characters, story - everything is perfect. What a great Voice acting! The ending was just PERFECT. It ends like all the good stories should end - when you want more. Remember Dreamfall, remember Syberia. So excuse me, but all the people who say "ending is bad"... ummm... this game is much more and deep than regular detective stories - it is unique and it ends just how it's supposed to end. 
I can't wait for the second part. And thank you so so much. I smiled, I laughed and I cried in the end. A real masterpiece!  https://youtu.be/kzafI9cASbE

author: {'steamid': '76561199072184721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1613674939}
review:
First and foremost: If you are looking for a challenge, this isn't the right game for you.
The "puzzles" are mainly just designed to make you [i]feel[/i] like you added to the progress of the story.
This is a game you are playing for the atmosphere, the humour, the intriguing story and the artwork.

But that isn't why I'm giving this game a thumbs down.
In fact it kinda pains me to do so because right up to the so called "ending" I would have given it a thumbs up without any reservation.
You see, the ending isn't really an ending at all but a giant cliffhanger.
You get no closure whatsoever. And the developers are fully aware of it.
The narrative framework is that of a book being written and it doesn't get finished in this game.

The way I see it, this is at least a case of misleading advertisement.
Had the game been called "Jenny LeClue - Detectivu Part 1" it had earned a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022666023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1613691446}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068171114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1613213265}
review: Most of the puzzles are really easy and just revolve around wasting time or fall back on the same dial one. It ends on a cliffhanger, which is dumb. The designs and art style is kind of neat, but beyond that there isn't really anything unique. The most interesting thing about it are the sci fi in a small town mystery ideas that were used in gravity falls and the concept that it was originally an encyclopedia brown style story that just randomly became a murder plot, but since it doesn't explain the sci fi elements and since the encyclopedia brown kids mystery elements are only in the first half of the story as an introduction, most of it is pretty dull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035730335', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1613678994}
review:
LOVING THIS GAME, has been years since I have wanted to play a game start to finish in one go.

A warning do not look at this game like an average click and point if you can let go and except the fact it is more like an interactive movie you'll like it.

The game does start off slow but just stick with it and you will find along the way you will start to yourself think who could it be and how, where and whats going on lol.

You're a young girl who is the daughter of a forensic university tutor and stuck in a hum drum sleep town, wishing for more excitement and real cases to work on. You are however a character in a novel and your author is being pressured to make your novel more dark and you get your wish, but at a price. You navigate your way around solving clues with twists and turns, trying to solve the 'murder'. You will find information along the way.

The areas are beautiful and some are eerie and the voice acting is really well done, the dialog is funny as you will find our novel hero will argue with her author as he reallly doesn't want to write the dark story and put her in danger. I found this charming and funny. Strange as it may seem but you find if you watch it like a movie you find yourself getting emotionally involved especially as you can select the reactions and reply options. I'm personally gonna stick it to her mother she seems a witch and not in the hocus pocus sense!.  This is what I am taking from the game not what it is so no spoiler. 

You have things to find just little rewards and one way to interact is you get a magnifying glass which can be hard to find the exact spot to use it on.  it is not a mouse using game and you use WASD to move around and when there is an interacting part a green diamond will appear and you just press enter and it will do a vocal part etc.

I don't want to say much more other than give this game a try but give it a chance to get into it before you decided its too boring etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198973658670', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1613366197}
review:
I would really like this game to be a big series or something, because it's just that good.

It's a story about a writer who needs to kill somebody in his mystery series. Jenny LeClue is the main character. And I love her dearly, even if she is a bit rough around the edges. She finally gets the mystery she wants, even if she didn't plan it that way.

It's basically a point-and-click mystery game sprinkled with puzzles. I like a lot of the deduction and observations you get to do, makes me think a little bit of the detective work in Agatha Christie's ABC Murder's game.

Pros:
Entertaining puzzles. Do repeat sometimes, which can be annoying if it was a puzzle you didn't like but it isn't terrible. 
Art work is AMAZING! A mixture of Agent A I think and, on an unrelated note, The X's cartoon. Very colorful and well made.
You feel like a real detective. From using a magnifying glass to find clues to observing the little details of a person, you feel like a detective even with the littlest cases.
Story, for the most part, is 10/10. Keeps you on the edge of your seat and I really like the bits with the writer, relating quite a bit of it. Characters are amazing as well, even if they do rebel against the plot sometimes. I also really liked the dialogue choices, just the little things you wanted to say.
You can find stickers and put them in your journal. What else is better than that??

Cons:
Controls seemed a bit wonky, don't know if that's me. Had trouble going up ladders; would get to the top and sometimes fall off. Would have to go really slowly at the top to finally get off. Climbing and grabbing were the same; grab when I wanted to climb and climb when I wanted to grab. Might just be a me thing but got on my nerves.
The ending. Won't give any spoilers of what happens, but it ends on a cliffhanger. A literal To Be Continued and Thats. It. Cue credits and you're just sitting there staring at the screen thinking 'that's it??' The story isn't finished by any means, some questions are still left to be answered. The story was getting long at this point, but I didn't expect it to just END!

Other than that, I really did like the game. Still a bit annoyed about the ending, but I am glad I got the game and hope that soon-please, let it be very soon-there'll be a sequel. I would love even more than just an end to this story, maybe even more cases. The writer did write 30+ books of Jenny LeClue; he can make more mysteries, can't he?

Random note: I don't know why it's considered horror; there are some jumpscares, but it's no horror game. Another little note there is swearing; various uses of the D word and h*ll but that's it if that concerns you. I got it on sale, not sure if it's exactly worth 20 but I am cheap. Maybe 15 if that gives you any idea? It's a long game, just finished, might would've took either longer or shorter knowing what to do on certain puzzles and finding all the collectibles/achievements.

Other than that, I recommend this game! Hope you enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198145692025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1613375942}
review:
Ich.. bin enttäuscht.
Dieses Spiel war die letzten 2 Tage mein Go-To-Game. 
Es war so fesselnd, spannend, lustig und schön anzusehen.
Ich habe mit Jenny gefühlt, hab mit ihr gelacht, mich mit ihr erschreckt.
Und dann? Wenn sich das große Mysterium auflösen will? "Fortsetzung folgt.."
Ich bin traurig und enttäuscht und habe noch so viele Fragen offen.
Ich empfehle, dieses Spiel erst zu spielen, wenn es auch eine Fortsetzung gibt. 
Ohne diese ist es einfach zu abrupt und unvollkommen. So schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123892093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1613248344}
review:
Honestly, I enjoy the game until the ending... what a way to ruin everything. The game doesn't finish, just let's you with open questions to resolve in the second game.
But where they say this is an episodic game?
The whole point of a Detective game it's solving a mystery and find what happen... How can they betray you like this and expect you to buy their second game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198434505097', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1648201605}
review: Одна из лучших инди игр в которые я играл.Одна только возможность украшать журнал многого стоит. Очень приятная графика. Сюжет объёмный, даже не уместился в одну игру, и увлекательный настолько, что каждый раз когда я хотел поиграть в неё часик перед сном, засиживался в ней до часу ночи. Так же , лично мне, очень понравилось повествование истории. Озвучка хороша, и саундтрек подходит игре. Загадки довольно простые и я считаю что это хорошо, потому что они заставляют твои мозги пошевелиться, но при этом не приходится тыкаться во всё подряд пока "всё само не натыкается". Все персонажи проработаны и по-своему интересные. Люди говорят что игра детская, и я с этим соглашусь, но это не делает её менее интересной. Юмор в игре безобидный (прям как я люблю). Заметно что множество механик и идей не были реализованы , но полагаю будут реализованы в следующей игре. Да, игра обрывается на самом интересном моменте, но таких моментов в игре много, так что не очень обидно. Игру явно удобнее проходить на контроллере, но и управление на клавиатуре весьма неплохое. Любопытство кстати игрой поощряется. Даже несмотря на то что игра незаконченная , она мне понравилась и теперь я с нетерпением жду продолжения. Вообщем рекомендую к покупке даже за фул прайс. Я даже не подозревал что в инди игре на прохождение можно потратить двенадцать часов.
