review:
Estética:
-La parte artística del juego es hermosa y es lo que más destaco del juego.

Jugabilidad:
-Los puzzles son repetitivos a más no poder y en general son muy fáciles.
-Jugar con teclado es super incomodo.
-Las decisiones no afectan en nada significativo.

Historia:
Es divertida y me atrapo, fue la razón de seguir jugando pese a que no me gusto la jugabilidad.
Pero.... el final del juego fue tan pero tan malo, que me arrepiento de haber seguido jugando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392381342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1613178343}
review:
Great story and immersive atmosphere accompanied with a somewhat weak gameplay. That’s an accurate summary of this game. It’s really a shame that the gameplay is only decent at best and even bad at worst, as that’s the only thing stopping the game from being a must-play Adventure game. 

Mr. Russ and Mr. Tillet, please hire more game designer for the next sequel in the trilogy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408251364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1657361956}
review:
非常优秀的作品,几乎没有缺陷的一部神作,墙裂推荐
画风可爱但是实际上是一部适应年龄段包含青年的游戏
建议有侦探梦想的童鞋们赶紧入手,这个好游戏不应该没埋没

如果有人说这个游戏结尾未完待续之类给差评的话我只能说,开发者给我发过邮件,说他们已经开始Jenny LeClue2的开发了

PS：不要吐槽我糟糕的英语

We have started work on Jenny LeClue 2, so thanks for playing and for your patients while we work on the next installment!

Joe

author: {'steamid': '76561198353098424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1626195652}
review:
[h1] Великий детектив завжди… [/h1]

Пригода Джені Ле-Клю, без сумніву, була цікавим досвідом. Гра надзвичайно деталізована, сповнена дотепними жартами і таємницями. Для любителів "збиральництва" є можливість вишукувати наліпки, що розкидані сям-там по локаціях. Головоломки в грі не дуже складні, але часто вимагають багато зайвих рухів, що трохи надокучає. Цікаво висвітлені взаємини письменника — який виступає в грі оповідачем — зі своїми персонажами. На мою думку, гра справить неабияке враження на дитину, але й дорослим може припасти до смаку. 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198375212582', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1611533010}
review:
Jenny LeClue - Detectivu é um jogo de plataforma 2D divertido, mas não se engane, não é um jogo de detetive e sim um jogo de aventura, quase toda parte de investigação é bem guiada e isso tira parte da diversão do jogo, pois é só apertar várias vezes um botão para fazer deduções e encontrar alguns itens, o jogo também apresenta uma parte de fazer escolhas que supostamente deveriam mudar a estória, mas poucas mudam algo o que é bem decepcionante. Em compensação o jogo possui personagens divertidos, principalmente Jenny LeClue, sim ela é uma ótima protagonista e consegue fazer a gente se preocupar e torcer para ela atingir seus objetivos, a história também é boa e consegue nos deixar envolvidos, mas não é perfeita, pois termina deixando várias pontas sem nós, provavelmente para concluí-las numa continuação, e claro tem o plot twist do final do jogo que é nada haver, totalmente inesperado e talvez desnecessário, não sei como os responsáveis pelo roteiro mantiveram isso. Se houver uma continuação espero que eles amarrem todas as pontas soltas e resolvam o que acontece no final do game.

Mas no fim das contas valeu a pena acompanhar Jenny LeClue em seu grande caso, ou na primeira parte dele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094349654', 'num_games_owned': 1922, 'num_reviews': 575, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1613383385}
review:
Прохождение: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mqBz55tU1bU

Jenny LeClue - Detectivu - милое детективное приключение, особенность которого заключается в том, что в роли детектива выступает маленькая девочка. Сюжет завязывается на убийстве, в котором обвиняют маму Дженни, и девочка отправляется на поиски правды. Сюжет очень интересный, невозможно оторваться. Разочаровывает только концовка, так как ее нет - в определенный момент игра обрывается со словами "продолжение следует". Геймплей довольно линейный и простой, но не надоедает. Локаций много, они постоянно меняются. Управление очень удобное на геймпаде. Выглядит и звучит игра отлично. Очень рекомендую!

review: A delightfully charming and fun detective game with some great mysteries running through it. The player choice has minor effects on the story, but those choices will persist throughout your gameplay experience from beginning to end. Being able to go back and select scenes to replay areas and hunt for missing items, even to see how different choices affect the rest of the story, is a very nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081501020', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1612210424}
review:
Selbstbewusst, intelligent, neugierig, mutig - Jenny LeClue

Der Autor Arthur K. Finklestein schreibt und erzählt die Geschichte der Detektivs Tochter Jenny LeClue. Dabei erwartet sein Verlag einen Todesfall in seinem nächsten Buch. Immer wieder stößt der Autor dabei an seine Grenzen. - Ein Todesfall... in seiner Geschichte? - Auf keinen Fall... aber er hat keine Wahl!

Jenny möchte in die Fußstapfen ihrer Mutter treten und unbedingt einen echten Fall lösen. Dabei vertraut sie ihrer Intuition und sucht bei allen Ereignissen nach der Wahrheit. Sie kann Umgebungen während Dialog-Szenen untersuchen, Objekte analysieren und Hinweise finden und zwischen Schuld und Unschuld unterscheiden. In Dialogen entscheidet man sich zwischen zwei Antwortmöglichkeiten, wobei jede Antwort Auswirkung auf den weiteren Spielverlauf hat. Jenny führt außerdem ein Notizbuch mit sich, indem sie alle wichtigen Informationen, die sie benötigt einträgt. Man kann diverse Sticker und Postkarten Schnipsel finden und diese in das Notizbuch einkleben. 

Die Rätsel und das Lösen der einzelnen Fälle sind recht einfach und das Spielgeschehen ist Lienar. Fehler sind so gut wie ausgeschlossen, da man auf bestimmten Screens verbleibt, bis die Lösung gefunden wurde. Insgesamt macht das Spiel wirklich Spaß. Der Humor ist super und die Mischung aus Erzählung des Autors und der direkten Reaktion von Jenny sind wirklich sehr gelungen. Die Story ist spannend und sehr unterhaltsam. 

Als Grafik dient ein handgezeichneter Vintage-Look, der mir sehr gefällt! Der Soundtrack für Jenny LeClue stammt vom Komponist C. Andrew Rohrmann, welcher bereits die Musik für Oxenfree und Old Man’s Journey komponierte.

10h Spielzeit sind durchaus drin, man sollte aber darauf achten wann das Spiel zuletzt gespeichert hat (wird auf dem Titelscreen angezeigt), da man selbst keine Möglichkeit hat manuell zu speichern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171033130', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1612161166}
review:
Although overly generic in parts the story does manage to build a decently interesting mystery by the end, with lots of substance to the art and atmosphere besides. 


Unfortunate that a second game will be required for the story to conclude, and for that reason players are probably better off waiting until the next game is finished before they play this one. As the momentum built up here will fade the longer players have to wait for the next game to come out, so they can experience the rest of the plot.

The art, music, atmosphere and animations are all quite thorough. It's certainly a visually polished experience for the most part. The full voice acting ontop of all that gives the game a lot of production quality. The puzzles are a decent balance between intuitive and satisfying although they do lean towards being fairly easy. There's a moderate amount of other gameplay elements but generally the experience is most shallow during the select extended sequences of just gameplay that occur sometimes, mainly towards the latter half. But these gameplay sequences are well paced and give the plot a sense of journey to it.

The story is as mentioned, generic in a fair amount of ways. The plot is interwoven with the concept of a writer typing out a book, and they narrate the plot while their own story as a writer is playing out simultaneously. This aspect of the game is pretty unique and adds an engaging secondary element to things. However the actual, dramatic novel esque narration the writer contributes to the experience is not especially enriching as it's mostly just pointless drama mongering that doesn't further the plot in any way. In turn the actual story itself feels like a somewhat tacky mystery. There's just a lot of typical, textbook elements and twists that are overly familiar by now in the genre. To some degree this plays well into the idea that this story is all being written by a writer, but it's still tacky all the same.

Despite that as the story progresses and the mystery compounds it does generate a solidly gripping degree of intrigue. The question is whether all that intrigue will climax in a genuinely interesting conclusion or if the conclusion will be just as stock as a lot of the supporting elements the mystery has. Which remains to be seen since the story is not finished in this game, and is expected to be concluded in the second one.

The conclusion is really what will make or break the integrity of this whole experience. It has distinct production quality, but the actual script is fairly generic with lots of familiar mystery genre commonalities. Players spend a lot of time alone with the protagonist and as a result much of the experience is padded with adventure game style puzzles and gameplay blockages over extensive dialogue and character building. 


It's not especially bad, there's certainly a lot of decent substance to this experience for the price, and it's set up the potential for an interesting reveal. But if the reveal turns out to be just a lackluster, predictable sputter of drama over a genuinely creative yet sensible twist then it will cast the rest of the so so plot in a very bad light.

If you're interested in finding more games like this I've probably reviewed quite a few on my curator page [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38950844-Anoemalous/] here [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198054608639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1611973629}
review:
I would recommend Jenny LeClue for younger players, maybe 8-12. I think older players may find it too easy.
 
The Good:

The art is ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. Totally drop dead gorgeous at all times, and the characters are well-designed and voiced. The entire thing feels extremely polished and cohesive, and it's a real treat to just gawk at the environments. I also loved all the little details like the way the text would shake when a character was angry or excited. Again, it just felt super polished. A lot of love clearly went into this game, and the music is pretty good too.

The Meh:

Overall, I enjoyed the story and found it intriguing, but it didn't feel very much like a detective game to me. Yes, there was a mystery, but the investigation felt spoon-fed. Most of the deductions were very easy or trivial. I also didn't like how zoomed in many of the puzzles were (forcing you to pan around to see everything). It felt like something that might be necessary if the game was played on a phone, but since I played on a PC, it felt strange. Similarly, the platforming aspect didn't feel right to me. I assume they made the controls the way they did in order to avoid letting the player fling Jenny off cliffs and what not, but it just didn't feel fun. I would have preferred traditional platforming (ie, press space bar to jump) or to just remove those parts all together. In general, I would have preferred the game to be point-and-click style, because I found the keyboard controls really clunky and confusing sometimes.

Obligatory note: this is not a "complete" game in the sense that it ends on a serious cliffhanger. You only partially solve the mystery, so it's good to know that before you buy. It says "To be continued," but I'm not sure when it will continue, unfortunately. Regardless, I still think it's worth the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1611870935}
review:
Un'avventura moderna, brillante, appassionante. Moderna nel senso che il gioco è fluido, forse non rappresenta una sfida ma almeno scorre narrativamente senza andare mille volte nello stesso posto a fare le solite cose.
Narrativamente è molto meno banale di quel che sembra. La storia è anche avvincente e il richiamo allo stile "Lost" mi ha molto divertito. Tagli e chiusure come finali di episodio sono divertenti. Bello lo stile "registico" che lo fa diventare un cartoon pieno di ritmo e atmosfera. Secondo me l'ispirazione a Oxenfree è abbastanza evidente, ma potrei anche sbagliarmi. Bello, da giocare magari con altri membri della famiglia. Bravi. Ora chissà quando uscirà il seguito...

author: {'steamid': '76561198293275711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1611762738}
review: Der Schein trügt, nicht nur weil es ein Dedektivspiel ist sondern auch weil es in den ersten Spielminuten wie ein putziges Kinderspiel für angehende Dedektive wirkt, doch dann wendet sich das Blatt und man wird in einen Mord verstrickt und es wird schnell klar dass das Spiel definitiv nichts für Kinder oder zart Beseitete ist. Das Spiel ist wie eine Verschmälzung von "Röki" und "Little MrsFortune" man kann sich immer wieder zwischen zwei Möglichkeiten entscheiden, was den Spielverlauf beeinflusst und man hat immer wieder Klettereinlagen und jede menge Sammelobjekte die den Wiederspielwert enorm steigern. Zudem muss man als guter Dedektiv die Hinweise wahrnehmen und Schlüsse ziehen und sehr schnell kommt man zu dem Schluss dass es nicht nur um einen einfachen Mord geht sondern um etwas größeres und Mysteriöseres das vertuscht wurde. Das Spiel ist für alle Fans von Dramatischen Wendungen und Mysteriöster Story und bereits jetzt erwarte ich gespannt die Vortsetzung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179967675', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1651947857}
review: Прекрасная, милая игра. Приятная озвучка, хорошая рисовка, отличный сюжет. Жду продолжение истории потому, что осталось много не разрешенного.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065687456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1611782792}
review:
La premessa è abbastanza carina e per la prima oretta ci si intrattiene bene ma poi si perde tutto in un gameplay ripetitivo e lento, percorsi lunghi e macchinosi da un posto a un altro che danno l'impressione di voler allungare il brodo ma che non aggiungono niente al gioco se non la noia. 

I controlli tramite tastiera poi sono molto scomodi, quindi se non avete un controller non prendetevi neanche la briga di provare il gioco. C'è inoltre una specie di bug molto fastidioso quando si salgono le scale, per cui spesso e volentieri vi ritroverete a doverle risalire più di una volta.
 
Come ciliegina sulla torta, la protagonista è piuttosto anonima e abbastanza insopportabile.

Non mi sento di consigliare questo gioco a meno che non sia in forte sconto. Potrebbe interessare i giocatori più piccoli.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042687424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1611729582}
review:
One of the best detective games I've ever played and quite more than its cute layout might lead you to! If you prefer story- and character-driven games you'll LOVE this!!! Reminded me alot of Gravity Falls.

There is mystery, replay value, different choices leading to different plot payoffs, mystery, you get collectables and a review of yout playstyle that you can access through a journal (or detective's notebook, you might say) and mystery.

I enjoyed how huge it was and I'm hoping for a sequel. Maybe then you can improve slightly on the gameplay itself, either by inserting more mini games or just more variation on what we can do with the controls - the mystery is challenging, but just walking around, pressing Enter (on PC) whenever something pops up and using the magnfying glass every now and then could have been more fun by adding another feature/button or just experimenting more with what we have (i.e. having to choose the right way by following a trail of clues or a scent, or just more action in general).

author: {'steamid': '76561198085305459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1611562113}
review:

It has some good mechanics and Puzzle gameplay.
The Story is mysterious, funny, intriguing with an open ending (whhhyyyyyyy!!!!).
This game is not perfect (but which game is?) but i would still recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992764875', 'num_games_owned': 2700, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1611435395}
review:
This game does a lot of things right. Oozing with atmosphere and and excellent mystery vibe throughout. The writing and dialogue is really well done and the pacing makes you just want to play the whole thing in one go.
There is however not a whole lot for the player to do. You're not actually solving a mystery, so much as you're watching it be unraveled. The puzzles, insofar you can call them that, are really easy with obvious solutions. So there's no challenge to this game.
But like I said, it's so well written you just want to play to the end regardless. 
When you do get to the end however, you frustratingly realize that there is NO ending. The game pretends it does, it pretends it has nine. But they're all functionally the same and provide no closure to the story. A shame, because I think if this game were two to four hours longer it could've wrapped everything up nicely. A sequel has apparently been in production for almost a year now, so I suppose we'll see what that'll bring if and when that does come out.
Some technical aspects could also be better. It's best played on a gamepad, as the keyboard controls are kinda weird and there is no mouse support. There's also an option for new game+, but it seemingly doesn't work. 
Still, this game has amazing art, great voice acting, and really great writing and atmosphere. And with up to ten hours of story it's well worth it's asking price. Fun for the whole family, play it with your kids on the couch. Or by yourself, if you're looking for some quality entertainment.
The lack of ending is almost frustrating enough for me to say wait for the sequel to be out, but that would be doing a disservice to the quality of this game. It deserves to be played, it deserves to be enjoyed. It has my recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034154078', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1611211776}
review: A wonderfully clever and charming game completely let down by a horrifically bad ending.  It's bad enough that they felt the need to disclaim that the ending is a cliffhanger in the store description, but that is no excuse and doesn't cover the magnitude of the story elements that end unresolved.  In addition [spoiler] the game presents you with two large, important seeming choices at the end that amount to nothing different than achievements [/spoiler].  When you're an indie game and don't have a guarantee of having a second game, don't end your game with the story half-finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199250105', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1609921049}
review: So pleasantly surprised by this game! I was iffy on it for a while because I thought it might be better for tweens/kids, but this really reminded me of the Her Interactive Nancy Drew games combined with Night in the Woods or Oxenfree. My only complaint is that the puzzles/deductions could be more difficult or complex, or I wished there was an option to make it more difficult. While I was never stumped, I was intrigued by the story the whole time and look forward to the next game! If you like detective games, conspiracies, and sci-fi, definitely give Jenny LeClue a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977837425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1609900787}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002433001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1609632932}
review:
Ok, whoah, it's been a while since I played a game that had an open ending, a "to be continued" label at the end! And just to be clear, I'm stoked for the next part!

In short, the game is super pretty to look at, amazing animation, über cute story and writing, very good voice acting!
I guess the only thing I can think of that I want to critizise is that some of the options you get when you need to answer/choose don't really give you a clue of what you're actually answering or going to say (like the "respect your elders" vs. "respect them some other time", I had no idea what I was actually choosing there). There's also a sidekick you get later on, without spoiling who, and she's not actually very helpful, she's more there to be annoying than helpful, although she does provide a bit of help here and there (but not crucial help). I just mention it because the game seems to set her up as beeing a very valuable ally, but then she isn't.

Other than that, I absolutely loved it. And I probably will play it again before next part comes out

author: {'steamid': '76561198081623099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1609161468}
review: An unique gem - I really enjoyed playing this game and the art style is just beautiful. A talented voice cast also brings the characters to life. Hope we don't have to wait too long for part 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198327119200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1609131076}
review: This game is perfect for those who love mystery novels or any type of mystery solving game/puzzle.  I have read different reviews on the slower paced walking and although this game does seem to have a lot of walking/slower-paced answering,  it is not too slow to where it makes the game unplayable, there seems to be a running option throughout,  and the slower paced moving makes it to where you can actually sit back and enjoy the story without feeling rushed. Having slow walking is a pro in a mystery game, in opinion, so you can pick up different clues along the way if needed or just to see the scenery the creator has developed. Overall, great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198344888996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1608992684}
review:
A difficult game to review. It's very simple, with almost no challenge in the puzzles - making it feel like "my first adventure"... great if you want to intro the kids to point-n-click. For a regular gamer it gets repetitive very quickly and eventually annoying.
But I can't give it a bad review - because the characters, writing, voice-acting and graphic styles are clearly a work of love from the creators - they are excellent throughout. Likewise the story within a story presentation, the narrative of the adventure itself are very good. You also get about 10hours - admittedly some of that walking needlessly long distances but most of it actual content - which felt good value.
What you're left with then is one of those 'Disney Movies' that just about has enough to entertain the grown-ups but is clearly for the kids. You don't mind that you watched it but would have liked more substance. As a game for my holiday hang-overs it was ideal!
Like others have said - it also just ends - suddenly and with no satisfying resolve at all. I think it needs a clear "Part One" stamp on it, because I had no idea this wasn't a complete game - it was very disappointing.
If you enjoy a walking simulator, with some 'choices matter' bits and a beautiful cartoon style - give it a go. If you need puzzles, this is not going to satisfy you at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993485063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1608349841}
review: I'm giving this a Thumbs Down even though I played through the whole thing and enjoyed parts of it. There are some really nice elements to Jenny LeClue, I think the story framing is well done, I think there is just enough personality to it, and I think the two threads of the mystery are pretty engaging. The issues I have are more to do with the game play and pacing. There is a lack of variety in puzzles, many use repeated formats such as the lock picking, breaking boards, the dial puzzles, and the wave frequency puzzles; solving them once was fine but repeating the puzzles with similar solutions was tedious. Moving around the environment often felt too slow, the story cutscenes are not skippable and they do not give you text speed options. Then the cherry on top of this all is that they decided not to even give a full conclusion to the game! I tried to go back and see if your choices gave different outcomes and the don't and it was REALLY cumbersome trying to get additional achievements. I think there are some easy tweaks that could make this game something like an 8/10 but in the current state I would give it a 6/10 at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143807861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1608588071}
review: This game is NOT a complete story. Huge let-down. Ending a detective game on a cliffhanger is one thing- but discarding the entire plot in the end? Makes me have buyer's remorse for sure. If you choose to buy this game, beware: you will have to spend more money just to finish the story that the first game should have finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011160772', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1607888239}

author: {'steamid': '76561198172260725', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1607546020}
review: One of the more enjoyable detective games I've played in a while! I'm looking forward to more stories set in this world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198426428291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1607128892}
review: This game is too charming and well-done not to recommend.  Story, graphics, voice acting - all outstanding.  But, gameplay is slow (sooo much walking and pressing enter) and puzzles are very easy.  This is really a pre-teen/teen game more than an adult game. There's nothing wrong with that - just be aware. That said, I'm pretty curious to see how the story ends in the next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198806666399', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1679533488}
review: Muy Buen juego me  encanta el ambiente detectivesco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100748279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1696720467}
review: Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is truly entertaining. The heroine is sarcastic and witty. I enjoyed the bit of comedy throughout the story. The game play is fairly linear, with some choices here and there. There are some extra collectables, too (bonus items that I had fun looking around for). I enjoyed the game. The music is fun and fits in well. The character interactions were amusing. The only downside is that the game ends as a "To Be Continued" story. I would have preferred to have had a completed game to play; I don't want to have to wait for a continuation to be released. Overall, I do recommend the game. It was fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198270941607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1606880319}
review: Un des meilleurs jeux auquel j'ai joué depuis un bon bout. L'histoire est très bien écrit, l'intrigue nous accroche dès le départ. Les personnages sont aussi très complets et intéressants. J'étais une grande fan des jeux de Nancy Drew en grandissant et Jenny Leclue est ce que j'aurais aimé que les ND deviennent. 10/10, ce jeu en vaut absolument la peine, vous ne serez pas déçus. J'ai déjà hâte pour la suite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047333977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1610505660}
review:
When Part 2 is released, I’ll edit this to add a review for that as well.

[b][Non-Spoiler for Part 1][/b]

The art for the environments and characters is stunning, plus great voice acting and animations. I’m glad I got the game when they updated it with full voice acting. The music is also fantastic, and (more or less) appropriate for the sci-fi 40s-50s time period it seems to take place in.

The tone going from light-hearted to semi-dark without blood or supernatural elements was refreshing. The story reminded me of the ones from the mid-1900s, Nancy Drew, Twilight Zone, etc. with a meta-side conflict with the writer.

I bought this on sale, but the $20 price tag is well deserved for 10 hours+ worth of story, voice acting and gameplay. 

In terms of critique, I have to echo a few reviews that said it would be nice to have keyboard and mouse support. While moving Jenny in the environment with wasd is fine, when it comes to looking for clues or breaking down barriers, it’s awkward to move the diamond cursor around the area and select small areas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223311340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1606768135}
review: Cute game, lots of gameplay.  I would play the next one in this series.  I was not a big fan of all keyboard movement but adapted.  The story is interesting.  Sometimes the cut scenes were a bit long but some provided some laugh-worthy comments.  For the most part the game seemed to be  more for younger players but it still held my interest.  Had no issues or glitches.  Would have liked to have been able to save at anytime.  A couple of times I needed to quit but had not reached an auto save point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110893329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1673760983}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030669842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1606729081}
review:
This game barely gets a recommendation, since there are many things I find annoying about it. But let's start with...

The Good:
- The characters are great, both from a design and from a personality point of view.
- The story - while not what I expected - got interesting eventually.
- The whole game is polished and professionally made.

The Bad:
- I'm not quite sure who this game is for. The puzzles are too easy for most adults, but the dark tone of some scenes is not approriate for children.
- The story has serious pacing issues. They should have cut the whole middle chunk where all you do is walk around and do the same mini-games over and over. It also ends on a cliffhanger, which I thought was unnecessary.
- The game is a completionist's nightmare. You're expected to search every nook and cranny for collectibles. However, sometimes the game moves to the next chapter when you walk a certain way, so you can't finish looking everywhere. I guess I'm supposed to replay all the chapters, but considering the pacing issues already mentioned, I definitely won't do that.
- The keyboard controls work, but I would have preferred using the mouse for puzzles.

The Verdict: If you want a mystery story with interesting characters, then consider this game. However, if boring stretches make you quit a game, then stay away. Also, if you want all achievements, you'll need some serious patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093653878', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1668850679}
review:
Cute artstyle, charming characters and genuinely compelling mysteries, Jenny LeClue is a must for anyone who is even remotely interested in the genre. 

Jenny is also the most precious, sassiest lass in fiction. Absolutely top tier protagonist.

review: Başta çok gereksiz konuşmalar dönse de biraz ilerleyince hikaye bir anda acayip derinleşiyor ve güzel bulmacalar geliyor. Ana kısımlar aynı kalsa da seçimlere göre değişiklikler oluyor. Çizimler çok güzel. Bilim kurgu temalı ilginç bir sonu var

author: {'steamid': '76561198017614297', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1606533398}
review:
With its endearing protagonist, colorful characters, engaging puzzles that (mostly) don't overstay their welcome, and an often-beautiful stylized setting, Jenny Leclue makes for a good few evenings of pleasant adventure-game company.

Though the story ends in a devilish cliffhanger that might leave some feeling short-changed, I'm invested enough to look forward to the continuation of Jenny's adventure. My primary complaints would be that the game could do with a dialogue-skip option for those revisiting chapters for achievement-hunting, and those chapters could be broken up better by checkpoints; however, it's hard not to find oneself smiling even when replaying them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066591074', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1592533549}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254279801', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1606437838}
review: Буду краток. Эта игра, плод страстной любви Night in the Woods и Oxenfree, при этом на всё это смотрела  Ненси Дрю. Отличный визуал, приятная озвучка персонажей, нелинейный сюжет(почти каждый выбор в диалогах имеет своё последствие), музыки мало, но она отлично справляется с созданием атмосферы, головоломки приятные. Мягко говоря, я не вижу каких либо причин докапываться к игре, ибо это весьма хороший детективная адвенчура с элементами мистики. Так что она полностью оправдывает свою стоимость.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047936303', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1606614829}
review:
Джени потрясающе интересный детектив. Это механика поиска улик и сведения их к выводу. Это возможность выбора поведения Джени, и последствия выборов. Это действительно интересный сюжет с неожиданными поворотами. А еще это потрясающий визуальный стиль. В игру интересно играть и распутывать головоломки, как и просто любоваться картинкой. Да герои получились очень хорошие, не картонные. 
 
Но при всем при этом есть и одно но, тут открытый финал. Который подготовлен для продолжения? И надеюсь он не заставит себя ждать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326325032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1627401871}
review:
I had so much fun playing this game! Jenny LeClue is a cozy and thrilling adventure/mystery game with an art-style and theme that reminds me of the Adventures of Tintin, Gravity Falls and Scooby Doo! Mystery Inc.

The game is narrated by the author of the in-universe Jenny LeClue books and while I did think some of the narrations got a bit long during cutscenes (since you can't move until they're finished) I also think they added a lot to the game's feeling thanks to the great voice acting.

I was also genuinely surprised by a lot of the darker themes in the game and even found myself on edge during some of those segments. Now I'm just standing-by, hoping for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198854003552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1610146435}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968095656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1605502897}
review:
Mostly a fairly linear interactive story with puzzle, deduction, and decision-making bits.  I really enjoyed the story telling though, it's suspenseful, exciting, and headed in surprising directions.  Voice acting is solid and the whole production feels fairly polished.

Some of the walking starts to get a bit tedious and the one thing that disappointed me is that the magnifying glass mechanic feels a bit like a gimmick since you are prompted to use it.  That turns out to be necessary since you can't at all see many of things that it reveals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832742723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1604832998}
review:
[h1]Cute yet mysterious...[/h1]

The story started with a very relatable author, Arthur K. Finklestein, pestered by his editor to spice up his wholesome Nancy Drew-ish mystery series. For his 38th book in the series, Jenny would not be track down any missing kittens or misplaced diaries — instead, she will find herself tasked with solving a real-deal murder, after one of the Arthurton's most prominent men winds up dead under shady circumstances. And this time, the fate of her family and friends hangs in the balance. These opening scenes establish Jenny LeClue's tone right off the bat — wry, self-aware, and thankfully never too pleased with its own cleverness.

What I really love about this game is that there are interactive dialog options where we can choose over the course of Jenny's journey. Some of them are in clear defiance of what Arthur wants for the characters and choosing those will get a comment from him as well, which is a really nice touch. The game even keeps track of all the choices you made and assigns Jenny a personality type to go along with them depending on how you have her react in different situations.

However, on the subject of endings, I was kind of [i]unhappy[/i] with how this game ended. It really feels like things are just ramping up and we have finally uncovered something so big that there is no way that it could be ended so abruptly!? 

Overall, Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is a mystery that I would love to recommend to everyone, but that recommendation is forced to come with a precaution that this game ends so suddenly, especially in the moment when things finally starting to get really wild and exciting.
 

[b]TL; DR

🖼️ Beautiful visuals and colors
🎤 Excellent vocal performances
🖋️ Consistently clever writing
🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Well-Written Plot & Characters Development

⚠️ Abrupt ending may leave players unfulfilled
🚨 Few minor technical issues such as control functions[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198116858193', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1604976400}
review:
I have really mixed feelings about the game
Pros : 
- Beautifull game with very nice moods 
- the interrogation phases were short and straight forwards
- The mini game puzzle were logic
- The story is charming, I liked the back and forth between the book and the writer
Cons
- The game was waaaaay too easy and never gave me any challenge.
Everything is served to you on a gold platter and the game do too much for you. 
For xemple, I would have loved to have to remember the code I found and enter it myself in the computer, but instead Jenny do it on her own.
- The tells too much when and where to search, observation is not really rewarded

Finally the choices seemed useless in many cases.

I was maybe expecting too much or I was not the target market, seems more appropriate for younger children that are not yet used to play point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059358712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1604985422}
review:
This is a very conditional recommendation. The core of this game is the story and it does an incredibly good job when it comes to that story. I kept wanting to know what happens next, and I think that the characters came off as genuine and there was solid character growth. I also really liked the meta narrative with the narrator. 

However, I'm not reviewing a book, I'm reviewing a game, and as far as the game aspects go, it falls incredibly short. Most of the time when I had agency it wasn't interesting, it just felt like fluff until I get to the next bit of story. I mostly enjoyed the puzzles, but the platforming was very linear and didn't really give any sense of exploration that I feel like a good mystery should have. There were a couple of times where I just wanted to stop playing the game because I was just sick of the platforming sections. There might be optional things I didn't find, but I doubt it. The game seemed to gate me off from moving forward until I found everything of interest.

I can also tell that there's a lot of passion and love put into this project, and the artwork is very stylized, and probably the best part of what makes it a game.  Overall, I feel like this game would have worked better in a visual novel format, with puzzles mixed in from time to time, and probably would've been easier and cheaper to make that way considering the existence of RenPy.

TLDR: If you want a good story, then buy this. If you want something with amazing gameplay, look somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132019728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1604295139}
review:
Pros:
The art design is absolutely stunning.

Cons:
Everything else

I wanted so badly to like this! 

But the whole experience was a mixture of boredom and frustration.

It's really more like a visual novel, as others have said. The level of player interaction is SO LOW. The story pace is incredibly slow. There is no subtlety or sophistication. It feels designed for kids or teens. There are all kinds of hokey bloating. Figure out what this person ate for breakfast. It doesn't matter! Who cares! It is just bizarre and frustrating. It also has really long cut scenes of characters talking where you can't pause and they are so flipping boring. OMG. UGHHHHHHH.
There is no mouse support. They controls are redundant (you have to click certain items with a magnifying glass to 'see' them and then click them AGAIN to actually look at them. The puzzles are not challenging in the slightest. It's just excruciating. 
There are options where you can choose between two things. But the VAST majority of these choices seem to have NO IMPACT on what happens AT ALL.
After a couple hours, I was literally like, on god, no, don't make me talk to some other boring person for 10 minutes. AGHHGHHGHGHGHG.

I found the main character to be absolutely annoying! I didn't like her AT ALL! She was so obnoxious. I also didn't love her voice acting which I'm sure influenced it.

The frame concept of the writer telling the story is interesting but why is it needed? It really seems like the value is to justify future endless installments of the game? It doesn't really add anything. Why do we need an adult man 'creating' this girl's story? Why can't she just exist without a dude controlling her, on her own terms? *Frown*

It's a shame that something with such gorgeous production value totally falls apart on plot, pacing, interaction, gameplay and editing. 

Also why are her feet so small?

author: {'steamid': '76561198011600042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1604320161}
review: A high-quality stylish game with a very twisted spy sci-fi plot and about 11 hrs of gameplay, but would be more interesting for kids than for adults. Puzzles are repetivie and pretty simple, don't give any mind challenge at all. I enjoyed this game more like a kid's cartoon with vivid characters, lots of humor and great design and music, than a puzzle game. Similar to Night in the Woods, Little Misfortune and Agent A - a puzzle in disguise. It's a shame that all mysteries were not solved by the end of this game and it said "to be continued"

author: {'steamid': '76561198155589533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1604179611}
review:
Jenny LeClue—Detectivu has the charm of a classic Humongous Entertainment game (Remember Spy Fox? Freddie Fish? Pajama Sam?) with a mature spin. Puzzles abound in this murder-mystery thriller that sets a sassy and snarly ginger junior genius up against a bizarre conspiracy. 

Thick with detective-story tropes and framed by the tale of an overwrought chapter-book author who simply wants to keep his protagonist's childhood sacred (despite the demands of the market and his publisher), Jenny LeClue—Detectivu is a do-not-miss title, especially at Halloween.

EDIT: I appreciate the keyboard settings are customizable. I prefer using the arrow keys for primary movement over WASD and was able to reverse them without a problem while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998656603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1601651736}
review: It's a really nice game, very relaxing. Interesting story, great voice-over, enjoyable and simple gameplay. The big disappointment is the cliffhanger at the end... damn. Still, I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029328534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1601230691}
review:
It's really charming and fun adventure game with good production values on voice acting and presentation. Bit worried about whether or not there is continuation to it since this is sort of "episode 1" but it definitely is long enough to be its own adventure game. Ending is cliffhanger though so again some people might want to wait there being sequel out first :p Depends on what is canon in sequel too since apparently this is "we decide second's game canon by what choices players picked in first one" sort of dealio, since some of things players can choice are much more interesting than other choices.

Sidenote, I'm really surprised at that I ended up liking the author framing device in the end. It did actually good job of making it easier to ignore things that in other stories might be broke the suspension of disbelief thing and it did give nice extra arc for the narrator too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975057641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1601183871}
review: Murder mystery adventure platformer. The graphics and voice acting are great. The main mystery _does_ get solved before introducing new mysteries for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971442549', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1601062448}
review:
As a puzzle game it's not particularly challenging. But the characters, style and story make it incredibly enjoyable.

+ Really beautiful graphic and very good voice acting!
+ Well-written and funny story and people, much deeper than you'd think.
+ Adorable animations and gorgeous backgrounds.
+ Interrogation and investigation are fun mechanics.
+ Surprisingly ... intense and serious at times.

- Some of the puzzles really feel like padding. They're not fun. just tedious.
- The walking around in some levels feels really, really slow.

It's a very nice experience and a lovely game in general. If they did a bit of editing on some of the puzzles it'd be almost perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094007603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1600797921}

Die Story wird in der Narrative konstant gut erzählt und macht durch und durch Spaß. Ich freue mich bereits auf eine Fortsetzung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844992279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1600670011}
review:
可愛的卡通畫風、配上合適的配音與音樂音效，再加上引人入勝的劇情，
整個遊戲過程就像在看一部精彩的動畫片，這是一個很棒的推理解謎遊戲！
非常期待續作的到來。

author: {'steamid': '76561198337614071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1600473456}
review:
Совсем другого ожидаешь от индюшного детектива, Дженни ЛеКлю хорошая игра, но для аудитории 10-14 лет.
Квесты часто повторяются: собери картинку из кусочков, сломай деревянные доски просто кликая по ним, взломай очередной замок, а потом ходи-ходи-ходи еще ходи.... Господи, как же медленно она ходит)
Картинка приятная глазу, правда очень красиво, на одном визуале не выехать!
Прошла до конца, потому что несмотря на то, что сюжет развивался очень медленно, он зацепил и было интересно чем все кончится. Но угдайте что? Концовка сплошное разочарование: ты выбираешь ее сам (буквально: выбери кто умрет) и все объяснения прерываются на  злосчастном "продолжение следует".

author: {'steamid': '76561198058850226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1600555820}

review: O jogo é relativamente fácil, porém a história é bem bacana! Os diálogos são muito divertidos e engraçados. O que mais valeu muito a pena nesse jogo foram as artes incrivelmente lindas, principalmente as cores. Vale a pena o joguinho!

author: {'steamid': '76561199082934527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1599345351}
review: WOAH this game was full of twists and turns––and not the cliche ones that are often used in the mystery genre, either. The visuals are quite stunning, and I loved the cast of quirky characters. I was truly on the edge of my seat for the last few hours of this game, and I was incredibly impressed by how it all came together! Truly, bravo to the creators. My only complaints would be that some of the puzzles weren't particularly intuitive, and there were some parts in the middle that dragged on for a bit too long. But truly, I can't wait for the next game in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091969640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1599290475}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072748946', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1597666364}
review:
A lovely little game that I was able to wind down with, in an evening.
With beautiful environments, great writing, and a cast of loveable characters, it brings back fond memories of early morning cartoons.
This is intended to be the first of two games, the sequel of which is yet to have a release date, so keep that in mind before buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250652918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1597514205}
review: Очень вкусная картинка наблюдается во время всей игры, а озвучка поражает своей чистотой. Единственный недостаток - это, когда ты думаешь "ну вот, щас пойдёт настоящий экшн", игра пишет "продолжение следует", но, тем не менее, проходить игру было интересно (за исключением главы с катером, она меня взбесила), так что рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431195873', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1598704250}
review:
Oyunu anlatmaya nereden başlasam bilemedim şimdi. 2D grafikli, seçimlerden ve bulmacalardan oluşan bir oyun. Hikayeyi spoilersız anlatmam gerekirse: Bir dedektif yazarı Jenny Leclue adında bir kitap serisi  yazıyordur. Zaman ilerledikçe kitapları daha az satmaya başlar. Kitaplar eski ilgisini kaybedince menajer ve arkadaşları, yazara kitabında birilerinin başına kötü olaylar -ölmek gibi-  getirmesini isterler. Eğer bunu yapmazsa kitabı yayınlatmayacaklarını söylerler. Yazarda üzülerek bu denileni yaparak hikayeyi şekillendirir. Biz de  hem yazarın hikayeye yapacağı değişiklikleri hem de Jenny'nin yazarın anlattığı dünyadaki  bazı önemli veya önemsiz   -Ki çoğu seçimi hikayenin ilerisinde bir şeye etki ettiğini görüyoruz.- kararlarını veriyoruz. Oyunu spoilersız bu kadar anlatabilirim ama hikayesi gerçekten güzel ve sürükleyici. İlk  2 saat öğrenme aşamasında sıkılabilirsiniz. Fakat sonradan oyun, macera ve adrenalin duygularını hissettiriyor. 

Aynı zamanda oyun 8 saatte bitiyor. Fiyatı biraz daha  aşağıda olabilirdi. Genede güzel oyun. Ve şunu da söylemek isterim oyunun devamı da gelecektir.

review: 어렵지 않은 퍼즐과 아주 괜찮은 스토리로 후반부까지 재밌게 했습니다. 하지막 가혹한 선택과 이상한 열린 결말로 인한 분노는 숨길 수 없군요 엔딩이라고 뜨는데 엔딩이 아닌듯한 이 게임은 뭔가요 그래서 마지막은 어떻게 되는건데요 쿠키 영상이라도 만들어줬어야하는거 아닌가요 그래도 재밌게 플레이했습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1597890575}
review:
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun, YA detective story. The animation is wonderful, the voice acting is great, the story is solid and memorable, and there was more content than I was expecting, plus incentive to replay.

It's not 100% perfect - there's some issues with pacing towards the end in which the explorable areas can become a bit of a slog, and the puzzle-y/logical deduction portions of the game become more scarce as you get to the second half of the game. And as a colorblind individual, I had some issues telling what was highlighted in the menus. Overall though, these are minor complaints on an extremely well polished and unique spin on the genre.

About 10 hours to beat a single runthrough, but this game exceeded my expectations on almost every front.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046471554', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1597791766}
review: Joia escondida, É a melhor definição. Esse jogo é perfeito pra quem gosta de puzzles e também sente falta de jogos da Telltale(Mais especificamente da série Batman). A história é intrigante e descontraída, a arte do jogo é linda e agradável. Os personagens são muito simpáticos e com carisma. Os únicos contras que eu tenho são os controles de teclado e mouse, que são fáceis de esquecer e a lupa que arrasta um pouco depois que você para de mover ela, o que é irritante pois os itens são pequenos e faz você perder tempo vendo a animação da mesma. Recomendadíssimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050570807', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1597115640}
review:
You should know that this installment ties up major plot points, but introduces new ones just before it becomes "To Be Continued". No real news on a sequel thus far, but the latest update at the time of this review bodes well for one.

If you want a detective adventure game done right, Jenny Leclue does almost everything right. The puzzles don't come with direct hints, but they're mostly logic puzzles and all of them dead simple. The story, writing, and voice acting are the main pull, so the straightforward puzzles get a pass.

I have one minor gripe with this game. Without getting spoilery, there is a character with a force of personality that feels, well, forced. Where there was potential for her to have had more depth than a cardboard cutout of a tired trope, it later turned out that she really did not. For a duration in the game I hoped to not see the worn-out scene where "Air Headed Companion almost gives away Main Character to Bad Guy for something that really could have waited until later, but does so anyway because they are so sweet/random". There was indeed such a scene in this game, presumably to some humourous effect, but I was so tired of it that it was lost on me. The same character does her "I'm in your way but only because I'm so sweet!" routine a little later, thankfully annoying for a grand total of two times only. Though cliches happen even in story-rich games like this, Jenny Leclue started off so strong that when it started to betray the creativity of its introduction, the disappointment was felt so, so much more so than if it were any other game.

Buy or no buy? Whether a sequel is incoming or not, the way Jenny Leclue does visuals, writing, and themes should be experienced by all fans of the point-and-click/adventure genre. Very worth 10/10 would buy again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292087084', 'num_games_owned': 1757, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1596782234}
review:
As of August 2020, this game does not have an ending. You'll be playing up to a point where it gets very interesting and then... it stops. Roll credits. Literally, that's it. The story and game stops mid-way through with no questions answered at all.

I can't recommend this game at any price because it's incomplete, and certainly not at the $20 it sells for. It's a shame, too, since the graphics, music, story, and voice acting are all top notch. Those things exist to help bring the story alive in a visual novel game such as this. The story is what we're here for. I wouldn't want to read a novel that's half-written or watch a movie that's half-filmed. Likewise, I wouldn't want to play half a story-driven game. Yet that's what we have here.

I assume the developers ran out of money and just tossed it out for sale. Meanwhile, I feel cheated out of my money and will avoid this publisher in the future.

Buyer beware.

review: I bought this game without knowing what it really was.  I like how the narration of the author deconstructs the protagonist's perspective of the story and the overall plot.  Choices feel like they have an impact.  The puzzles are challenging but not impossible.  I just wish they had a normal mouse control option instead of the keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128083033', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1596123787}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a great game that I really loved playing.

The game's writing is top notch and its not surprising considering the game itself is told by a story writer that is the author of well liked Jenny LeClue series. The game we play is the most exciting entry of all time cause our writer has issues with his publishing company.

From a visual point, I really like this cartoonish style in games so I loved all aesthetics it offered. Beautiful is a great word to use to describe Jenny LeClue's art. 

The game reminded me Night in the Woods with both it's story and how it feels to play. This was a really positive thing because NITW was another game I really loved! 

I liked all characters game had but Suzie Glatz was my favorite! All the characters are really good written and feels great to meet every one of them. 

The only negative aspect of Jenny LeClue is that absurd cliffhanger ending. It had no explanation and purely was there to make a way for a second game. But, it didn't affect me that much. Only thing I thought was the fact I'm glad that I'm going to see Jenny once more in the future :D

Overall, I recommend this game to every point and click lovers and the story based game enthusiasts. With that said, I will go for chilling in the Jenny LeClue 2 waiting room.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113124226', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1596017743}
review: 作者2人对光影、镜头的运用非常娴熟

author: {'steamid': '76561197978484533', 'num_games_owned': 1883, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1595876081}
review:
This is a very hesitant recommendation.

First, the bad. There is a lot of walking in this game, and it's not particularly interesting walking. It's slow. Yes, there is a dedicated run button, but to create atmosphere it's disabled half the time. And sometimes it's not even walking, but climbing. Slow climbing across huge structures.
The game itself is a mix of puzzle types. The most common are search the scene for 'clues', but most of the time it's just scan over the whole thing to find the hot-spots. Then there are the mysteries, which are really just find odd ones out from a set of possibilities. And finally are the 'real' puzzles, which are all simple enough that you can just fiddle with them until they work without needing to actually think. So lots left to desire there. And on top of it all, you have a ton of false choices, that are often (but not always) transparent in how false they are.

But there is some good - the game is incredibly charming and the music throughout is wonderful. The charm pretty much makes up for the gameplay issues, and the music makes the long walking sections tolerable. The story is... captivating, but weird, and I'm not yet sure that it will all be acceptably wrapped up by the end.

And then the weird:
A glowing lake. A dead body. Mysterious circumstances. Old technologies dealing with the unique properties of this weird place. Secret passages. Finding clues by searching screens and interrogating suspects. Small side puzzles you need to solve to progress. An ultimately linear story. Great music, charming characters and good voice acting.
Am I describing Jenny LeClue or Tangle Tower?
(Though if you specifically want a game that has all those things, I'd hands down recommend Tangle Tower before this one.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198128930363', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1595840312}
review:
브금, 사건 전재 방식, 해결 과정, 스토리등 대부분의 면에서 저는 소위 갓겜이라고 생각했었습니다.

퍼즐 자체는 중반까지 진행을 하니 비슷한 패턴밖에 나오지 않아 퍼즐 자체에는 머리를 쓰는 작업(전체적인 전개나 흐름 정리 같은)를 제외하고는 중반 이후 부터는 지루하게 느꼈습니다. 그리고 어떤 퍼즐은 가이드가 없어서 알아내는데 불편했고, 어느 퍼즐은 아예 찍어맞추기 식이나 왔다갔다하는 것 밖에는 없어서 호불호가 갈릴 것으로 생각합니다.

그래서 퍼즐 구성보단 사건 해결 과정이나 스토리쪽을 중점적으로 해서 플레이하니 훨씬 괜찮았습니다. 특히 사건 해결 과정이나 추리 과정을 실제 필기하듯이 표현해서 몰입이 잘 되었습니다.

스토리적 부분에서는 불만이 좀 있습니다. 어느정도 설명되지 않은 부분 따위가 많았고, 선택지가 강요되는 것 처럼 보였지만 정작 엔딩에는 큰 영향을 주지 않았습니다. 그저 인물간의 관계나 대사가 조금씩 다른 정도에 불과해 너무나도 아쉬웠습니다. 특히 시간제한까지 걸어놔 이 부분이 더 크게 다가왔네요.
또한 엔딩부분에선 열린 결말식으로 한 것은 상관이 없으나, 많은 부분에서 독백 형식으로 사건을 설명해주고, 그 마저도 모든것을 충분히 설명해주지는 않아 스토리가 미완성된 느낌을 강하게 받았습니다.

용두사미랄까요? 초~중반까지는 괜찮았으나, 중반 이후 부터는 그렇게 새로운 퍼즐이 없어 지루했으며, 스토리도 후반까진 흥미로웠으나 엔딩부분에서 마무리가 좋지 않았고, 선택이 중요한 것 처럼만 보여주었습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018495202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1595707380}
review:
Parts of this I *really* liked.  The art is great.  Voice acting was added with an update (that happened to come out while I was in the midst of playing it), and it really adds to a cinematic feel to the game.  I found it funny and good natured.  The animation sequences for some of the deductions are really strong, and the journaling system is extensive in a way that allows you to flip back and appreciate the experiences.  The main mystery within the game also has a satisfying resolution, in terms of the reveal of the culprit and motive.  The game has a meta-element where Jenny LeClue is actually a fictional character and you have scenes with the author, and the tension between the protective author and Jenny provides for real fun (although it, like so many other of the game's big positives, is mostly in the first half and more muted toward the end).  

Two big downsides that are essentially fatal for recommending it: (1) The game really drags.  A lot of the puzzles are tedious, especially ones that involve a repeated mechanic (spinning dials, picking a lock).  A lot of it is also de-skilled platforming -- moving things so that you can climb and that sort of stuff.  As the game goes one, the tedious bits start to become more prominent, and the game spends a large part of the second half underground, which doesn't allow the art to shine; (2) There is a different mystery that also gets a lot of attention to the game, and indeed takes center stage for most of the second half before the denouement, and that one just ends totally abruptly, with a "To Be Continued." It was particularly annoying for me because the game has a choice at the end that seems EXTREMELY consequential and I really thought about it and only made the choice with some trepidation, and then it turned out not to matter at all except for something that happens in literally the last two seconds before "To Be Continued" shows up.  But, anyway, if the series does end up being continued, then maybe after the second game is finished the fact that it has this sort of cliffhanger will feel better, but as I write this I have no idea about what the odds of Jenny LeClue 2 coming into existence are, especially since the game was apparently a much-delayed Kickstarter.

Also, quirk of this game: How old is Jenny LeClue supposed to be?  It talks about how she is a "tiny" detective and her Mom talks about her a "just a child" and needing a babysitter and you get the sense of a lot of it being about a detective who is, I don't know, in junior high or so.   At the same time, though, the town in the game has a college, and it is implied that her sidekick friend is a benchwarming basketball player at the college and Jenny is presented as roughly the same age as some of the cheerleaders who are cheerleaders for the college.  Plus her friend has a father who is the college dean and is retirement age, which, sure, folks can father children well into old age, but it just created a lot of confusion about how I was supposed to approach some of the game's interactions.  Overall: 6/10 (but maybe 7/10 until its final minute).

author: {'steamid': '76561198002759061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1592105868}
review:
I wanted to like this game. I enjoy the art and I love mysteries in general. It gave me the feel of old point and click adventures. 

BUT it's SO SLOW when it has no need to be. Both the plot and the gameplay. The puzzles aren't complicated and overall I became bored and dropped the game. I might recommend for a younger player, but otherwise save your time. Sadly I won't be getting mine back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013940622', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1594383114}
review:
Хм. Начну сразу с плохого.
Игра позиционируется как самостоятельная история, но нет. Это история, заканчивается клиффхенгером, что, как я считаю, неуважение к игрокам.
Управление на клавиатуре - неудобное, сюжет разгоняется очень долго.
Зато тут красивая картинка, сюжет когда разгонится - становится вполне интересным.
Жаль, нельзя поставить нейтральную оценку. За старания - рекомендую.
Но концовка...

author: {'steamid': '76561198829483727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1594278187}
review: Dense exciting story told in lovely designed pictures, animations and dialogues. Although character movement is limited to sidescrolling, there's still much to discover.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000940943', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1594273489}
review:
El desarrollo de la historia y personajes es bueno, evoluciona bien a través del tiempo. La ilustración y animación es linda, se ve la misma paleta de colores a lo largo del juego pero que hacen juego con la ambientación adecuada.

La historia parece simple pero se va volviendo más compleja a medida de que avanza el juego. 

Estás escribiendo el que pareciera ser tu último libro, eres reconocido por las aventuras de "Jenny LeClue", una niña detective, hija de Julie LeClue (detective) y Henry LeClue (fallecido). Te exigen que, para publicar tu libro, la historia debe estar llena de misterio y asesinatos pero... Jenny LeClue se caracterizaba por resolver misterios "amigables" y aptos para niños, pero si quieres seguir con las publicaciones de tus libros debes acatar las órdenes... Así es como Jenny se ve envuelta en la resolución de un crimen en Arthurton, la ciudad que parecía que lo tenía todo. 
Mientras resuelves el misterio de una muerte e intentas encontrar al verdadero asesino para sacar a tu madre de la carcel, pondrás a prueba tu amistad con tu mejor amigo y tal vez puedas conocer nuevas amistades... 

¿Puzzles?, si
¿Decisiones?, si... pero no creo que afecten el final
¿Entretenido?, si

¿Pero qué es ese final?...no me termina de convencer que tenga el final que tiene, pero si cambio de opinión tal vez edite esta reseña... aún así el juego es bueno, sólo no quedé satisfecha con la manera en que termina.

Horas aproximadas de juego: 8-10 hrs tal vez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198828778418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16346, 'last_played': 1602447799}
review: Had my eye on this game for a long time, and was excited to play when it came out. It surpassed my expectations with its charming town/characters and gorgeous art! This is definitely worth a purchase if you're into mysteries and fun stories. Really looking forward to the next installment, though I hope there are more side-cases next time around unrelated to the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289656671', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1593890495}
review:
Начну с хорошего:
1) Замечательная атмосфера игры.
2) Отличная графика.
3) Неплохой сюжет. Ничего закрученного и замудрённого.
4) Головоломки, которые и вправду «ломают твою голову». Поверьте, вам захотеться при прохождении посмотреть ответы на некоторые из них. 

Теперь поговорю про плохое:
1) Концовка [spoiler]Расстроен, что выбор игрока ничего не меняет в самой концовке. Выбор того, кто умрёт — неинтересно и банально.[/spoiler]
2) Скучное начало игры. В начале очень мало геймлейной части: одни диалоги, которые хочется проматывать и проматывать. 

Моя оценки к игре — 7/10. Жду продолжение, если оно будет конечно...

author: {'steamid': '76561198053049087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1593770539}
review:
Overall I enjoyed the game. Wonderful art style and atmosphere. Decent humor. HOWEVER,

as others have pointed out and I didn't know before hand,
the game currently doesn't seem to rap up all its plot threads and ends with a "To Be Continued" kind of thing.
I was not aware of this fact before hand and was left with a somewhat unsatisfied feeling after finishing my first playthrough.

I hope what happened to Broken Age doesn't happen with this game too.

On the flip side, it sounds like they'll be adding voice acting to the game soon, which I was also unaware of before playing.
So, that's nice. Maybe I'll replay the game some day. Hopefully it will have a conclusion by then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978604096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1593740736}
review:
If you like games like THIMBLEWEED PARK or OXENFREE or NIGHT IN THE WOODS, I think you're really going to enjoy this game. The artstyle is great, the music is wonderful, and I just really enjoy spending time with the characters. At time of review, I'm maybe half(?) way through the mystery and I'm hooked. 

If I had any minor quibble, the puzzles are mostly of the assembling puzzle pieces or rotating disc variety, but I think the style and breeziness of the puzzles keep it fresh. The game also has an interrogation, clue hunting, and deduction mechanic that is low key and fun. These are not hard puzzles and if you're expecting some Sierra-level moon logic (or Thimbleweed Park-level grammar sorcery), you might find them a little shallow, but I think they provide nice little diversions between story beats.

edit: Turns out I was farther into it than I thought! I guess this is going to be an episodic series? The ending is pretty abrupt and some people find it a little unsatisfying. For me, I reeeeaalllly loved the characters in this and I think it has a lot of heart, so I'm sad it's over but excited for Chapter 2: Detectivu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087395427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1593649683}
review:
Buyer beware: This game is episodic in nature. This is only Episode 1 (or at least that's the best explanation I've heard for why the ending is the way that it is).

This game is a very easy going, visually-appealing interactive story. The puzzles are very easy and the game is very forgiving. The art, animations, music, sound effects are all top notch.

If you're looking for a challenge, I'd recommend checking out an actually puzzle game, like The Witness or Baba is You. If you're looking for a good mystery game, this game is the one you want. 

The story is probably the weakest part of this game. The mystery's resolution feels a tad out of left field and the story is lackluster. The main character develops throughout the story, yes, but a lot of her character development doesn't feel earned IMHO. 

Would I recommend it? Yes. It is well-done overall. It will be especially worthwhile when the second part comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284663251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1593592315}

author: {'steamid': '76561198275140236', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1602994835}
review: 10/10! Я под большим впечатлением от этой игры! Она действительно невероятно атмосферная, симпатичная и интересная. Отдельно стоит сказать о персонажах, потому что они по истине живые! Каждый наделен своим характером и имеет свой вкус жизни. Стоит отметить храбрость и мужество главной героини. Графическая составляющая игры просто необычайная: цвета, пейзажи, архитектура! Чистое великолепие и услада! Больше всего из персонажей мне понравилась Флоренс и её дочь Сьюзи, они очень располагающие, добрые и олицетворяют женскую сущность. Мне очень нравится реализация геймплея: собирать наклейки, читать личный дневник, исследовать местность, искать зацепки и наводящие факторы! Я чувствовала, как развивается моё дидактическое мышление. Единственное, что не понравилось, это склонение и убеждение ребенка к непослушанию. Если бы играл ребёнок, он бы наверняка полностью считал это поведение и стал бы поступать так же. В целом, игра хорошая и заслуживает внимания. Спасибо за это чудесное произведение!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202989419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1595889845}
review:
Update after voice acting added: Wow this game is just amazing now! With the added voice acting it puts this game over the top fantastic! The voice acting is so good and all of the characters match the voice perfectly!  I can't wait for the sequel!!

So this isn't the usual point and click game with inventory and puzzles that I typically play, but I'm really glad I gave it a try.  I wish there had been voice acting, but other than that this was a great game.  I'm looking forward to replaying and making a few different choices and finding all those stickers!  I really enjoyed the story though it started very sugary and beige, the story quickly changes and gets interesting and mysterious.  I'm eagerly awaiting the sequel.
