author: {'steamid': '76561198151395732', 'num_games_owned': 3946, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1595369521}
review:
I first played the demo for this a few years ago on itch.io and was absolutely impressed. now that it's been kickstarted and fully released, I dipped my toes into it earlier today. and my first impressions are really positive:

+ the writing is fun and clever, the author is affable and Jenny is an adorable lead.
+ fantastic, unique visuals.
+ nice music.
+ so far, an interesting story conceit that has loads of potential.
+ solid puzzles.

by no means a definitive opinion, but things are looking good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372126296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1593054114}
review: Great game - It was a little slow in the beginning but it does pick up so stick to it! Has excellent storytelling and visuals for the story. I was really absorbed in the game after a certain point which is a good sign to me. I would definitely play an additional installment when it is (hopefully) released :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047761166', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1592976115}
review: This game has an incredible art style to it. The colors are brilliant and very pleasing to the eye. The atmosphere and musical choice also makes for a very pleasing experience. As far as the story goes I found it very fascinating! It wasn't too predictable the way other games tend to be and it had quite a few surprises that threw me off in the best way. I would definitely recommend trying this game out. It was longer than expected and worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060150011', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1620927808}
review:
OK so I finally beat the game! Here is the edited review!

So this is a charming little adventure game about an author's character Jenny LeClue, a girl whose boring town suddenly becomes a LOT less boring after a murder happens and her mother is framed! Jenny must use her detective skills to find out just what's going on and save her mom - and the author's - reputation.

That's the premise to a captivating story full of well written characters, there's a fair bit of humor in there and even some scary stuff, but nothing that isn't too outside the realm of family friendly. The dialogue between characters is believable and snappy! The ending as mentioned in the product page is a cliffhanger ending and while some people took umbrage with it I personally felt it fit right in and worked wonderfully as a cliffhanger! My advice to anyone playing this is make sure to pay attention to BOTH sides of the story, and things will fit together nicely.

Such a great story would be lost on the player however if it wasn't presented well, and Mografi have knocked the presentation out of the park and into the stratosphere! This game is GORGEOUS, absolutely beautiful environments, personality-filled character animations, cinematic camera work, it's almost an interactive cartoon! The music and sound design are equally as great and really help with the immersion. Plus voice acting will be coming soon so it's going to get even better!

The gameplay is not a point and click as you might believe but rather controller/keyboard only and I would definitely recommend a controller after playing with the keyboard. There is basic side-scrolling platforming which occasionally breaks into separate scenes where you search for clues with a magnifying glass or interact with an object in some way. This gameplay and also the puzzles are not the most challenging but that doesn't matter to me, not every game has to be crazy-intense on the reflexes or Sierra absurdly complicated puzzles. I had definite fun playing this and I think you will too. There's a cool system where you can see how dialogue choices represent the type of player you are, and some of these choices will affect the development of the next game! ALSO YOU CAN DECORATE YOUR JOURNAL WITH STICKERS!!!

There are the occasional bugs where the game gets stuck and you can't get out but they are working diligently to iron them out and the auto-save is so generous you'll never lose much progress if you happen to run into one.

Bottom line, this is a game made from the heart and you won't be disappointed. It took a few years to come out but it's SO WORTH IT!  Can't wait for Jenny LeClue, Detectivu 2!

Excellent work, Mografi!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999317451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1591717540}
review:
There are many qualities to this game, but one minor, one major and one gigantic flaws. 

Pros:

* I never expected such a high quality for the art and animation from a very small indie team. Even where repeated, art is always stylish, charming and never boring. 
* The story is well written (if only a bit slow to really start) and a decent length in my opinion. 
* The puzzles are nice even though I found them slightly too easy, but that blends well with the "charming" tone of the game in my opinion. 

Cons:

* The minor flaw is that many mini games (I cannot really call those puzzles... it's just pressing a button repeatedly) are boring. 
* The major flaw is that there is no mouse support on PC. This was clearly designed with consoles in mind but it is still baffling it is not there for PC.
* The gigantic flaw is that this not a full game even though it is marketed/I bought (kickstarted) it as such. Ending a game in the middle of the story you have worked the whole game to build with a "to be continued" message is really lame. Honestly, if the story was finished properly, I would have bought a second instalment without a second thought but with this situation, I really feel ripped of. So my advice to anybody who did not buy this game yet, is to avoid buying it until the second part is released and this half game is marketed as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009752238', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1591597150}
review:
This was a very charming and unique game and I'm super happy I played it. I want to say that Jenny Leclue plays like a Point and Click game, except that it;s side scrolling. It took me some getting used to at first, but I liked how unique the developers made it.

The story comes at you in two-fold. On the meta side of things you are an author who has been writing a popular child detective series for years. However, your agent says that you need to spice it up or bit or your series will be cancelled. That's right, someone in the series has to DIE in your next book! The second fold is you playing as Jenny, the child detective who lives in the small town of Arthurton. It's one of those perfect small towns that no one really knows, but tourists love to pass through when traveling. It's a pretty boring town, however, it has some surprising secrets. Jenny somehow gets pulled in to the mystery of the town and has to find out what its hiding!

The controls are pretty simple. I used a controller and you will mostly be moving left to right and investigating various objects and things to solve small cases. The dialogue was very funny and well written. I love how the author is the narrator and would argue with Jenny sometimes. The way you solve cases was very fun. After gathering clues, the game does a fun thing where you have to match the corresponding clues to solve the case.

The art style is very cute and stylish. Love the colors and the hand writing scribbles whenever Jenny is investigating things. The puzzles are decently challenging as well. Some made me scratch my head and I had to think. But they were never so hard that I needed a guide or anything. Although there is no voice acting, the music is nice and ambient for all the mystery and danger Jenny will find herself in. You will also find yourself making choices that will alter the story slightly and there are multiple endings as well. The game oozes charm and I love it.

I only have one gripe with this game. There are a lot of platforming puzzles and they aren't much of a problem. Some of them will have you pushing and pulling objects to reach higher ledges. They mapped the push and climb button to the same button and often times I would have trouble getting Jenny to do one or the other in certain puzzles because of this. I feel they should have made the pushing a diffferent button and the climbing another to prevent the super minor frustration. It's a small gripe, but you'll understand once you reach those puzzles.

Final verdict? Give it a try! It's a great game, only about 9-10 hours long and very fun! It's fun trying to solve the mystery along with Jenny and figure out who gets killed. I got a very cliffhanger ending that didn't make sense, but I think that's just because I got a bad ending. I still loved this game and hope they continue the series. Thanks for reading!

TL:DR: A point and click-like adventure game that is side scrolling. Very charming and fun with decent challenging puzzles. I recommend it if you want to play a fun and cute mystery game with as a child detective!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091288363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1657720605}
review:
Hacía mucho tiempo que no disfrutaba tanto un choose your own adventure. La historia se torna de la infancia más temprana a la oscuridad absoluta, con una gama de colores que acompaña totalmente la sintonía de la situación, generando un ambiente total que acompaña todo lo que vive Jenny. 
Amé totalmente la posibilidad de elecciones, la diversidad de factores que alteran la historia, y las dificiles decisiones que debe tomar un escritor que está por caer en la ruina. Todo tiene una conexión aglutinante dentro de este juego, y todavía faltan más cosas que aun no tienen respuesta <3  
Just can't wait 4 the next game s2

author: {'steamid': '76561198027879009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1593881330}
review:
I found this gem by accident. What a surprise! I did not expect to see such a charming game with a story that captures the mystery of exploring something unknown so well. 

A good mixture of humor, riddles, exploration, danger. The riddles are logical and can be solved by observation. The exploration is lengthy enaugh to provide a sense of greatness without being tedious. The choices that you have to make increase the immersion quite a bit. Let the mystery unfold!

I would really love to see more of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045487131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1591322271}
review: My husband and I played Jenny LeClue without looking up too much about it. Quirky smart main character- check. Good writing- check. Fun mysteries to solve-check. However, some of the ways to go about things is clunky and not user intuitive. I wish there was more mouse support. We really enjoyed playing the game but were really disappointed to be hit with the fact that it is episodic at the end of the game. Thinking that maybe I missed it on the store page I went back to pour over it. The store does say it's episodic, but you have to click the read more under a ton of information about the game (I really didn't want to know much before going in to deepen the mystery). I believe that the developers should have put that in the top or the synopsis paragraph to the side. I really wouldn't have minded it being episodic if I was mentally prepared for it. I'm still recommending the game because I really did enjoy it, but with the warning that IT IS EPISODIC.

review:

아이디어는 좋은데 좋은 아이디어를 많이는 몬 찍어내서 돌려막기하는 느낌

-------------------------------------------------------
2020-12-29

12시간 플레이 중에서 가장 흥미로웟던 파트가 엔딩이었음 시벌거;
추리파트는에 비해서 라디오 맞추기 넘 많은데 그게 한 5번은 나왓나?

author: {'steamid': '76561198163977244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1589682506}
review:
I really don't know what to think of this game. It's sort of... childish, and sweet, and family-friendly on one hand, but some sequences, my god. They are just creepy.

Lovely art style, beautiful and vibrant, entertaining story, good puzzles, the game brought some chuckles, even if behind all the blush it tells a painfully familiar story of the murder of someone's creativity. I generally liked it, it had nice pacing, things, however weird they were, made sense, and I left with a hope of a sequel for this game, but such things as harder puzzles and mouse support (and yes, I realsie it's a tablet port) would only make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019934920', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1589737212}
review:
Jenny ist ein kleines Mädchen in der langweiligen Stadt Arthurton. Ihr großer Traum ist es Detektivin zu sein und ein großes Mysterium aufzuklären. Ihr Traum geht jedoch schneller in Erfüllung als erwartet und sie stürzt Hals über Kopf in einer unglaubliche Verschwörung hinein.
Das Spiel präsentiert sich in einem wunderschönen Cartoon-Stil und sprüht mit den verrückten und interessanten Charakteren nur so vor Charme und Witz und auch die Musik trägt sehr gut zum Erlebnis bei. Durch das "Wählerischkeit"-System hat man die Möglichkeiten durch Entscheidungen die Story zu beeinflussen, wobei das jedoch anscheinand nicht allzu große Auswirkungen auf den Ausgang der Geschichte hat. Alles in allem ist es ein sehr schönes und verspieltes Detektivabenteuer, bei dem selten etwas so ist, wie man es erwartet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077831915', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1589487696}
review:
I first learned about Jenny LeClue a few years ago through Adventuregamers, after it had already been funded on Kickstarter. I followed the progression of the game through the developer's page and eagerly awaited the arrival of this beautifully animated detective game, led by a young girl no less! 
I regret to say that even though the developers obviously put a lot of effort in this game, it’s poorly constructed in terms of gameplay, plot and pace. After spending 21 hours of my life on it, which I’m never getting back, I feel a bit outraged – so forgive my long review and negative rant. I really regret being a completionist since I otherwise would have deserted the game maybe an hour after trying it.
The thing that bothers me most is that even though the protagonist is a child, I didn’t expect the game to be aimed at kids and did not see any indication in the description or marketing that this was the case. But the pace and gameplay scream “slowed for kids to follow”, with repetitive and easy mechanics. I was expecting a cool, funny and challenging point and click adventure game, and got a visual novel with some low-challenge platforming and a frustratingly slow pace. Speaking of miscommunicating what the game is – nowhere is it mentioned that the game has countless boring and unchallenging platformer sequences.
I want to focus on the clunky and annoying mechanics – instead of clicking on items to make them work, the game forces you to tap repeatedly each time. What’s wrong with a simple point and click? Why do you have to make the players work hard to do something simple? The dialogues force you to press the enter button after each short sentence or description, and there’s a lot of them. Sometimes a magnifying glass appears and you have to search the screen for something hidden and hold till you see what it is. Every gameplay mechanic is repetitive and annoying – you find stickers for your journal (not interesting if you’re above a certain age), you have the simplest “put together parts of postcards”, you have to make electrical circuits work with the right flow. The only original puzzles in the game are syncing radio waves together to get messages, and deciphering messages from a book with a certain code. Though the puzzles are simple and not creative in general, the real sin is how much they recur; after the third identical puzzle solution (breaking a barrier by tapping 30 times in different places, for instance, which I had to do at least 5 times) – it’s not fun.
It takes the game forever to move past the introduction and actually get to the main mystery, and even after the long unveiling we’re left with a bunch of tired tropes (evil corporation! Cover-up! Things not as they seem! What is ridiculed at first is actually true!). To make matters worse, a lot of things are left unexplained and unaddressed, and the game ends with a cliffhanger! Yes, you get the infamous “to be continued” at the end after only part of the issues were resolved. A very long game just to get to a half-resolution so the developers can compel you to buy their next game? Not cool. Also, the frame story in which an author of detective stories struggles with his editor’s demand to make Jenny’s world more gruesome and murderous adds very little to the plot, is a tired trope, and makes the game longer with little value in return.
The music, like the gameplay, is repetitive and gets old very fast, and there is no voice acting that might have brought some flair to otherwise-stereotypical characters.
The art is really the one aspect that makes the game shine, and I really wish that the rest of the game had aligned with that.

review: 초반은 약간은 싱거운, 지루함이 있으나 갈수록 이야기와 세계에 빠져드는, 곳곳에 배치된 퍼즐도 재미를 더해간다. 간혹 동일 패턴이 존재하기는 하나 헤매지 않는 보너스 같다고 할까.. 중간중간 난해한 퍼즐로 스트레스가 있는 와중에 쉬어가는 느낌. 아직 남은 길에 얼마나 새로움이 있을지 궁금. 아트웤이 좋아서 캡쳐하는 순간이 기대되기도. 음악이 덜한게 조금 아쉽, 어울리는 백경음악과 좀 더 다이나믹한 보이스가 깔렸다면 더욱 더할 나위 없을 거 같다.

review:
This has the look and feel of being more a kids game than something designed for adults or people looking for entertainment, thus be forewarned.
The pacing of the game has all the charm of an Alcoholics Anonymous meeting without coffee and donuts. I consider my purchase of this game to be more of a donation to the developers than anything else.

review: Скука смертная. Час игры полный  длинных бестолковых диалогов, отвратительного (без джойстика) управления и так и не начавшегося сюжета. Зато понятно откуда у писателя, создавшего юного детектива такие проблемы, на первой главе реально можно уснуть. Картинка яркая, но желания продолжать мучиться с двиганием курсора по экрану и чтением тягомотных разговоров не вызывает. Как это с Тремя Сыщиками можно сравнить (в литературном плане) вообще не понятно. Детектив для пятилетней девочки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166013157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1589108366}
review:
今このゲームを7時間ぶっ通しでプレイしてからこのレビューを書いています。
それくらい、私にとってこのゲームは面白かったです。
最後の方に差し掛かる解決シーンを見ながら、「早く皆に広めておススメレビューを書こう！」と思っていたくらいです。
ですが、表記の通りその希望は打ち砕かれました。

今からありとあらゆるくらいの長所をがりがり書きます。
その最後に決定的な欠点を書きますが、欠点＝ネタバレになるので
ネタバレを食らいたくないのであれば長所だけ見てください。
「おすすめしない」を本当につけたくないくらいこのゲームは良い物になっていたはずでした。

長所
・主人公を含む癖のある魅力的なキャラクター（内面も外面も）
・創作者に分かる「自分のオリジナルキャラクターをいじめるのに抵抗がある」という気持ち
　そして一旦いじめ始めると「それが冒険なのだ」と気が付く気持ち
　（実はTRPGのGM経験者としてはここが最高に面白い）
・カートゥーン調の風景、奥行きや雰囲気を重視した表現
・UIの優れたゲームシステム（UIは昨今のゲームでもかなり良いと感じた）
・平和な街に潜む闇を、平和に飽き飽きした主人公が解き明かすという王道シナリオ
・考えの見える推理パート（メモっぽく書いていくシーンが最高です）
・詰まり防止のシステム（調べるべき何かに近づくとボタンが出る、推理で間違ってもすぐやり直せる）
・随所の選択によって自分のタイプを判別してくれるシステム
　（判定の是非はともかく、面白いシステム。）






















ーーーーーーここから短所ーーーーーーー

短所
・このゲームが「未完成」だと言われても言い逃れできない。

トゥルーエンド（とはいっても普通にプレイすればたどり着く）が
「ハッピーエンド」なのか「バッドエンド」なのか判別できないのです。

ざっくり言うと、名探偵コナンで眠りの小五郎が犯人を特定した後、
犯人が大人しく何がを話し始めた瞬間で「To be continued」と出ずに「THE END」と出ます。

本当にこれ1点です。
ENDの演出を見て、クリア後てっきり「まだ未回収要素があったのかな」と思っていたら、steam内のスレッドを見て愕然としました。
7時間やってきて、「結果は続編orDLCにお預け」と言うつもりでしょうか。
ここまで100点満点中95点くらいつけてたのに、この1点だけで一気にガクンと落ちて、友人に勧める気も起きなくなりました。
いつか、DLC・更新などでちゃんと終わりをつけてくれることを願っています。
続編を狙っているのかもしれないですが、これでは裏切られた感が残って買う気が起きません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198378944124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1589363357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144434789', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1588957789}
review:
Começo extremamente interessante e cativante, com visuais absolutamente lindos e chamativos. O jogo começa com uma introdução (FTUE) muito gostosa que conduz e insere o jogador na temática muito eficazmente. 

Entretanto, da mesma maneira que nós somos inseridos, nós somos retirados, pois, com o passar do tempo, o jogo se torna repetitivo e monótono, com mecânicas, à primeira vista, interessantes, mas que ao serem utilizadas repetidas vezes, tornam-se massantes. 

Ainda no âmbito do game design, o jogo não tem um bom flow, pois ele não concede respiros e nos faz permanecer em uma incessantemente subida frustrante de puzzles cansativos com uma narrativa medíocre.

Resumindo, é um jogo muito competente em ser visualmente lindo, mas que, talvez infelizmente, nos gera tanta expectativa por ter um começo tão cativante, que, depois de algumas horas jogando, ficamos desamparados ao percebermos que o jogo se resumirá a somente isso.

Apesar de tudo, é preciso ressaltar, mais uma vez, como o jogo é absolutamente lindo. Fiquei apaixonado com a beleza gráfica, ela me impactou e me fez gostar, ainda mais, do começo do jogo. Além disso, o product value é outro fator a ser comentado: é estonteante o carinho que os desenvolvedores tiveram em colocar inúmeros detalhes gráficos, e, também, feedbacks que, apesar de parecerem imperceptíveis, fazem toda diferença! 

Eu realmente queria passar mais tempo naquele início ensolarado, saindo da universidade, vendo os pássaros e conversando com o reitor, talvez resolvendo alguns casos por ali mesmo, queria ter aproveitado mais do jogo e, sinceramente, gostaria de ter sido cativado do início ao fim. Infelizmente não aconteceu.

Talvez eu esteja sendo tão duro, pois eles me botaram tão lá no alto que a queda foi brusca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210864601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1599910746}
review:
To be continued, but not unfinished.
After I'd bought the game I read a review (yeah I know, wrong order) that complained that the game just stops with a 'to be continued'. While this is true, there is a resolution of sorts and it really doesn't matter that much. The 'ASDW' interface is kind of old school and even after playing for hours I was still hitting the arrow keys and wondering why nothing moved but that's probably just me.
The crucial thing in any adventure game (iIMHO) is that the story drives the gameplay and that's true here. I rarely had to think about what I was supposed to be doing.  All in all a fun, distinctive and quirky game. I'm looking forward to part two!

review:
Superbe DA.

On se laisse aller très facilement dans cette super histoire de détective, malgré le début enfantin, la suite devenant plus sombre et plus prenante, manque juste des voix pour que le jeu soit parfait.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981325554', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1569023276}
review:
It's more of a visual novel, not a game.

I purchased Jelly LeClue when it was still in production, based on the eye candy looks and some humour from the trailer. 
And it really does look amazing. The story is also quite ok.

However, there is not enough "gameplay" for me to even consider calling it a game. It's really a visual novel. Just because you can move character between places and click on some things to have a puzzle or two (they are also quite repetitive here) doesn't mean it has any gameplay.

Jenny LeClue feels boring. It drags a lot. Usual visual novels have mostly unanimated screens with a lot of text and dialogue choices. Here you have empty spaces you can walk on, with some little dialogue going on between them. The game also likes to lock you up in one room until you "solve" (find/click) something. Then it moves you to another room. It's very linear in this regard. 

The whole things seems like its main target was kids. This was never specified in the descriptions and I found the whole experience was a bit "tacky" in this regard. 

The game is also unfinished. It ends with a "to be continued" sign. So... clearly the creator couldn't manage to finish it in time, maybe due to the poor design choices - if there's no gameplay and all you have is some dialog and a LOT of graphics, then drawing all this by hand (and animating!) can really take forever. 

All in all it's not a good game, if it even is a game. However, if you're looking for something for your young kids to play, then it may be ok. But reading a book is probably better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015488045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 8304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1598364125}
review:
Адвенчура, которая после "Ночи в лесу" доставила самое большое удовольствие.
Читанные в детстве со сдержанностью про Неси Дрю, с зевотой про Братьев Харди, с восторгом про Трех Сыщиков, подготовили неплохой фундамент для восприятия стилистики игры. Она прекрасно заигрывает и использует приемы как "детских детективов", так и вполне взрослых. Тут есть намеки и на Lost и на Твин Пикс. 
Текстово все круто
Локализация очень неплохая
Визуал шикарный
Звук умеренныый, одна из напряженных тем, кажется совпадает с Оруэлл. Интересно, это просто общий банк, или одни купили у других.... Не понял. 

Рекомендую всем как лучший детектив и приключение последних лет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157388471', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1587346068}
review:
Para los que sepan hablar español o enterderlo.

Disfrute mucho el juego, me gusto la forma en como se mostraba tanto en la historia, como en su arte visual el juego; tanto en el aspecto de cada personaje que le da un tono unico de todos los demas, y el mundo en donde se desarrolla la historia; los personajes son muy carismaticos y cada uno tiene su propia historia si pones atencion. Recomiendo si te alcanza el dinero y te interesa la premisa del juego, vale la pena darle una oportunidad; o si no, puedes ir a ver unos youtubers para ver la historia (de aqui en adelante ya es tu decision si quieres comprarlo o verlo en youtube).

y spoilers de aqui en adelante.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Aunque el juego haya quedado en un final inconcluso, y por lo que la mayoria opine sobre que este tipo de premisas pueda ser un poco fustrantes en varios elementos como las series para una segunda temporada para continuar la historia; o como las veces que en la saga de "The walking dead" de TellTales (que en paz descanse) que la historia continue en el siguiente capitulo. Pero en mi opinion, si podemos sobrevivir a esta pandemia que estamos ahora, espero con ancias la siguiente entrega de esta saga, para ver como concluye o como fluye la historia en la segunda parte. (y tal vez pude haber puesto todo esto es ingles; idioma que la mayoria habla, pero me da flojera ( :P ) )

author: {'steamid': '76561197980971062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1605774822}
review: SPOILER ALERT! IT ENDS ON A HUUUUUGE CLIFFHANDER! FUCK!!!! WHY!? Who the hell makes a Detective/Mystery story and ends it on a CLIFFHANDER!?!? Mystery stories are ALL about the catharsis at the very end! The Denouement! The Big Reveal!! THE FUCK!? I loved this game so much that it just sucks all the more that there is a nonending and that I have to not recommend it.... UGH! Please get the damn sequel out soon so I can find out what the hell actually happens in this story!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011515841', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1639443471}
review:
Absolutely loved this game!  It was what I expected, a girl detective story, but it was much more.  The detective story is framed by that of the author who is pressured to make Jenny’s stories more exciting.  And so an exciting story we get.  The wonderful range of characters and the story are the best part of this game.  Coming in a close second is the beautiful and colorful artwork that makes up the town of Arthurton both above and below the surface.

Some of the puzzles were repetitive, but they make sense with the story and this game is too good for that to be a deal breaker.  The challenge level was very doable.  No walkthroughs needed but enough of a challenge that I wasn’t bored.

There are collectibles and optional areas that give more information and fill out the story even more.  I would recommend spending the time and not rushing through.  My play time was about 16 hours to complete the game, find all the secret areas and almost all the collectibles.  Even if you speed through, you should get at least 8-10 hrs of play time.

The developers have said that voiceovers have been recorded and will be added in an update soon.  There is discussion over the game ending on a cliffhanger.  The entire mystery of Arthurton and Jenny LeClue’s family will be continued into the sequel.  The main case that was the crux of this game was solved. The game leaves you wanting more because there is more to discover about what’s going on in this place, but I completely disagree that the game is “unfinished.”  The Case of Who Killed the Dean is solved.  The developers gave an update last month saying the sequel is in pre-production right now and I can’t wait for it!

This game was cute, funny and sucked me in from start to finish.  I highly recommend this game.  It is well worth the price and the time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295012458', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1606380936}
review:
Мне нравятся игры, Но чтоб Детективная игра у меня На момент Этого обзора ВПЕРВЫЕ, Мне игра ОЧЕНЬ понравилась, Сюжет Супер! Все кто хотят эту игру советую всем Кто впервые хочет Поиграть в детективные игры! Даже Достижения секретные , это даже немного радует, так как не будет спойлеров! (Мой вам совет, просто посмотрите трейлер игры, не смотрите прохождения, иначе вам будет особо не интересно играть)
Переводы есть, Так что Вопросов по поводу: "Тут где то не переведено!" не будет (Есть один момент где немного не так написали, но думаю после этого обзора исправят)
Проходите сами, Конечно если где то вы пройти не можете , можете подглядеть в видео, НО только чтоб пройти! Дальше сами!
И как я уже говорил, игра отличная! Всем советую, На момент этого обзора у меня не было минусов!

author: {'steamid': '76561198398256896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1585693755}
review:
I appreciate this game more after largely coming up empty when looking for similar games to Night in the Woods. If you like that game, you should definitely give this one a try, there are lots of similar elements both narratively and stylistically.

However, be warned that the ending very abruptly announces that this game is only part 1 of a larger story, in a way that didn't feel earned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330592017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1643465577}
review:
刚玩完是，说说感想。总体来说给个好评
刚一开始就是中文系统BUG,根本没法开始游戏，好不容易在steam翻到评论解决了。问一句制作商：你们这个bug都多久还不修复？？
操作方面是全键盘，简单明了，对手残患者很友好，不会产生跳跃失败的剧情；但是有些操作其实更适合用鼠标来完成。开船那里的操作就很迷，卡的我关游戏两次去看电视
大部分时候信息给的很全，前面根据每个人找线索很有趣，有一说一比后面爬来爬去有趣多了。后面来回折腾的剧情不是很方便，而且有些时候奔跑键不能用就只能慢慢走……我这个暴脾气……
没有存档功能，疯了。只能等到自动存档，很累，希望修复完中文就修复这个吧

剧透警告

其实船那边还是提示被误解了。说是要回家，然后捡了一张纸条，上了回家的船反而要跟着纸条走，这一点没大想过来。
游戏很漂亮也很有趣！解迷非常有意思！我超喜欢珍妮和作家的；
但是能不能，在这个游戏名字上加一个【珍妮克鲁索第一部】或者【上篇】，至少让我知道结局是TBC啊！！！我好不容易打到结局，选择了一个开关，决定了一个人的生死，音乐缓缓开始，大门打开——告诉我，未完待续？？
未完待续？？？？？
心态直接就崩了 你就告诉我 玩之前 买之前 我怎么能知道它还没完结、？是没完结还是烂尾了？？下一部什么时候？有详细更新日期吗？？
（试图冷静ing
我真是感觉看了一部玄幻小说男主角刚买齐装备走出村门就被牛车撞死了
你们加油继续制作 
我还是给好评，是个好游戏，瑕不掩瑜

只要有结局
只要有结局
有结局！！！！！

不说了，生气去了

author: {'steamid': '76561198431344834', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1581488706}
review:
相当优秀的解谜游戏，画风可爱，剧情衔接的也很紧密。而且没有恐怖元素，非常日常，可以心情放松地玩下去。
而且解谜设置得非常恰到好处，都是不需要去找攻略但也需要尽全力才能破解的。
作者脑洞真的很大，剧中剧的形式也很新颖。
但是流程稍微有点长，而且为什么有的地段不能奔跑，看得我有点着急。
我觉得算是我玩过非常好的解谜游戏了，希望更多人能发现这个宝藏游戏。
期待后续更新（？）

author: {'steamid': '76561198165791247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1580446435}
review:
beautiful visuals, music, animation, and i think the dialog is good. sadly, however, this game does not suit my tastes. it has everything i love about a good game, except the gameplay isn't my thing. i'm fine with puzzles, just not these ones. it's a game that requires patience, of course, but it's asking too much of it from me and i don't find the puzzles to be very amusing (in my opinion).

it's definitely a great game, and i think it's worth the money if you have the patience to play through it. personally, it's just not for me. i'd say give it try and see if you might enjoy it.

also, this is technically part 1. from what i've read, the story ends on a cliffhanger.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047897265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1579984221}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993516952', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1579928080}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a promising adventure game from a fledgling studio. On the whole, I think the game shines brightest aesthetically: the art, music, and animation are very well done. The writing and character work is also handled well. My biggest issue comes with the gameplay: instead of playing like a LucasArts point-and-click adventure, it's a sidescroller with very limited interactivity. It feels like playing a point-and-click adventure game with the hint system forced on. Making matters worse, traversal is typically boring: slowly climbing vines or ladders, the lockpicking minigame doesn't add anything, nor does the breaking of the planks do a satisfying job of creating pleasruable pacing. The game is at its best when it tells its story and lets you converse with the denizens of the town. It has a great sense of humor, and there's real character development going on here. I would really like to see a sequel embrace the more old school tenents of classic adventure games, namely actual puzzles without holding your hand. Perhaps a combination of the two styles could work. Keep the 2d movement but maybe include a full fledged inventory and allow us to solve puzzles. I would much rather prefer that than slowly climb up more ladders or vines.

In sum, not without its flaws to be sure, this is an adventure game with a lot of heart and charm. I look forward to the follow-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432100968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1579676093}
review: I expected this game to be point & click like the demo. It isn't. So I couldn't play until I could get help with the parts that required jumping, climbing, & grabbing. Which is practically the entire game. After 26 hours of game play it did not save my game like it is supposed to automatically do. I've closed and opened this game a million times before and it had always saved it right where I left off. I was so close to the end of the game! My only option now is to start a new game. I have no desire or physical energy to start this game all over again. The cost of this game was way overpriced for the agony it has brought me.  If I could I would ask for a refund!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123274967', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1578953721}
review: It's a pity that I can't recommend Jenny LeClue, because I did have a good time playing it. The mystery is intriguing, the writing is great, the art is lovely. The music fits well but does get a bit repetitive. The main issue is the gameplay - for a game with such cool stuff to think about, it doesn't really ask the player to think at any point. A couple of the detective sections use a nice system where you have to decide the three most important bits of information. This is a nice device but is used too seldom and never really develops. Instead, the game repeats other bits of gameplay such as a boating section which just aren't fun. A lot of the gameplay, such as the boating section, are "things you do" rather than proper gameplay, which is a pity. If you can look past that and just want to have a nice time with a charming story and fun characters, then pick this game up. As a whole package though, I think it falls sadly short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970653174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 3260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1618561236}
review:
It's a highly story-driven, puzzle-ish, enheartening story.

Pros:
* Decent character development - often obvious, but it happens, which gives it a leg up on its competition.
* Good level design.
* Puzzles were fun but not difficult enough to distract from the plot.
* Choices have an effect (?) - seems like it's the case, anyway.
* Collectibles weren't hard to find, if you search nooks and crannies.  I probably missed some, but it felt like I found most w/o seriously searching.

Cons:
* Ending was... sharp, and unsatisfying.  (Very strong hints of [spoiler]continuing the story in a sequel[/spoiler])

TL;DR: 8/10 if you ignore the ending, else 6/10 - Good, and probably worth replaying again after a few months pass, to clear my mind.  Vastly lower score because the ending really, really irked me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198997048770', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1621535020}

review: For the 1980's Sierra fan. This was a great choice. The puzzles in Jenny LeClue weren't hard but also not too easy. The story was engaging with a nice touch of snarky humor. Characters we likable for the most part. A couple of them bugged me, but that's to be expected. The perspective of having an author writing the novel as you play was equally entertaining. That ending though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198259860019', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1580703436}
review: Over all great game, The story line is great. As is the art style, with the almost always blue undertones, I like the color blue. The gameplay itself might be improved a some bit. Sometimes I get stuck with what I see, however Jenny can still move and I would guess interact with things but I can see it happen, so would have to go to the quit and start the game up again. But that is only one point off a 9/10 game. Ohh and don't stop playing because you think the 1st 30min of the game is easy or childish, because it quickly speeds up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993317307', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1609505179}
review:
Не ждал, что игра будет настолько хороша. Она увлекает, интригует и держит прикованным к экрану от начала и до конца. История очень интересно подана, персонажи запоминаются и им сопереживаешь, геймплей не перегружен лишними вещами, пазлы и загадки логичны и не переусложнены.

Единственный недостаток - после прохождения хочется, чтобы игра получила продолжение и в него можно было тоже поиграть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035881493', 'num_games_owned': 839, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1571357731}
review:
A Jenny LeClue Derectivú egy gyönyörű, kézzel rajzolt grafikájú 2D kalandjáték, amiben egy minden lében kanál kis detektív csaj életében először egy valódi gyilkossági ügybe keveredik. A sztorit a Jenny történetét író ifjúsági regényíró szála keretezi, aki megállás nélkül küzd önálló életre kelt kis hősnőjével, hogy megóvja a bajtól.

Jennyt viszont nem kell félteni, hiszen nagyon otthon érzi magát ebben a sötét mégis kedves, Twin Peaks-szerű új világban, ahol az elágazó beszélgetések, puzzle-ök és az L.A. Noire lightos verziójának megfelelő kihallgatások és nyomvadászatok várják.

Kisebbeknek és gyermeklelkű felnőtteknek egyaránt erősen ajánlott, szuper kis kalandjáték.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1943062468

author: {'steamid': '76561198019512267', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1593045474}
review:
와우... 열린 결말과 더불어 퍼즐도 머리를 조금만 쓰면 깰만합니다. 거기다가 3D와 2D의 중간의 멋진 아트들도 빼놓을수 없겠네요. 대신 엽서 뒤의 한글 폰트가 너무 커서 뭔지 알아먹기 어려운 정도가 있는데, 뭐 옥의 티라고 볼 정도입니다. 번역 수준이 상당하네요. 다른 언어는 모르겠지만, 확실히 한국어 번역은 잘되었습니다. 과연 2편은 나올것인가? 액자식 구성이긴 한데, 액자식에서 티격태격 하는것도 볼수 있습니다. 결론은 11/10 정도 되겠네요. 현기증 나니까 빨리 2편 내놓으세요.

ps. 애플 기기(macOS, iOS, iPadOS)를 쓰시는 분들은 애플 아케이드를 쓰시면 스팀없이 게임을 즐기실수 있으실 것입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418002776', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1593520470}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011639423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1598730978}
review:
I haven't played a lot of adventure games this  decade, but of the ones I have, Shardlight, Thimbleweed Park and Broken Age, Jenny LeClue is the one I think I'll replay a lot. While I didn't love the design interface, the WASD keys will be the death of me and the meta elements that took me out of the game, I loved how Jenny used deductions, the magnifying glass element and the world building was just sublime. I just wanted to explore more of Arthurton, especially Skull Island. I enjoyed the characters and while I'm very intrigued by the ending or endings, I wish it didn't end up on a cliffhanger.

P.S. full voice would be great but I understand if it wasn't in the budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834240140', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1601162370}

author: {'steamid': '76561198280468840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1576788998}
review:
Playing through this, was an experience like no other. The story is complex, delivering a heart stopping adventure. You can choose multiple choices that affect the grand scheme of the story tremendously! It only took me two nights to finish this game for the first time through. But I foresee several more days of playing to uncover more of the mysteries. I will warn you of a cliff hanger ending that MAY haunt your dreams until a sequel is made. But all in the same, this game is VERY WELL WORTH THE PRICE. 
 Jenny LeClue, became a character I related to and some of the choices ended up being heart breaking. Though one choice made things seem as if choices were going to lead to the same climax, it changed dramatically. There are big twists in this story and, even the slightest mistakes can seem much larger. I, myself wound up blaming myself for not turning the boilers off. Yet at the end it didn't show if they caused the ending I was suspecting would happen. In fact, the ending, or shall I say the cliff hanger leaves players wondering what choices will carry over. What the switch meant at the end, sorry for spoilers. I simply can't wait to play and read the sequel to find out what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079220438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1575783518}
review:
This game had an amazing plot. It was a good mystery with twists that kept me guessing. The characters were charming and felt like they had deep back stories. I can't wait until the next chapter for Jenny!

I liked that we had choices to make Jenny snarky or nice. Some choices have consequences on the plot points later and where you can explore. There's a setting to turn off the choice timer if you have trouble making the right (or less wrong!) decision.

Great mechanics for making it replayable. Jenny finds stickers and postcard fragments in spots where you may not think to explore. The stickers were so cute I wanted to find them all!

I can see some similarities from some of my favorite games. A notebook to collect notes like in Night in the Woods, but also to collect clues to the mystery. A radio frequency puzzle like Oxenfreee, but the radio puzzle was a little more complex. The bridge scene really reminded me of the spooky landscapes in Oxenfree. One song in the sound track really reminded me of the Machinarium sound track. Oh, and one sound track used a Mega Marvin, which is always neat and creepy to hear.

There's new mechanics in this game as well. Introducing an author as the narrator of the game means we get to pick when the author can't make a decision as to what to write. I loved some of the visual representations of this being a story someone was writing. [spoiler] It was amazing seeing Jenny run past the words the author was typing. [/spoiler] 

I would definitely replay this, and I'm looking forward to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307903631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1576001186}
review:
I have to say that the localization needs improvement. I have wishlisted the game for years and purchased it right after the release. But I had great difficulty in starting the new game in Chinese. I thought there was some bug and was waiting for fixes. Until today, I found that it was only because on the menu of "start new game? cancel / confirm", the button of "confirm" is missing in the Chinese version, so Chinese players have no way to know how to start the game! (unless they selected the confirm button that cannot be seen accidentally.) I hope this can be fixed soon so more Chinese players can enjoy this game, which, I expect to be great. 
选择了中文的同志们，进不去的原因是新游戏页面下，右边的确定按钮消失了，选择到左边的取消，再往右边移一下按确定，就能进入新游戏。这种bug也是醉了。 也可以先切换成英文再进去换中文。英文版没有这个bug。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035930579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1615166131}
review:
I held off on getting this for a little while, then picked it up during the Autumn Sale. My word, I'm glad I did! The art is beautiful, the story is riveting, and the MUSIC! I can't say enough about the sound design in this game! It's phenomenal! 

I really enjoyed the progression of the story, it went from everyday normal to absolutely insane in a very gradual manner until you were down a rabbit hole and not entirely sure how you got there. I also loved the "outside" story with the author, it really added another layer to the whole game. 

There are a few cons to this game tho. I ran into a bug in the sewers where Jenny was behind the scenery she was supposed to be running in front of, but it didn't stop me from interacting with anything, and a cutscene fixed it. The game also ends in a to be continued. Which, I hope it does, but this might be the only piece of the game we get. I think it's worth it, but you might not. Also, while I haven't gone through and unlocked all of the achievements for this game yet, I have the suspicion that this game only has one ending. So, if you were one of the people who was protesting outside of Bioware at the way Mass Effect ended, you won't like this game. 

TLDR: Awesome story, amazing music, totally worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977164553', 'num_games_owned': 1825, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1573164876}
review:
This game is quite intriguing. The art style is interesting. Somewhat reminiscient of South Park but a bit more grainy. The ideas are well implemented. I enjoyed my time with the game a lot.
There were only a few nagging issues, which did not detract too much from the overall enjoyment of the game.
The main character is a bit on the annoying side. The story stops abruptly on a cliffhanger. The puzzles were a bit on the easy side. The achievements are rather cryptic especially given the lack of description for many of them.
As stated above I enjoyed the game. The asking price is fine. 
I had a somewhat difficult time to come to a decision on the topic of recommending this game. But it fell ultimately on the recommended side.
Score: 7/9 - A good game with a few hiccups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073844849', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1597962173}
review: Jenny LeClue – Superdetectivu es una obra que no deja de progresar. De la inocencia más pura al drama más intenso. De los misterios más simples a los mayores enigmas. Aquí se nos habla del deseo de rebeldía, con una protagonista que se atreve a marchar contra su madre, contra el mundo entero y hasta contra su creador con tal de seguir un camino propio. Los motivos de esto, la conveniencia de recorrerlo o el resultado final tendrán que ser descubiertos por cada jugador. Pero una cosa está clara: sin duda será una experiencia divertida, completa y que nos hará sentirnos como auténticos detectives mientras conectamos con la historia que nos espera y dejamos que nuestro corazón se llene con el calor que solo ciertos títulos son capaces de ofrecer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977206235', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1574132564}
review:
[b]Muito repetitivo.[/b] Repetitivo até demais. Os mesmos minigames durante o jogo inteiro, com as mesmas mecânicas arrastadas e deduções pouco interessantes. "[b]Arrastado[/b]", aliás, é a palavra correta para esse jogo, que demora demais para acabar e ainda com um final extremamente bizarro, onde [spoiler]você nem ao menos tem uma resolução, fica um cliffhanger ENORME e a descoberta do assassino é bem broxante. [/spoiler]

Fora que, como jogo de detetive, você não exercita muito a sua lógica para descobrir o que é necessário para passar de cada fase. As deduções são bastante óbvias, o jogo praticamente joga elas na sua cara.

Não recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992572112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1574575083}
review:
This game is charming and visually beautiful. This little mountain town has stunning vistas! The framing device is an author trying to revive a dying series about a girl detective, and most of the game is you playing through the book as he writes it. It's not especially difficult, but the story really keeps you interested because the author is wrestling with how dark to make the plot, so it's not all rainbows and lost puppies. Nor is Jenny a Mary Sue; she's often a jerk.

Runs smoothly, is respectful of your time, has lots of fun things to find but not so much it stresses me out, but is sometimes a little buggy. I've had to reset the game a few times, but I never lost more than like three minutes of progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 2434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1655245705}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32296668-Casual-Game-Reviews/]More reviews on our Curator Page[/url]

[b]Jenny LeClue - Detectivu[/b] is the result of a very promising and successful [url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mografi/jenny-leclue-a-handmade-adventure-game]crowdfunding project[/url], one that hasn’t finished yet. The current goal aims to produce the second and third episode, in order to finally release the complete game and even aim at console port.

As you guessed by now the current game is in fact the first episode. This alone doesn’t state much since it’s a 10 hour game, therefore calling it episodic may not be appropriate, however, before you continue, please notice the game is “To be continued”. The final ends in a total cliffhanger, one I can’t want to continue!

[b]Jenny LeClue - Detectivu[/b] is a fantastic game and for mystery fans, it’s a game which one cannot miss. The storyline is simple but well worked to a point where it becomes better with each hour that passes. Without many spoilers, it’s one of those stories that you’ll never guess what they are until you dive into the game. There’s thrill, mystery, crime, conspiracy theories, and it’s all perfectly mixed.

The narrative and dialogues are charming and developed extremely well, making the game addictive like a book, even for those who do not enjoy reading. Interactions between Jenny and the narrator are amazing and completely add a new contemplation to the whole game. The humour between the lines, the twists and the improbable, but charismatic events will make you laugh and feel touched at the same time.

The mystery takes on the gameplay with substance, almost like an extension of curiosity itself. Players control Jenny in a 2D environment, like a in a cartoon where scenarios and characters are made with paper. Interacting with objects and solving puzzles almost seems identical to a Point & Click, but when played, it feels unique and not something that emulates other games in a different way.

I personally suppose it works well for mobile and will seemingly work fantastic on consoles. The puzzles are simple, nothing fancy or over complicated. The whole point of entertaining is not through harsh puzzles, but instead, relying on their creation and genuity. Eventually puzzles or mini-games become repetitive such as connecting wired dots or putting together scraps of paper like a jigsaw puzzle. In the end they work well and are fun to complete, without making you feel exhausted.

The most fantastic, unique and pleasant mechanic of the game is clearly the Investigations where young Jenny observes a scene and analyse the clues. Although they are scripted and part of the story, players will analyze evidence, people and objects by moving freely and spotting areas of interest. When all clues are gathered it’s also up to you to place evidences together in order to find answers. This mechanic is awesome and super fun.

Visually [b]Jenny LeClue[/b] is a hand-made wander, with beautiful colors and perfect atonement of vibrant and deep pigmentation contrasts. From the saturated sunsets, to the deep absorbing green of the woods, it’s all fantastically well colored. In a way, reminds me of children's books and how they try at their maximum to captivating the young eyes of children.

Music is mostly atmospheric and in that regard, it’s perfect for adding a thrilling vibe to each area. Sound effects are pretty good and I can only imagine how good would have been to have [b]Jenny LeClue[/b] completely voiced-over, unfortunately and due to probably time and money restrains, the developers opted for a simpler way. Each character will emit an expressive sound, almost like a voice but at the same time not understandable. It blends well with the narrative, but would have been a fantastic addition to have a cast.

A story about family, friends and hopes. Jenny will search and investigate until she finds the truth, about her family and the strange town she lives in. A video-game for all ages, with identity and highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292461573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1573612080}
review: Different mechanics and an awesome storyline make for a great detective game.  I love the detective games and I play tons of point and click puzzle games.  Some of them are are difficult just because you have to walk everywhere to find a wrench that is hidden or something just as dumb.  This game moves along without the stupid seek and find tasks we have grown used to in point and click games.  If you like the detective or the point and click puzzle genre,  give this a try. You just might enjoy it!

review: I backed this game on Kickstarter way back when and even though it took a while to get released, it was totally worth the wait. It's not a perfect game by any means but the story was fun and well written. The puzzles were entertaining and there was just enough variety to keep it from ever getting boring. It wasn't particularly challenging but that didn't decrease my enjoyment at all. The art style is amazing so it's great to look at and the sound design makes it a treat for your ears as well. I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125409173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1572961801}
review:
玩下来整体感觉相当不错的一款解谜游戏，通过一个个小解谜，逐渐引出一个出人意料的复杂故事。画风是我比较喜欢的，人物设计也很有个性特点。谜题设置的难度不高，铺垫的很顺畅。本作是这个故事的第一部，算是一个大事件中的子事件，通过这个案件的解决，为整个大事件进行了铺垫和引导。期待下一部作品。

另外，无法开始游戏的朋友，在选择“新游戏”的界面（就是：新游戏、新游戏+的那个界面），其实“取消”选项旁边是有个“确定”选项的，只不过可能因为显示原因被隐藏了，只要在“取消”选项高亮时按“右方向键”就可以了。这个问题可能是翻译时排版的问题，进去把语言切换成英文的话就能直接看到正常的显示。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972801091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1572219262}
review: A really fun detective story. Game play is quite simple, and puzzles aren't too hard. I liked that everything felt logical in this game, and I didn't have to resort to any helpers for completing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011168560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1572216332}
review: Jenny LeClue has fantastic art direction and a refreshing, engaging story. It's not often that a game just makes me smile in delight at an unexpected animation or twist in the narrative. The puzzles have a perfect level of difficulty for the type of game. It's wonderful that it's kid-friendly, too. If you like puzzle adventures with good stories, you'll certainly enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073792106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1571940542}
review:
Je viens de finir Jenny LeClue. Ce jeu est une oeuvre de qualité. Graphiquement, les textures et les couleurs sont très jolies. Pour ce qui est  des énigmes, les solutions ne sont pas téléphonées et il faut parfois un certain bon sens pour les résoudre. L'intrigue maintient en haleine tout au long du jeu.

Cela dit, il y a juste deux choses qui m'ont un peu géné : 
- à un moment donné il faut reconstituer une phrase simple en anglais. A mon grand dam, j'ai regardé la solution mais les plus décidés pourront prendre cela comme un défi supplémentaire.
- quant à la fin du jeu, la chute m'a un peu laissé sur ma faim.

Mais je ne boude pas mon plaisir et je dois reconnaître qu'en jouant à Jenny Leclue , j'ai passé un agréable moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085450333', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1574883259}
review:
Wow. This game is better than I first thought. The game features and author and his creation, a little girl detective. The game starts with him writing his cute stories. Supercute and boring. But then, since his stories are childish and boring, he is about to lose his contract. And so he spices things up a bit. And soon the story becomes weird. And creepy. The author drinks a bottle of wine since killing characters depresses him. A drunk author is actually a good explanation for the story, which gets weirder and weirder ...

The game itself consist of little riddles, most of them very easy. The story is the highlight, not the gameplay. The only weak thing is the ending, it feels abrupt and the cliffhanger could have been done better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322561841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1608841869}
review:
I seriously loved this game! As others have said, the art is BEAUTIFUL. I also enjoyed the mix of difficulty levels on the puzzles: some were quick to figure out & some it took me a little more time. The story was captivating and I definitely lost track of time while I was playing because I just had to keep going and see what was going to happen next.

I also really loved the added bonus of looking for the stickers & postcard scraps. I will be playing again to try & find the pieces I missed on the first run through.

Really looking forward to Chapter Two to continue Jenny's story!

author: {'steamid': '76561198354884771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1571397817}
review:
Tenho ressalvas a fazer, mas sim eu gostei do jogo e me diverti bastante.

Bom, é um jogo de detetive com ótimo gráficos, trilha sonora perfeita, me prendeu a atenção até o fim.

Para mim Jenny Leclue está mais para uma história jogável do que um jogo com uma história, mas vou tratar como jogo aqui nesta resenha. 

Não é um jogo difícil, não tem sistema de combate, nem subchefe ou chefe de fase. O jogo foca em deduções e uma exploração que se dá de forma bem retilínea, ou seja, a direção para onde ir o que fazer é bem clara na maior parte do jogo. Ah sim, há muitos quebra cabeças para resolver, mas todos são bem fáceis.

O que me prendeu ao jogo foi a história, que em conjunto com os gráficos bem desenhados e trilha sonora bem encaixada me fez passar bons momentos e alguns sustos também. Preferi jogar depois das 22h só para dar um clima a mais de mistério.

Um pequeno spoiler: A minha maior queixa do jogo é o final, que me chateou bastante. A história do jogo é bem envolvente, mas no final do jogo muito pouco, melhor quase nada ficou resolvido. O jogo te passa uma série de questões que você fica doido para ver o resultado da coisa e aí no momento mais quente da história o jogo acaba assim do nada. 

Nesse ponto me senti desrespeitado como jogador. É lógico que gosto de continuações mas eu queria ver todas pontas soltas sendo resolvidas, os arcos serem fechados. Mas não aconteceu, e só vou saber o restante da história na continuação do jogo se houver.

A impressão que tive é que os desenvolvedores estariam pressionados a colocar o jogo no mercado, é saiu meio que pela metade. 

Do ponto de vista da diversão eu recomendo o jogo, do ponto de vista do final que não é final, eu não recomendo. Se é desafio que você procura, também não recomendo mesmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118982727', 'num_games_owned': 10661, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1643492292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060767070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1572744613}
review: This was one of the best games I have ever played! The game follows the story of a young detective, Jenny Leclue, whose goal throughout the game is to save her mother who has been framed for murder. It tells a story of love, loss, friendship, etc. The 2 aspects of this game that really made it enjoyable are the artwork, which was flawless, and the story, which was so engaging that I just kept wanting to play. It has a decent length, about 10 hours, and will be continued with a sequel (which I cannot wait for!) All in all, I highly recommend the game and would love to see more from these game developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019466684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1570721206}
review:
[table][th]
Review by [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34633003-Gaming-Masterpieces/] Gaming Masterpieces [/url]  - The greatest games of all time on Steam. 
[/th][/table]

Is this game a masterpiece? Maybe.

It certainly is a cute, colorful, child-friendly mystery point 'n click adventure with lots of different mini-games, some kind of hidden object searches, (slightly) branching gameplay depending on conversation choices and a very polished presentation. It's a nice investigation game for (younger) hobby detectives.

You (most of the time) play little Jenny, The World’s Greatest Detective, solving one puzzle (mini-game) after another. The point'n click parts requiring object manipulation are rather simple, the game mostly advances by solving "quests", which consist of a variety of different mini-game puzzles. Find lost school essays, manipulate a door-opening device, deduct the order of events from clues and so on. I was reminded of Telltale's "Puzzle Agent" series, which follows a similar structure. Jenny has easier puzzles but higher production values, though.

The mystery story is engaging and with fun characters, the puzzles are mostly rather simple and forgiving (no dying), the whole presentation seems to aim at younger players. It's a great game to play with your kids, aged at least 8. Older kids can play alone, as long as they are not overwhelmed by the required reading parts. 

The story is completed, but the game hints at a sequel. After all, Jenny LeClou is a fictional character and the events in this game actually describe the writing of the 30th novel of the (fictional) series.

Works fine with controller.

[u][b] Conclusion:[/b][/u]
Lovely little puzzle game with fantastic art, suitable to play with your kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971247793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1602215061}
review:
EDIT: October 2020 - I replayed this game with the new voice acting and enjoyed it even more the second time through. This is definitely one of my favorite adventures of recent memory.

A really lovely little game. The art is fantastic. The story is engaging with fun characters who may start out as simple tropes but reveal depths over time. Gameplay is simplistic and there's not much challenge, but I think that's fine for this sort of thing. And the way the game uses drawing to convey ideas is wonderfully tactile in a way that makes unlocking each puzzle a joy. 

My only concern is that it ends on a cliffhanger and this entry took was a long time coming. I hope the next one can arrive more quickly. I'll definitely be here waiting whenever it comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026547170', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1568953654}
review: Overall I liked the game, I think the story is well developed and is this games strong point.  The game play is a bit simplistic, but I think it suits the type of game it is.  I'm excited to play and demand that a sequel comes out so we can get some more closure to the narrative setup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029802654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1570897269}
review: Jenny LeClue ist ein sehr charmantes Spiel das eine gute Balance zwischen Humor und Ernsthaftigkeit schlägt. Die Charaktäre sind sehr liebenswürdig und die Geschichte ist gut geschrieben und wartet mit ein paar Überraschungen auf. Besonders gefällt mir die Tatsache das die Geschichte sich nicht nur um Jenny dreht, sondern auch um Arthur, den Autor der Jenny LeClue Roman Reihe, der das neueste Buch schreibt während wir es spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174399265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1575441431}
review: I typically don't play story games, but this one was really well written and lovely to look at. I was surprised that this is part 1 of a series, but also pleasantly surprised at the end to know that there'll be more fun in the world of Jenny LeClue in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198993120652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1622696843}
review: I absolutely adored this game~ I'll be keeping my fingers crossed that JLC2 will take much less time to get to us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062177527', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1570547555}
review:
Обидно признавать, но игра больше не понравилась, чем "зашла". Что-то в ней отталкивает на подсознательном уровне, а по выходу - не хочется возвращаться. Делаешь это лишь потому что картинка глазу приятна.

Сюжет не цепляет. Более того, он монотонно усыпляет. 

Озвучки героев нет, тонны текста заставляют зевать. Даже появление оного на экране не озвучивается отдельными "нотками", словно говорят разные люди. Всё безлико, как под копирку. Пыталась воспринимать диалоги/монологи аки книжные зарисовки, но, вспоминая сказанное мной ранее, повествование оставляет желать лучшего. 

Твёрдая тройка, исключительно благодаря уникальности персонажей и их графическому воплощению.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970738312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1570343550}
review: I really enjoyed this game up to, but not including the ending. The game is very well designed and I enjoyed playing it immensely. Unfortunately the developers haven't made it clear that this is just the first episode. As a result, the ending is abrupt and confusing. I will certainly play the following chapters when they finally arrive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987930039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1597580841}
review: I want a sequel. Badly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056078228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1583983039}
review: Honestly, Jenny LeClue is probably my favorite game I've played. The art style is incredible, the puzzles are incredibly fun and not too difficult, the story is fantastic. As a long time player of the famous female detective game series Nancy Drew, this scratched so many of those same itches but added so many incredible twists. You'll read players complaining about the ending, but I disagree. Yes it is abrupt, but sets up perfectly for a sequel that I am so, so excited for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331117330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1570345806}
review:
This game was a marvelous gem! I felt like I was solving problems along with Jenny and also like I was writing alongside the author. This title has expanded my repertoire of games. Other titles introduced me to adventure and mystery puzzle solving games, and this game solidified it.
The controls took a little bit to get used to, as I’m used to using a mouse to interact on a laptop, but once I got the hang of them they started to make sense to me. Earlier today I realized that there is a profound symmetry between the laptop/computer controls (excluding the hand controller from the metaphor), as we just like the author in this story can only interact with this world through the keys on our “typewriter” aka keyboard. 
I look forward to more games from the creators of “Jenny LeClue Detectivu” in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969899664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1570299472}
review: Sadly I'm not sure I would recommend the game. It's incredibly repetitive, and it's feels more like watching one big cutscene instead of gameplay. When I first started I was amazed at the art and design, but it's simply not fun after a few hours. I just feel like I'm not really doing anything, or that it's too simplistic. A lot of potential here though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097222182', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1570378668}
review:
一款气氛非常到位的解谜游戏，一开始在众多剧情走向选择之下以为是多结局，没想到该作中并没有把故事讲完，而且最后展开的叙事节奏明显仓促起来，剧情在前面这么长的铺垫之下戛然而止实在是有点猝不及防，希望大家多多支持，让作者尽快出续作（挖的坑实在是太多了）
话说意识流叙事真的是降低成本的捷径，然而突如其来的穿插一段之后又再没出现过的意识流在整个游戏流程里给玩家的感觉还是比较明显突兀的，也算是游戏情节节奏把控功力不足的一个体现了

author: {'steamid': '76561198087039748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1609065829}
review: Loved it everything was 10/10 for me

author: {'steamid': '76561197961507382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1581609423}
review:
I love this game. The story is really gripping (In the 5 hours I've played so far I've already skipped a meal to continue playing). The puzzles are a wonderful way of changing the pace between story elements.

Wonderful art (which is why I initially bought it), and just overall very fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198443501233', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1577620161}
review: 玩完了，讲真这么好的画风（这个因人而异，反正特别戳我），互动性也强，剧情深入人心（果然最后一个未完待续要出第二部拉我入坑哈），关键是全程自带中文翻译不要太友好，70块有8小时的通关体验不亏，值得拥有。最后谈谈缺点吧，最大的缺点！！！！这个这么大的图你走的也忒慢了吧，耐心都要磨死，还有还有对话这么多为啥不加点配乐更有代入感啊，如果能有配音就更完美了，游戏配乐真的太单调了，这么好的剧情和动画竟然没多少配乐，不合适吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198231000848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1620091834}
review: Estuvo en mi lista de deseados hace aproximadamente 3 años y por fin. Aunque si es la primera parte, ... y tardo este tiempo... la segunda tambien sera asi? Francamente el juego es espectacular, sin embargo si fue decepcion que fuera solo la primera parte y que no hay fecha para la segunda u,u todo lo demas es muy muy bueno, sobre todo la atmosfera

author: {'steamid': '76561198018686466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1570284893}
review:
Overall I really enjoyed this game. It's very focused on delivering a narrative experience with excellent sound and graphics. If you're expecting a challenging game then you'll be disappointed because it's more like an interactive story than a puzzle game. For what it is, I think it's great game.

However, I was so frustrated at the end when I learned it's a "to be continued" game, which feels doubtful that i'll ever see a second part. The story was almost completely wrapped up by the end of this game; it felt like there was maybe 15 minutes more of closure needed to finish the story when it suddenly just ends. I can't even fathom how there would be enough content for a second game based on how much felt wrapped up. *shrug*

author: {'steamid': '76561198973776161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1655640429}
review: 很棒的游戏，剧情非常有意思，让人猜不透。画面优美，是的，不同的场景，不同的光线，都很柔美。至少让我非常舒适。游戏的场景也很多，谜题也很多，大体来讲不算难。选择是真的可以影响游戏的走向，这是比较有意思的事情。唯一的遗憾就是没有讲完：伟大的侦探从不留坑。期待续作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198018835399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1569807338}
review:
Very charming adventure game. Reminds me of those YA detective novels I used to read as a kid. Puzzles aren't overly challenging, but still satisfying.

The story goes places I didn't expect. Very much looking forward to the 2nd game.
