author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1633871427}
review: Great detective story, great art & music. The overall sensory identity is fantastic. decent gameplay. The ending was a bit... not there, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104520450', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1569705380}
review:
Is like any game ever finished when it comes out anymore?

Look i love love love this game and it's clear that it took a ton of work and heart to pull it off as well as it does, but WHY a cliffhanger ending??? I'm not going to care about ANY of it when the resolution comes out in a few months/years/never!

With this and katana zero, I'm beginning to wonder if there's some stigma about releasing a complete game.

It's still worth the buy, obviously you should support this indie darling, but heads-up for the gutpunch cliffhanger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992753861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1569434170}
review: I LOVE this game. I continue to be impressed by the storyline, details, and graphics. I truly enjoyed every second of playing. It was 100% worth the wait and the price. I only wish there were a few more "puzzles" throughout the game... Can't wait for another Jenny LeClue!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025750566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1572295282}
review:
The controls are a little funky. The button prompts don't add much. There's occasional bugginess. But the music is good, the visual design is great, and the writing is fantastic. If you like narrative-driven games, plot twists, solving mysteries, or bad jokes... please, please play this game.

Then maybe we'll get a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060576195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1569620592}
review:
I never write a review but I believe this game deserves one.

First thing is that this game has all the elements a perfect detective story should have making it surprisingly interesting. You keep on going trying to find out where the story goes and discover what really transpired in the tiny town of Arthurton. All the different locations you come across when you play the game only add to the mistery. The athmosphere and artstyle fit in perfectly with the story the game tries to tell you. Even though it is a simple adventure puzzle game I personally started to develop feelings for the colorfull characters. This is something that only brilliant writers can accomplish.

The game doesn't take long to play but the choices you get to make it interesting to play again.

If you have time and like to relax on the couch with a good mistery novel, make sure you buy this game. 
It's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048668312', 'num_games_owned': 11251, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1569591564}
review:
[h1]More interesting reviews on [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33843777//] Fenol Baron Approves Curator Page[/url] [/h1]

The World’s Greatest Detective Jenny LeClue steps in, tremble the villains! The small town of Arthurton will shudder more than once from the sudden illumination of a young detective, and her sharp eyes behind all-seeing glasses will reveal every hidden secret. The barely perceptible vibrations of the Nancy Drew, Night in the Woods series of games are felt very softly and unobtrusively, creating a wonderful feeling of comfort and coziness. We have before us an excellent example of a youthful detective, in which there is enough charming naivety, and touching moments, and frightening discoveries, and the right thoughts about friendship, relationships and interaction with the outside world, which is such an adult, but of course does not understand anything. The game is very plot-oriented, I would not say that there are a lot of puzzles and other gameplay wisdom here, we mainly interrogate, analyze the facts, moving through the story towards the Terrible Secret. The atmosphere of a small town in which nothing happens is perfectly maintained, all the characters are very lively and vibrant, leave a good impression. Communication with them is so easy and relaxed that one wonders how the authors managed to achieve such a result. The story moves at a very measured pace, it is worth noting that the game (especially as for an indie game) has a good duration, most of which is full of events and situations. My only complaint about the story is about the ending - it’s kind of strange, to be honest, but I hope that we will see a sequel that will put everything in its place. Again, in a future game I would like a little more gameplay variety (more different puzzles, for example), so that the action would be even more dynamic. This does not detract from the merits of the game, just tips to make the sequel even more wonderful. And how do you want the badges and backgrounds for this game, with the stunning artwork that is here, this would be an incredible gift.

"Jenny LeClue - Detectivu" is a wonderful, exciting and kind story, created by very talented people. Which obviously invested in it part of their heart and soul, that to please the players, which they did fine and did, I enjoyed the game very much, and now I look forward to continuing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024376103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1569563093}
review:
This game was impossibly good, and I am surprised at how I'm looking forward to more. I have a deep appreciation for this game and all its aspects. Wholly worth the wait and the $20 (cost at time of posting). First playthrough netted about 15+ hours of gameplay between actual in-game content and cipher solving both on live-stream and off.

[b]Get Jenny LeClue if you like:[/b] Nancy Drew, Oxenfree, the Blackwell series, story-driven adventure games, investigation adventure games, mysteries, stylized graphics. 

[b]PROS:[/b]
No mouse needed, can be played on a laptop. Multiple layers of experience, both obvious and hidden. Fully encapsulated narrative with enough unanswered questions to make you desire more. Excellent art. Beautiful music. Packed with genuine moments and "Whoa, I'm smart!" puzzles. Tips between classic Nancy Drew-esque investigation and games like Oxenfree.

[b]CONS:[/b]
Lack of direct address commas. I had to put [i]something[/i] here...

[spoiler]Anyone who knows me knows that I hate TBC (to be continued) endings with a fiery passion, because most games use it as an excuse to avoid a mess of an ending. Jenny LeClue has a fully realized and wholly encapsulated narrative that satisfied my need for answers, solving the mystery while simultaneously building a very strong case for a second game. I had a knee-jerk reaction to the ending initially, but the more I thought about it, the more I found that this game delivers on all fronts.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012051873', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1674848157}
review:
Ich hätte gerne einen Daumen zur Seite gewählt für "mittelmäßig" aber leider gibt es diesen nicht und eigentlich überwog das Positive. 

Erst einmal das Schlechte:
Es ist schade, dass fast nichts aus der Demo und dem Teaser bis zum Release überstanden hat. Die tolle Mechanik, kniffligen Rätsel, das Mystische und vor allem die Maussteuerung (Point 'n Click) wurden nicht übernommen. Selbst der Ort wurde nicht ins Spiel gebracht. Jetzt haben wir ein vollkommen anderes Spiel erhalten aber mit den selben Charakteren. Hatte mich sehr auf das, was in der Demo gezeigt wurde, gefreut aber nun ja... Zudem gibt es nur etwa 3 Rätsel, die sich dann an anderen Stellen im Spiel wiederholen (+1 Rohr-Rätsel) und nicht sonderlich schwer sind.

Nun das Gute:
Auch wenn es nicht meinen Erwartungen, dem Teaser Trailer und der Demo entsprach, war es ein gutes Spiel! Der schöne Stil, die Charaktere und die Entscheidungen, die man fällen konnte, waren sehr überzeugend. Die Sicht aus einem Autor zu spielen war eine schöne, erfrischende Idee und es kam einen fast so vor, als würde man wirklich ein Buch lesen...nur interaktiv...und wir konnten an einigen Stellen entscheiden, wie es weitergeht. Wir waren das Schicksal und der Humor war auch ganz nach meinem Geschmack. Das man sein Notizbuch mit Stickern bekleben konnte, die man im Spielverlauf suchen kann, fand ich auch gut und am Ende hatte ich mein ganzes Buch beklebt, zwischen den ganzen Zeichnungen und Daten von Jenny. Alles in allem ein ausgeglichenes Spiel und als ich meine Erwartungen abgelegt und einfach das Spiel gespielt hatte, fand ich es sehr gut!

Ich freue mich auf eine Fortsetzung, denn die Geschichte ist noch lange nicht zu Ende! :D Vielleicht fühlt sich Mografi dann nicht so unter Druck und kann vielleicht die alten Mechaniken aus der Demo wieder hinzufügen, sowie einige bessere Rätsel einbauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044486691', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1589520163}
review: I LOVE THE GAMEPLAY its so unique and the storyline and the dialogues are goofy but very funny, but sometimes idk what to press and could use a little help with the keys to use cause its confusing but otherwise i love this game been looking forward to it forever, totally worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198040509634', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1571208185}
review: На игру наткнулся случайно, но она сразу захватила мое внимание. Она великолепна! Интересный сюжет, постоянно хочется знать, что же будет дальше. Очень приятные персонажи. Есть парочка затянутых моментов и перевод на русский местами корявый, но это не помешало мне получить удовольствие. Я полюбил эту игру и с нетерпением жду продолжения! Разрабы на Кикстартере заявили трилогию, очень надеюсь, что следующая часть не задержится. Обновил для значка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119007569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1605231037}
review:
¡Una enorme aventura! Valio totalmente la espera. Lo preordene a comienzos del 2018 y no estoy para nada decepcionado con el producto. Se nota que es un juego hecho con cariño, tiene una gran narrativa. Te deja con las ansias de saber que es lo que sigue. 

Mi personaje favorito es Susie, es muy tierna y ojala que haya mas participacion de ella el capitulo 2. En realidad todos los personajes del juego son entrañables. 

Ojala que en los futuros capitulos hayan mas opciones de personalizacion "Ame la opcion de llenar con pegatinas el diario" pero me hubiera encantado la opcion de personalizar al personaje tambien. Por ejemplo cambiar de atuendos. "Hubiera sido genial que Jenny hubiera aceptado el cambio de ropa que le ofrecio Susie"

Pero en fin, estoy ansioso por la continuacion, vaya final mas bueno! 

Jenny leclue es un juego totalmente recomendado si te encantan las buenas historias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970730025', 'num_games_owned': 1744, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1572545109}
review:
Before I review, I was a kickstarter backer, but if I'd have bought the game, I'd like to have known this first. Some may see it as a spoiler, so I'm using the tags. [spoiler]The game has no ending. Just a 'to be continued'.[/spoiler]

With that out of the way, I found Jenny LeClue to be a fun little adventure. It's strengths exist in it's strong story-writing and absolutely phenomenal artwork and animation. It's a truly beautiful game, and an absolute work of art. For this reason, I'd highly recommend experiencing this title.

With that in mind, and I say this with a heavy heart, as I had such high hopes for this title, the gameplay is what lets the title down. Puzzles are repetitive and simple. If you're along for just the story, then you'll have a great time. If you're looking for challenging puzzles then you won't find them here.

Thanks to Mografi for all their hard work, and I look forward to seeing what's next for them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198215835417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1595436274}
review: Loved this game. Great sense of humour, heart and story. My only gripe, I want more, missing it now I've finished!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001653809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1569692255}
review: Not very challegening and kind of linear/straightforward gameplay, but very beautiful art, lots of fun and incredible writing! If they write a novelized version of this game I will buy it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073675479', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1569505912}
review:
Hurmaava indieseikkailu värikkäällä grafiikalla. Pelin idea kirjansa kanssa kamppailevasta, höpsöstä kirjailijasta on mainio, ja kirjailijaa kuvaavat välivideot rytmittävät peliä hyvin. Pelin käsikirjoitus on loistavaa ja kaikki hahmot hyvin kirjoitettuja, vaikka tietyiltä seikkailupelikliseiltä ei voidakaan välttyä (eikä se ole välttämättä edes huono asia). Pelimekaniikat jäävät ehkä hieman ohuiksi ja peli on todella helppo, mutta saa paljon anteeksi viihdyttävyytensä ansiosta. Lisäkehut tarrojen keräilystä, hauska idea johon en ole ennen törmännyt.

Jos tykkäsit Night in the Woodsin tai Broken Agen kaltaisista peleistä, luulen, että myös Jenny LeClue iskee sinuun. En suosittele tätä jos etsit haastavia aivopähkinöitä tai vihaat lineaarisia pelejä.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138224157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1572008966}
review: 这个游戏在我愿望单躺的都要长草了终于发售了，一开始纯粹是被画风和题材吸引的，玩了之后只想说太好玩了！谜题类型和解法完全戳中我的点，这个游戏原价买不亏！值！只希望steam上这类游戏能更多一点

author: {'steamid': '76561198034026303', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1709090949}
review:
First things first, Jenny LeClue is not a LucasArts or Telltale game; if you go in expecting that, you'll be disappointed. It's an interactive novel peppered with puzzles and dialogue choices, akin to Night in the Woods or Oxenfree. With that out of the way, I can safely say that I was quite happy with this purchase. The characters are all well-written and believable, the art style is what made me follow this game way back in 2017, and the mystery had me second-guessing everything all the way to the end and still surprised me.

Second, the murder mystery does not end on a cliffhanger as one review stated. The crime gets solved, and the events and motivations directly connect to things you encounter during play such that you could theoretically figure it out beforehand. However, the ending reveal/monologue scene does raise some world-shattering implications to use as a sequel hook. It's a BIG hook, and the wait for a sequel will be agonizing, but the question you should be asking is "If this sequel never comes out, will I regret buying this?" I sincerely believe that even if Mografi never makes another game, I'll still be happy having bought and played through Jenny LeClue. Certainly not as happy as I'd be if I get to see where they're going with this, but happy nonetheless.




Those two walls of text are what I'd say are the big points, if you're still reading now I'd like to address the common points I saw in negative reviews. First off, yes, the story has a long buildup of little slice of life moments and a metaplot with the author getting lambasted for writing books that are too safe and formulaic. Either you enjoy the slow start, or you don't, personally I feel like the rest of the story doesn't work without getting to see Jenny's world before it all goes to hell.

Second, Jenny is a gigantic antisocial butthead who is constantly dismissive of literally the only person in town trying to help her. She's cocky, a little bit edgy, and nearly dies on at least three occasions. And you know what? I like her. She's written like an outcast teenager who's in over her head, but is too stubborn and deep already to even consider turning back, which is exactly what she is. She'll grow out of some if it, sooner or later depending on how you direct her interactions. Until then, you're controlling a premade character who isn't a paragon of social skills or even basic ethics.

Finally, yes, I do agree that the exploration can be annoying and slow at times. And the occasions where you're forced to walk and/or stop to do minor block and jumping puzzles don't help. I had similar issues with Night in the Woods and Oxenfree, but in all three games I found the story and characters more than engaging enough to forgive the hiccups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079626599', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1571093175}
review: Just finished part 1 and my gosh is this game a gem! It has such a captivating story, which is only enhanced by its lovely characters, great soundtrack by the same composer from OXENFREE, a fantastic art direction, and overall such charm. I definitely recommend Jenny Leclue, especially if you love story-based games with choices such as Life is Strange, Night in the Woods, or OXENFREE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023541946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1569199514}
review:
I was a kickstarter backer, glad to see it finally out. It really ended up being more of an interactive story or visual novel than a game in the end, which hurts it at times. Would have loved for a bit more meat to some of the puzzles and fewer segments of walking back and forth. However, I found myself sucked into the world and the story thanks to some solid atmosphere and likable characters. Ultimately I had a good time, although I was occasionally frustrated, especially with the lack of resolution. In the end, I'd say it was worth kickstarting, and I'm looking forward to the sequel, although I hope they make some improvements to the formula by then. 

---tl;dr ---
If you like a good story and atmosphere and don't mind that there isn't much actual game, this is a fun ride. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100002739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1569193459}
review:
[h1]Resumo geral sem spoilers:[/h1]

Recomendo com um asterisco. O jogo é bem divertido, mas talvez apos completar toda a historia disponivel você corre o risco de se decepcionar um pouco, especialmente se conhecer alguns outros titulos num genero similar que caem na mesma armadilha...


[h1][u][b]A partir daqui, spoilers que podem estragar sua jogatina, não digam que não teve aviso.[/b][/u][/h1]

O jogo é bem interessante, mas bastante pesado em dialogo, algo que combina mais com um filme que com um jogo em si. A interatividade é bem minima em muitos pontos e a maioria dos quebra-cabeças é ainda mais simples,[spoiler]  porem, o que mata o jogo pra mim no momento é o final subito.[/spoiler] Como toda boa historia de detetive, o caso geral é bem intrigante se você começar a prestar bastante atenção [spoiler]e isso infelizmente é um problema, pois assim como alguns outros jogos do genero, ele se apoia em um final ambiguo, aberto e que literalmente diz "Continua...". [/spoiler] Algo otimo quando se trata de um bom livro de misterio, [spoiler]deixar a cenoura pendurada na frente do leitor, com aquele gostinho de quero mais. Algo extremamente problematico com jogos, visto que o cenario financeiro do estudio/equipe pode mudar e a continuação pode nunca aparecer. Estou olhando pra você FACE NOIR.[/spoiler] [spoiler]Embora tenha me acostumado com esse tipo de situação, o gosto amargo na boca não se torna mais suportavel. [/spoiler]Comprei o jogo muito depois do kickstarter, mas antes do lançamento oficial, sabendo bem de todas as dificuldades que o projeto passou, o tempo que levou até o finalmente e embora acredite que ele merece uma chance, o motivo que citei é o que me deixa receoso [spoiler]principalmente quanto ao futuro da historia, ja que fazer um jogo não é barato e pode levar anos pra que algo concreto saia do papel e mesmo assim, pode nunca sair.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164168213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1605485864}
review:
I bought this game the day of the release as I had been waiting for it's release for a longggg time (not quite as long as Midnight in Salem, for any Nancy Drew fans out there). 

And holy cow, I was not disappointed. 

Yes, the graphics are beautiful, the story is an amazing fusion of mystery, scifi, and a little bit of horror, and the characters are vivacious and brilliant. But what's most incredible about this game is that the creators have spared no expense to make it extremely user friendly. I was rarely ~stuck in this game. It would remind me where things were after longer puzzles, there were no repercussions for making mistakes, and things made logical sense (which you don't always get in mystery games, surprisingly). 

Not to mention, the collectibles in this game are the best. Stickers you can put on your in game journal? I'm in heaven!

This game is a fusion of A Night In the Woods, Oxenfree , and The Low Road, all put into a Nancy Drew formula. Jenny LeClue is my new favorite Heroine and I cannot wait to continue her story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068556208', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1569177566}
review:
[h1] Настоящий детектив [/h1]
Дженни Леклю свалилась на меня нежданно-негаданно. Странно, но про неё я не слышала совершенно ничего вплоть до релиза (хотя в самой игре есть инфа, что был сбор на кикстартере). Яркая графика и обещание детективного приключения в трейлере убедили меня приобрести игру и вот что я могу сказать...
[b] Плюсы:[/b]
+ Интересная детективная история в духе Нэнси Дрю, Флавии де Люс и прочих девочек-детективов. Собственно говоря, именно этот поджанр детективной литературы игра обстёбывает на каждом ходу. 
+ Яркая, сочная, красивая картинка. 
+ Есть загадки. Не особо сложные, но не дают заскучать. 
+ Выборы. Игру проходила один раз, так что не знаю, сильно ли они влияют на сюжет. На что действительно влияют - на ваш психологический портрет в дневнике (это совершенно бесполезно, но прикольно).
+ Хороший перевод на русский язык.
+ Коллектаблсы в виде стикеров, которыми можно обклеить свой дневник детектива, хоть обложку, хоть страницы (господи, это же гениально!).
[b] Минусы:[/b]
- Хоть перевод на русский хорош, ошибки, опечатки и непереведенные места мне попадались. И если в одном случае это оправдано тем, что для перевода пришлось бы целиком переделывать головоломку, то в других непонятно, почему бы и не.
- В целом юмор в игре неплохой, но иногда бывает не к месту.
- Клиффхэнгер. Разрабы, are you serious?!!
Вердикт: Дженни Леклю пополнила мою коллекцию ламповых адвенчур. Из похожего вспомнились Night in the Woods и Oxenfree. Игре не хватает сложных оригинальных загадок (особенно детективных, это именно что приключение), но впечатление она оставляет положительное. Хотелось бы пожелать игре побольше внимания игроков, чтобы вторая часть все-таки вышла...

author: {'steamid': '76561198029292678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1569358466}
review:
I have been waiting for the game release for more than a year. And now it is finally out! And I love it so far! 

Overall, I'd describe it as an interactive story with great writing and beautiful unique art-style. I also love how dynamic sounds and music smartly highlight important gameplay of events and actions. 

Keep in mind, that the game would not probably offer much for hardcore puzzle solvers. As I said before, it feels more like an interactive story. 

Also, it looks like a real teen/child-friendly game. So, you might consider buying it for your kid or to play it together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052816270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1569179645}
review: Stinklangweilig. Ewiges Dialog-Weitergeklicke. Hirnlose Aufgaben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377718438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1569176337}
review:
Love this game! I've been watching and waiting for it to come out for a long time and it was worth the wait. The art, story, and everything was super compelling and it was everything that I, personally, want from games. The game played longer than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise. I can tell the makers put a lot of heart and soul and love into the game. I want more!!! 

As others mentioned, the biggest negative for me was that it ends with a cliffhanger. To be continued. I'm definitely excited for more. But going into it I didn't know that that was part of the game creator's plan. I will say NOT knowing that definitely made the ending more shocking. Maybe that's why it wasn't advertised as Episode 1? 

I also didn't know that they were intending to add voices to the game play, or that that's something coming in an update in the future. I don't feel like the lack of voices detracted from the game at all. I personally enjoyed it without them and don't think they're needed. But I'm sure it will be super fun to it play again when they're added.

Anywho, someone please give them more money so they can finish the story ASAAP! It looks like on their Kickstarter Episode 2 and 3 were stretch goals that were never reached. Which makes me nervous, so I really hope that they get the funding they need to finish the story!

With all that being said, even if Episode 2 and 3 were never to see the light of day, Episode 1 is well worth the play and a piece of art on its own and was a true joy and experience to play. I loved it. Thanks y'all!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972383201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1569102990}
review:
Played through all of it yesterday. The game is an absolute delight. Do not get deterred by the seeming slow start. It picks up the pace and takes a left turn into humorous Mystery Nancy Drew land after a short hour.

The visual style, the twisting storyline, the dialogue are all top notch. 

There are a few gameplay elements which just involve repeatedly mashing the same button for a few seconds but they are quickly passed.

Overall,  really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970556751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1635901440}
review:
What a lovely game, through and through. The visual style is absolutely unparalleled. I loved the framing of Jenny's story within Arthur's, I laughed out loud at a whole bunch of dialogue, the music made me smile all the time, and without spoiling anything, let's just say that the weirder elements of the plot really intrigued and engaged me - they felt right at home in this story.

I wish there were a save system instead of autosaves, and I wish there were some sort of mouse support. Neither of these small gripes blocked me from having a great time, and I can't wait to get back into it again, with different choosiness!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035245232', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1595697042}
review:
物語主体のアドベンチャーゲーム。
美しいが平凡な田舎町を舞台に、臆病で気難しい探偵少女が殺人事件の謎を解き、町の秘密を暴いていくお話。
アクションやプラットフォーマー要素はありません。
ほぼ完全に日本語化されています。誤訳・未翻訳部分が少々ありますがプレイには支障のないレベルです。

長所
特徴的で可愛いらしいアートスタイル。
主人公と捜査対象者とのユーモアに富んだ会話。
引きの強いストーリー。止め時が見つからず、一気に最後までやってしまいました。

短所
操作性にやや難あり。慣れるまで時間がかかりました。
バグ。イベントが起こるはずの場面で何も起らないことがあります。ゲームを再起動したら進行しました。
物語の都合上、冒険の舞台が夜や地下になることが多いです。きれいな景色がもっと多ければアートスタイルが映えたのにちょっと残念。

結論
欠点は色々あるものの、それを遥かに上回る美点と魅力を持つゲームです。
オススメ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023125803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1621748880}
review:
Is the game a challenge for adults? 
Nope.
Is the game something seasoned game fans can sink hours upon hours into? 
Nope.

Does it control well? 
I screwed up a couple times, but that was on me.
Is the gameplay fun? 
Sure is.
Is the story good? 
You bet your sweet ass it is!
Do you get to make interesting decisions? 
;)
Are the characters likeable?
I WOULD DIE FOR JENNY.
Is it aesthetically pleasing?
HAVE YOU LOOKED AT IT??

HIGHLY recommended, if you like mystery adventures, and adorable kid detectives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065744985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1569083329}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel seinerzeit auf Kickstarter unterstützt. Prinzipiell klang es damals nach einem guten Point & Click Adventure mit einem interessantem Art-Stil. Als dann nach Jahren die das Projekt hinter seinem Zeitplan lag (es hätte urspr. schon im Dezember 2016 erscheinen sollen, die Kickstarter-Kampagne war immerhin 2014 erfolgreich) dann doch endlich ein Release-Datum kam, war ich schon erstaunt genug, denn hier hätte ich eigentlich nicht mehr überhaupt mit einem Erscheinen gerechnet.

Während der ganzen Jahre kamen immer mal wieder Updates rein, die auch oftmals mit Entschuldigungen für die Verzögerung des Projektes gefüllt waren ("Wir sind nur ein kleines Entwickler-Team..." und so weiter und so fort..). Aber im Gegenzug kamen immer wieder mal Updates rein, wie toll es ist, mit dem Spiel auf z.B. der Playstation-Experience von Sony dabei zu sein. Hier sehe ich den Fokus des Team falsch ausgerichtet: lieber PR-Events besuchen als am Produkt zu arbeiten...

Hatte also schon mal einen bitteren Beigeschmack. Dass man angeblich nur ein kleines Team ist (Bemerkung am Rande: in der Kickstarter-Kampagne waren als Team 12 Personen gelistet) ist schonmal eine nette Aussage, da man hier offensichtlich in der Kickstarter-Kampagne gelogen hat, wenn es am Ende doch nur 3 waren. Mit 12 wäre eine solche Verzögerung nicht zu erklären.

Aber lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: diesem Entwickler werde ich bestimmt nie wieder auch mit nur einen Cent bei egal welchem Projekt unterstützen.

Zum Spiel selbst kann ich nicht viel sagen, weil es für mich durch die "Steuerung" schlichtweg eine Tortur ist gespielt zu werden. Das ganze ist mit einem absoluten Fokus auf Controller programmiert worden, der aus dem was ich bisher gesehen habe eine lange Kette von Mini-Spielen macht. Wenn man ein Adventure erwartet und dann sowas bekommt, dann ist es noch höflich zu sagen, dass man sein Geld verschwendet hat. Nicht mal in den Menüs hat man eine Mauszeiger-Steuerung.

Die Jahre die sich das ganze hier verzögert hat spiegeln sich nicht wirklich wieder. Andere Kickstarter-Projekte (ebenfalls von kleinen Teams) kamen lange nach diesem und waren lange vor ihm fertig (und lieferten dabei viel aufwendigere Grafik, Steuerung und Gameplay).

author: {'steamid': '76561198394082543', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1621909374}
review:
This positively one of the best games I've ever played.

I personally felt like I was playing a proper Sherlock Holmes game. I felt invested in the story, the art is absolutely gorgeous and the twist/ending has my jaw absolutely dropped on the floor.

My favorite part was exploring the areas in the game to find new, hidden secrets especially when they could help the ultimate mystery of what in the actual heck is going on in Arthurton.

If I had one major nitpick, it was that it felt too short. But for all I know, this is secretly an episodic game.

Overall 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197978326395', 'num_games_owned': 1310, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1569079622}
review:
Good game.
Looks gorgeous, sound/music is fine :) 
Puzzles are good, at least once, don't think some of them needed to be repeated that often.
And If it had actually had an ending it would have been an amazing story as well, really want to know what happens next ... just don't know when that will be... hopefully faster than the 5 years part 1 took.
Also If it is an episodic game mention it in the game description or in the title...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994062567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1569074015}
review:
I rarely post any reviews, actually, but this game really deserve one.
Perfectly charming story, nice dialogues, and (despite many opinions) not tedious and repetiteve gameplay - if you put your time to actually read and not just jump from one puzzle to another. I will replay it once more in a week or so, just to try another dialogue options and see if they matter. But anyway, it is fantastic job - my respect to gamedev on this one.

Highly recommended to people who like to read (with no offense to any other kind - you may actually like this game for platformer part, for example).

5/5
Will buy next part, if it's planned :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198451653990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1569070979}
review: Played an hour so far. I've been looking forward to this game for a very long time. Unfortunately it feels like watching an episode of a slow TV-show so far. No real choices, no puzzles thus far, just pushing the buttons the game tells you to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999613406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1570020348}
review:
A gripping tale of intrepid detectivity and harrowing adventure, bursting with style, deduction, and conveniently sturdy tree roots.

Can I trade in my stack of old hardy boys/three investigators/nancy drew books, and get another Jenny LeClue adventure? While I haven't finished the game yet, it's been a wild ride so far.

Puzzles aren't ultra complex, but neither are they trivial - while they feel balanced on the "keep things moving" side, I found many had an element that needed a little thought. The deductions are done in a "you unearth the clues, and identify the key linkages, then Jenny reasons it out" style. For at least a couple of them it looked like there may have been alternate viable linkages, but haven't yet had a chance to replay and find out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999385812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1569013222}
review:
This game is cutely drawn, surprisingly dark, intriguingly written, and a joy to play and experience. The puzzling is a little less than I wanted, in that there are only a few places I felt challenged. By the end, though, I realized a lot of the game was in experiencing everything and gathering clues, clues that you use later on to solve "cases" (basically puzzles of deduction).

My only real caveat is that this is part 1 and the game ends on a cliffhanger. This seems like something you should know going in.

---

Also, I noticed another review stated that the game doesn't indicate when it autosaves. It does, with a little Jenny LeClue logo in the lower left of the screen. BUT the game never explained this, so it was something I had to figure out on my own. The game also saves quite regularly, so you'll never be giving up much progress beyond the most immediate puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014471504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1597328374}
review:
Note: When I wrote this review, Jenny LeClue had no voice acting, which is why the review doesn't mention it. The game recently updated with the voice acting. It is extremely good, and on this replay, I can't imagine going back to no voices. It turned a great game into an exceptional one.
-
Jenny LeClue is positively adorable. The eponymous hero, yes- exceedingly so- but also the game itself is just overall incredibly charming.

As far as gameplay goes, it's nothing you haven't seen before. There's a lot of conversations between Jenny and the various residents of Arthurton, as she walks about a 2d world, flicking switches and pushing boxes. There's some neat investigation sections that will feel very familiar to fans of Danganronpa or Phoenix Wright.
There's absolutely nothing wrong with how the game plays, but it's really just the way everything else- the art, the characters, the narrative- are delivered, and nothing more.

What starts as a fairly mundane adventure in the shoes of a bratty child detective relatively quickly goes off the deep end, and just keeps on diving down until you're forced to accept you'll never take another breath. 
You navigate Jenny through increasingly traumatic experiences, and she jots them all down in her journal (adding personal notes in the margins every time she makes a discovery or nearly dies)

And it is still adorable, despite the bizarrely dark places the narrative goes. Jenny picks locks with her hairclip like a little MacGyver. The in universe author of Jenny's world becomes increasingly depressed and turns to alcohol to cope.  You can put stickers all over Jenny's detective notebook. There's a lot of actual corpses!

Cute and horrifying as the game can be, however, it's not free of its actual issues.

For one thing, there's only the one save slot- that's always annoying, especially in games with so many choices. Said choices don't appear to be hugely important generally, but I've only played through the one time so I can't say that with confidence. 
Either way, it would be nice to be able to have a few backup save slots, in part because of the other issue, a weird bug in which the journal would record my choices incorrectly, leaving me unsure of whether or not my choice would be correctly rewarded if it were to come up again.

Much more importantly, though, the game ends on a cliffhanger, with a promise of a followup title. The ending is abrupt, and comes immediately after a choice that will leave you feeling cheated.
This might not be an issue except that the game took like. Five years to come out? So I'm a little hesitant to get excited about a sequel that for all I know will take another five. The store page didn't mention the lack of a proper ending, and there's been no communication about how long the sequel will potentially take, which is frustrating.

Despite these problems, I still absolutely recommend Jenny LeClue. It's cute and good, and disappointing mostly in that I wanted more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020870325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1569334242}
review:
I've waited 4 years for this game to come out. I had it on my wishlist the second I saw the first trailer. That the game got delayed a ton had me a bit miffed but damn was it worth it.
"A game that gets delayed is eventually good, a game that is rushed is bad forever." - Someone i guess

The story is even more engaging than I expected from the trailers, gameplay seems a bit simple so far but the story and humor make up for that, I just want to keep going and going and find out what's going on.

The aesthetics are the epitome of beauty. Rarely does a game make me gush over its aesthetics to myself while I'm playing and I find myself regularly just standing still and taking in the scenery. It's simply beautiful.

One thing I'm a bit sad about is that there's no voice acting. I really liked the actor who voiced the author of the book series in the trailer and was hoping the game would feature him and maybe others. But alas, it was not meant to be. But that is only a small bump in the road for this otherwise just wonderfully beautiful and entertaining adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198870815789', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1574261035}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029927145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1569073552}
review:
Ich liebe den Look des Spiels, seit ich es das 1x gesehen habe!

Die Geschichte ist charmant und die Charaktere sind liebenswert. Das Ganze hat etwas von einem interaktiven Jugendbuch, mit dem ich bisher viel Freude habe.

Ich mag die Gimmicks, wie die Sticker, mit denen man sein Notizbuch komplett verzieren kann. Die Notizbucheinträge und Fallauflösungen sind einfach cool. Das alles zu Lokalisieren muss hart gewesen sein. Es funktioniert zu großen Teilen sehr gut.

Wer ein Spiel sucht, bei dem er alles ändern kann, ist hier falsch: es handelt sich um ein klassisches Adventure mit Controllersteuerung und recht wenigen Itemrätseln.

Ich bin jetzt bei 60-75% angekommen und kann nur sagen: super Leistung, liebe Entwickler! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198094616067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1595596789}
review: Wow, great experience! Jenny LeClue really creates an immersive atmosphere. It's the kind of game I'd want to play during a thunderstorm. The visuals are SO cool and unique. The world feels rich, and the large variety of characters add so much personality. There's a nice balance between story and gameplay that puts you in control while also delivering on a narrative that feels well crafted. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020730354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1633479032}
review:
As a Kickstarter backer of this game, I really wanted to love it. It has a lot going for it. The visual style is distinct, and the graphics are very pretty. The music is moderately okay. There's an attempt to make a reasonable framing backstory. 

Unfortunately, none of those could save the experience for me.

The control scheme is horribly designed (genuinely, did ANYONE playtest this, even once?), poorly (and often just plain incorrectly) explained, and inconsistent.

There's no way to save your game. The game autosaves periodically, but there's no manual save function AND no indication of when it autosaves. It will, however, happily inform you of how much gameplay you're going to lose if you quit.

Perhaps worst is that there are giant swaths of the game where you're just watching a cut scene but where the game comes up with irritating ways to attempt to "gameify" it by adding in pointless tasks that don't actually involve any gameplay. "Hold ENTER for 10 seconds, then tap it seven times to continue watching the cutscene." Uh, how about I just play an actually-fun game instead?

And even that could be worth putting up with if it were wrapped in a story that really grabs you from the get-go, but in the first half hour of game play it's still just a very boring and bland story about an author being condemned for writing a very boring and bland story.

I can usually come up with a, "If you like X or Y, you might still enjoy this game," but I can't honestly say who I'd recommend this game to, if anyone. Maybe it's good for young kids who enjoy the art, so long as they're patient with unexplained or misleading controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079260383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1568931751}
review:
You should title this game as Jenny LeClue - Detectivu PART 1.
7 hours of gameplay is filled with repetitive walking, and mini-games.
I liked visual aspect of this game.
but TO BE CONTINUED ending is not what I expected.

아름다운 그래픽과 매 순간순간이 만화적으로 연출된 고퀄리티 탐정 게임입니다
탐정 게임으로서의 요소들이 충실하지만 다른 게임들에서 이미 봤던 기믹들이라는 느낌을 받았습니다.
그리고 무진장 재탕합니다.
플레이타임을 걷기와 단순 퍼즐의 반복으로 늘려놓고
스토리를 이거 어떻게 수습할까 기대될 정도로 벌려놓고
>계속<으로 끝난다는 점은 게임사측에서 미리 고지해야 했다고 생각합니다.
적어도 제목 끝에 PART1이라도 달았으면 비추를 누르지 않았을 것입니다.
후속작이 나와서 스토리가 마무리가 된다면 평가를 수정할 것이지만
제가 이 게임을 몇 년을 기다렸는데 후속작은 얼마나 걸릴지...

author: {'steamid': '76561197984365020', 'num_games_owned': 1610, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1574732245}
review: I have had this game in my wishlist for a very long time. I was excited to see it had come out today. I've played about half an hour and I'm already in love with the story, characters, and gameplay. It is a true detective and investigation game and something I wish there was a lot more of on Steam. Congrats to the developers for sticking through the long development and delivering such a great looking mystery game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155758971', 'num_games_owned': 1478, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1574792593}
review:
Jenny LeClue - Detectivu, gizem - macera türünde bir dedektiflik hikayesini konu alıyor. Görsel sanat tasarımı ve hikaye anlatımıyla öne çıkan oyun etkileyici ve mizahi bir atmosfer yaratmayı başarırken oyuncuyu da hikayenin içine çekebiliyor.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1867318591

Arthur K. Finklestein isimli bir yazarın uzun soluklu romanın baş karakteri olan Jenny LeClue'yu kontrol ettiğimiz oyunda hem Arthur'un romanını yazışına eşlik ederken hem de hikayeye belirli anlarda müdahale edebiliyoruz. Bu müdahaleler her zaman hikayenin akışını etkilemese de eğlenceli diyaloglarla desteklenen bir çeşitlilik sağlıyor. Ayrıca oyunda aldığımız kararlara göre Jenny’nin kişilik analizi değişiklik göstererek bazı özellikleri öne çıkabiliyor. Bunun oyun üzerindeki etkisini çok hissedemediğimden sadece istatistiksel olarak konulmuş olması da mümkün görünüyor bu aşamada.

Hikaye, Jenny ve annesinin yaşadığı sakin ve sıradan bir kasaba olan Arthurton'da geçiyor. Gizemli bir girişten sonra yazarımız Arthur ile tanışıp sonra da asıl hikayemize giriyoruz. Arthurton kasabası oldukça renkli ve kendine has, mizahi karakterlere ev sahipliği yaparken aslında büyük bir gizemi de barındırıyor.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1867419574

Oyunun görsel sanat tasarımı kesinlikle son zamanalarda gördüğüm en etkileyici 2D tasarıma sahip. Özellikle renkler ve ışıklandırmanın uyumuyla ortaya çıkan manzaralar oldukça etkileyici olacaktır bu tarzı sevenler için. Diyaloglar seslendirilmemiş ve bu bir eksiklik hissi veriyor. Oyunun belki de en eksi noktası bu oldu benim için.

Oynanış olarak daha çok kanıt toplama-çıkarım yapma üzerine kurulu olsa da oyun çok zor olmayan bulmacalarla da çeşitlendiriyor içeriği ve hikaye anlatımını animasyon filmi izleme hissinden uzaklaştırıyor. Bazı oyuncular için bu kısım biraz sıkıcı gelebilir gerçekten çünkü bazen çok fazla izliyorsunuz hissini veriyor oyun ve bu da bir eksik sayılabilir oyun akışı için. Oyunun eksikleri, benim görsel ve hikayesel anlatımından aldığım zevki etkilemediği için oyunu gerçekten çok beğendim.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1867339728

Fiyatıyla da oldukça uygun olan oyun ayrıca Türkçe dil desteğine de sahip fakat bu destek biraz yarım olmuş. Özellikle diyaloglarda büyük harfler kullanıldığından Şş,İi gibi karakterler sorunlu ve bir de kelime hataları göze fazla çarpacak kadar mevcut. Hikaye akışını çok rahatsız etmeden takip edebilmeniz için oldukça yeterli olsa da bu tarz şeylere takılan oyuncular için rahatsız edici olabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040528007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1568926912}
review:
Uff. It's kind of heartbreaking writing a bad review for a game that I know the developers fought hard for to make, I mean, game industry and game making isn't an easy task.

But the truth is.. I feel like this game, isn't nearly as amazing as it looks. The art style is beautiful, and the tongue-in-cheek humor and writing is STELLAR. I feel the narrative itself is strong, but the game feels like it drags on after a while and the game becomes painfully long and starts to lag, because the gameplay isn't there (and I believe that's by design), but that lack of gameplay becomes it's fatal flaw, as the game then starts to drag out unneccessairly.

The puzzles are repetitive, and few to begin with. The movement is very restricted, with very little to explore.

I feel that when someone heads out to make a game about a mystery, there should be an ACTUAL mystery, instead, this just feels like a story being played out in-front of you, which is all good, but I feel that it would have been an amazing animation movie rather than a "game".

I guess it's still an "interactive experience", but I feel that said experience is far from perfect, and the game's only saving grace is its writing and humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121368770', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1569168794}
review:
Отличная локализация, красивый литературный язык. Полагаю, что история будет довольно объёмной, на несколько вечеров. 
И похоже это тот случай, когда долгие годы разработки полностью оправдали себя.
Не стыдно затарить за фулпрайс.

UPD - прошлась за один вечер и два дня, оставила за собой вероятность продолжения (без спойлеров)! Но при таких темпах разработки и отсутствии интереса со стороны прессы, боюсь, что можно будет забыть.
Хочу заметить, что небольшим коллективом по факту проделан труд, который порой не под силу целым подразделения корпоративных студий. Дизайн и графика локаций на твердый высокий балл, все диалоги выдержаны в стилистике, головоломки легкие и антуражные, сделаны исключительно для умножения атмосферы детективного повествования.
Есть пару затянутых моментов, но совокупно они на впечатление не влияют.
